('77', 0, 1, 2, 47) 1. LETTER TO INDIRA NEHRU
('77', 0, 2, 3, 73) [After October 15, 1939] 1
('77', 0, 3, 4, 100) INDU, You must have now lost the habit of writing Hindi.
('77', 0, 3, 5, 157) But I must write, mustn’t I, in the rashtrabhasha ?
('77', 0, 3, 6, 209) Have you gone there for studies or for falling ill?
('77', 0, 3, 7, 261) How did you contract pleurisy?
('77', 0, 3, 8, 292) I have suffered the pangs of pleurisy.
('77', 0, 3, 9, 331) May God restore you soon to health.
('77', 0, 4, 10, 367) Blessings from BAPU
('77', 0, 5, 11, 387) From a photostat of the Hindi: C. W. 9805. Courtesy: Nehru Memorial Museum and Library
('77', 0, 6, 12, 474) 2. NOTES
('77', 0, 7, 13, 483) A POSER A Britisher has written to Deenabandhu Andrews a letter on the war expounding his own views.
('77', 0, 7, 14, 584) He is an ardent pacifist.
('77', 0, 7, 15, 610) Deenabandhu has shared the letter with me.
('77', 0, 7, 16, 653) In it occur the following paragraphs:
('77', 0, 8, 17, 691) For India too I think that this is a very critical time.
('77', 0, 8, 18, 748) The danger I see is that Britain may promise full Dominion Status or something of the kind, and as a result India will raise an army and become one more military minded nation.
('77', 0, 8, 19, 925) Her witness for the way of non violence and soul force would then be largely discounted.
('77', 0, 9, 20, 1014) How can Gandhiji as a believer in non violence ask for clarification of war aims with a view to getting India’s support for Britain in this way of war?
('77', 0, 9, 21, 1166) The only thing that he can do and that we should all be doing is to build up an army of men and women who are committed to the way of love and forgiveness and to receive but never to return violence.
('77', 0, 9, 22, 1366) We have to work this out to see how it will alter our daily life as well as all our thinking and acting towards other communities and nations.
('77', 0, 9, 23, 1509) We have to be disciplined in this and also to
('77', 0, 10, 24, 1555) 1 In her book, With No Regrets, Krishna Hutheesing explains that the addressee went hiking during the autumn of 1939, got soaked and caught a chill which developed into pleurisy.
('77', 0, 10, 25, 1734) In a letter dated November 6, 1939, Jawaharlal Nehru had written to the addressee that he had a joint cable “from Agatha and Bhandari that you are going to Europe”.
('77', 0, 10, 26, 1899) She went to Leysin (in Switzerland) after having spent some time in Middlesex Hospital.

('77', 1, 0, 1, 2062) 2 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 1, 1, 2, 2102) learn to act together as one man.
('77', 1, 1, 3, 2136) Along this line I see tremendous possibilities.
('77', 1, 2, 4, 2184) Of course we should also use all the influence we can to urge Britain to acknowledge and put into practice full democracy in India as it is a high principle quite apart from whether India helps Britain in the war or not.
('77', 1, 2, 5, 2405) The danger that the writer senses is real.
('77', 1, 2, 6, 2448) I dealt with it last week.
('77', 1, 3, 7, 2475) The writer cavils at my sympathy with the Allies.
('77', 1, 3, 8, 2525) I have shown it as an out and out believer in non violence, even because of my belief.
('77', 1, 3, 9, 2612) Whilst all violence is bad and must be condemned in the abstract, it is permissible for, it is even the duty of, a believer in ahimsa to distinguish between the aggressor and the defender.
('77', 1, 3, 10, 2801) Having done so, he will side with the defender in a non violent manner, i.e., give his life in saving him.
('77', 1, 3, 11, 2908) His intervention is likely to bring a speedier end to the duel and may even result in bringing about peace between the combatants.
('77', 1, 3, 12, 3039) Applying the argument to the present war, if the Congress actively sides with the Allies in a non violent way, the Congress assistance will lift the Allied cause to a high moral plane and the Congress influence will be effectively used in the cause of peace.
('77', 1, 3, 13, 3298) What is more it will be the special business of the Congress to see that, if the war is fought to a finish, no humiliation is heaped upon the vanquished.
('77', 1, 3, 14, 3452) That is the role I have conceived for the Congress.
('77', 1, 3, 15, 3504) The declaration of independence has become a necessity.
('77', 1, 3, 16, 3560) The question having been raised, the Congress cannot help Britain if Britain is secretly fighting for imperialism while it declares to the world that the fight is for saving democracies.
('77', 1, 3, 17, 3747) For Britain to be in the right a clear declaration of her war aim is a necessity, irrespective of the Congress policy.
('77', 1, 3, 18, 3866) SEGAON, October 16, 1939 Harijan, 21 10 1939
('77', 1, 4, 19, 3911) 3. THE FICTION OF MAJORITY
('77', 1, 5, 20, 3938) It is painful to find the British Press and Britishers advancing the minority claim to prevent the declaration suggested 2 by the Congress, if I may say so, in the common interest.
('77', 1, 5, 21, 4119) If the force of the Congress suggestion has not been overwhelmingly felt, the declaration will not
('77', 1, 6, 22, 4218) 1 Vide “On Trial”, 10 10 1939. 2 Vide Appendices “Working Committee’s Manifesto”, 14 9 1939 and “A.I.C.C. Resolution”, 14 10 1939.
('77', 2, 0, 1, 4349) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 3
('77', 2, 1, 2, 4396) There need be no dejection among Congressmen if it does not.
('77', 2, 1, 3, 4457) We shall get our independence when it is deserved.
('77', 2, 1, 4, 4508) But it would be well for the British Government and the Allied cause, if the minority argument were not flung in the face of a credulous world.
('77', 2, 1, 5, 4652) It would be honest to say that the British desire to hold India yet awhile.
('77', 2, 1, 6, 4728) There will be nothing wrong in such a desire.
('77', 2, 1, 7, 4774) India is a conquest.
('77', 2, 1, 8, 4795) Conquests are not surrendered except when the conquered successfully rebel, or under an awakened conscience the conqueror repents of the conquest, or when the conquered territory ceases to be a profitable concern.
('77', 2, 1, 9, 5009) I had hoped and still hope that the British, having become war weary and sickened over the mad slaughter involved in the present war, would want to close it at the earliest possible moment by being above board in every respect and therefore in respect of India.
('77', 2, 1, 10, 5271) This they can never be, so long as they hold India in bondage.
('77', 2, 1, 11, 5334) I know that many have been angry with me for claiming an exclusive right for the Congress to speak for the people of India as a whole.
('77', 2, 1, 12, 5469) It is not an arrogant pretension.
('77', 2, 1, 13, 5503) It is explicit in the first article of the Congress.
('77', 2, 1, 14, 5556) It wants and works for independence for the whole of India.
('77', 2, 1, 15, 5616) It speaks neither for majority nor minority.
('77', 2, 1, 16, 5661) It seeks to represent all Indians without any distinction.
('77', 2, 1, 17, 5720) Therefore those who oppose it should not count, if the claim for independence is admitted.
('77', 2, 1, 18, 5811) Those who support the claim simply give added strength to the Congress claim.
('77', 2, 1, 19, 5889) Britain has hitherto held India by producing before the world Indians who want Britain to remain in India as ruler and arbiter between rival claimants.
('77', 2, 1, 20, 6041) These will always exist.
('77', 2, 1, 21, 6066) The question is whether it is right for Britain to plead these rivalries in defence of holding India under subjection or whether she should now recognize the mistake and leave India to decide upon the method of her own government.
('77', 2, 1, 22, 6297) And who are the minorities?
('77', 2, 1, 23, 6325) They are religious, political and social: thus Mussalmans (religious), Depressed Classes (social), Liberals (political), Princes (social), Brahmins (social), non Brahmins (social), Lingayats (social), Sikhs (social?), Christians—Protestants and Catholics (religious), Jains (Social?), Zamindars (political?).
('77', 2, 1, 24, 6634) I have a letter from the Secretary of the All India Shia Conference registering their claim for separate existence.
('77', 2, 1, 25, 6750) Who are the majority in this medley?
('77', 2, 1, 26, 6787) Unfortunately for unhappy India even Muslims are somewhat divided and so are the Christians.
('77', 2, 1, 27, 6880) It is the policy of the
('77', 3, 0, 1, 6904) 4 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 3, 1, 2, 6944) British Government to recognize every group that becomes sufficiently vocal and troublesome.
('77', 3, 1, 3, 7037) I have drawn no fanciful picture of the minorities.
('77', 3, 1, 4, 7089) It is true to life.
('77', 3, 1, 5, 7109) The Congress itself has been obliged to deal with every one of the groups I have mentioned.
('77', 3, 1, 6, 7201) My list is not exhaustive.
('77', 3, 1, 7, 7228) It is illustrative.
('77', 3, 1, 8, 7248) It can be increased ad libitum.
('77', 3, 1, 9, 7280) I know that the fashion is to talk of the Hindus forming the majority community.
('77', 3, 1, 10, 7361) But Hinduism is an elastic, indefinable term, and Hindus are not a homogeneous whole like Muslims and Christians.
('77', 3, 1, 11, 7475) And when one analyses the majority in any provincial legislature it will be found to consist of a combination of the so called minorities.
('77', 3, 1, 12, 7614) In other words and in reality so far as India is concerned, there can only be political parties and no majority or minority communities.
('77', 3, 1, 13, 7751) The cry of the tyranny of the majority is a fictitious cry.
('77', 3, 1, 14, 7811) I observe that Janab Jinnah Saheb has said, in reply 1 to Rajen Babu’s letter 2 offering to refer the League’s grievances against the Congress Governments to an arbitration tribunal, that he has
('77', 3, 2, 15, 8006) already placed the whole case before the Viceroy and Governor General and requested him to take up the matter without delay as he and the Governors of the Provinces have been expressly authorised under the Constitution and entrusted with the responsibility to protect the rights and the interests of the minorities.
('77', 3, 3, 16, 8322) The matter is now under His Excellency’s consideration, and he is the proper authority to take such action and adopt such measures as would meet our requirements and would restore complete sense of security and satisfaction amongst the Mussalmans in those Provinces where the Congress Ministries are in charge of the administration.
('77', 3, 3, 17, 8655) It is unfortunate that he had rejected Rajendra Babu’s reasonable proposal.
('77', 3, 3, 18, 8731) Is it rejection of the proffered hand of friendship?
('77', 3, 3, 19, 8784) Be that as it may, nobody can have anything to say against the Viceroy investigating and adjudicating upon the charges brought against Congress Ministries.
('77', 3, 3, 20, 8940) Let us hope he will soon conduct the investigation.
('77', 3, 3, 21, 8992) Whether the Muslims are regarded as minorities or otherwise, their as well as any other community’s rights and privileges, religious, social, cultural and political, must be regarded as a sacred trust to be jealously guarded.
('77', 3, 3, 22, 9218) And the independence of India will make no difference to the protection of those rights.
('77', 3, 3, 23, 9307) In fact they will
('77', 3, 4, 24, 9325) 1 Dated October 6, 1939 2 Dated October 5, 1939
('77', 4, 0, 1, 9373) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 5
('77', 4, 1, 2, 9420) be better protected in every way, if only because in the framing of the Charter of Independence by the nation’s representatives the Muslims and other minorities, real or so called, will have an effective voice.
('77', 4, 1, 3, 9631) Consider for one moment what can happen if the English were to withdraw all of a sudden and there was no foreign usurper to rule.
('77', 4, 1, 4, 9761) It may be said that the Punjabis, be they Muslims, Sikhs or others, will overrun India.
('77', 4, 1, 5, 9849) It is highly likely that the Gurkhas will throw in their lot with the Punjabis.
('77', 4, 1, 6, 9929) Assume further that non Punjabi Muslims will make common cause with the Punjabis.
('77', 4, 1, 7, 10011) Where will the Congressmen composed chiefly of Hindus be?
('77', 4, 1, 8, 10069) If they are still truly non violent, they will be left unmolested by the warriors.
('77', 4, 1, 9, 10152) Congressmen won’t want to divide power with the warriors but will refuse to let them exploit their unarmed countrymen.
('77', 4, 1, 10, 10271) Thus if anybody has cause to keep the British rule for protection from the stronger element, it is the Congressmen and those Hindus and others who are represented by the Congress.
('77', 4, 1, 11, 10451) The question, therefore, resolves itself into not who is numerically superior but who is stronger.
('77', 4, 1, 12, 10550) Surely there is only one answer.
('77', 4, 1, 13, 10583) Those who raise the cry of minority in danger have nothing to fear from the so called majority which is merely a paper majority and which in any event is ineffective because it is weak in the military sense.
('77', 4, 1, 14, 10791) Paradoxical as it may appear, it is literally true that the so called minorities’ fear has some bottom only so long as the weak majority has the backing of the British bayonets to enable it to play at democr acy.
('77', 4, 1, 15, 11004) But the British power will, so long as it so chooses, successfully play one against the other calling the parties by whatever names it pleases.
('77', 4, 1, 16, 11148) And this process need not be dishonest.
('77', 4, 1, 17, 11188) They may honestly believe that so long as there are rival claims put up, they must remain in India in response to a call from God to hold the balance evenly between them.
('77', 4, 1, 18, 11359) Only that way lies not Democracy but Fascism, Nazism, Bolshevism and Imperialism, all facets of the doctrine of ‘Might is Right.’ I would fain hope that this war will change values.
('77', 4, 1, 19, 11541) It can only do so, if India is recognized as independent and if that India represents unadulterated non violence on the political field.
('77', 4, 1, 20, 11678) SEGAON, October 16, 1939 Harijan, 21 10 1939
('77', 5, 0, 1, 11723) 6 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 5, 1, 2, 11763) 4. FAMINE WORK IN MORVI
('77', 5, 2, 3, 11787) Referring to Rajkumari Amrit Kaur’s visit to Morvi during the Rentia Jayanti celebrations, the Dewan writes as follows: 1
('77', 5, 3, 4, 11909) His Highness the Maharaja Saheb has been giving for some years Rs. 10,000 every year during the Gandhi Jayanti for the benefit of the Harijans and khadi.
('77', 5, 3, 5, 12063) Sometimes the amount is sent to you as was done last year, and many times the amount is spent in Morvi for Harijans and for the encouragement of khadi..
('77', 5, 4, 6, 12216) This year we are hard hit by famine.
('77', 5, 4, 7, 12253) We have organized relief measures on an extensive scale..
('77', 5, 4, 8, 12311) Cheap grain and grass depots are opened throughout the State where food and fodder are distributed on cash and credit..
('77', 5, 4, 9, 12431) Agriculturists are given food and fodder on credit..
('77', 5, 4, 10, 12484) are helped to grow fodder crops by giving loans for seeds.
('77', 5, 5, 11, 12543) Every available source of water is used for irrigation by setting up small pumping plants.
('77', 5, 6, 12, 12634) You will be glad to learn that one of the activities of famine relief is to produce khadi.
('77', 5, 6, 13, 12725) The Famine Department purchases raw cotton, and all operations from carding to weaving are paid for at reasonable rates.
('77', 5, 6, 14, 12846) The State takes all the khadi that is being produced.
('77', 5, 6, 15, 12900) It is hoped that this will give the much required employment to a large section of the people—most of them Harijans—at their doors.
('77', 5, 7, 16, 13032) This year His Highness has decided to distribute khadi worth Rs. 1,000 to the needy, and owing to scarcity conditions many will need free help of clothing.
('77', 5, 7, 17, 13188) This will be his usual donation on Gandhi Jayanti..
('77', 5, 8, 18, 13240) Bhangis and Meghwars would not use the common tank for taking their water and the State had closed it till their differences were composed.
('77', 5, 8, 19, 13380) During the period of the existing stress they have made up their differences and now they use the common tank.
('77', 5, 9, 20, 13491) During the year the State has provided two measures for the benefit of the lower ranks of State service which include Harijans—one is to give them loans without interest, and the other is to give female servants the benefit of one month’s maternity leave on full pay.
('77', 5, 9, 21, 13759) Seeing that generally it falls to my lot to criticize the States, it is a pleasure to be able to record the good work done in Morvi in connection with famine.
('77', 5, 9, 22, 13918) I congratulate the Maharaja Saheb on the
('77', 5, 10, 23, 13959) 1 Only excerpts are reproduced here.
('77', 6, 0, 1, 13996) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 7
('77', 6, 1, 2, 14043) effort that is being put forth to alleviate distress.
('77', 6, 1, 3, 14097) As to khadi I would like to suggest that if it is to become a permanent insurance against famine, the Maharaja Saheb and the people of Morvi have to use khadi for their personal and domestic use.
('77', 6, 1, 4, 14293) Morvi grows good cotton enough for its requirements.
('77', 6, 1, 5, 14346) Its people can produce all the khadi they need.
('77', 6, 1, 6, 14394) Those who are too poor to pay the higher price at which khadi must be sold if it is to give an adequate wage to the spinners, should become spinners themselves.
('77', 6, 1, 7, 14555) Shri Narandas Gandhi’s yearly experiments have shown progressively the immense possibilities in this direction.
('77', 6, 1, 8, 14667) But these latent virtues of khadi cannot be brought out so long as the Maharaja Saheb and the people of Morvi remain distant patrons instead of becoming lovers and wearers themselves of khadi.
('77', 6, 1, 9, 14860) It is suicidal economy to buy cheap mill cloth even though the people can easily produce enough khadi in their own homes without much extra effort or outlay of capital.
('77', 6, 1, 10, 15029) SEGAON, October 16, 1939 Harijan, 21 10 1939
('77', 6, 2, 11, 15074) 5. BAPA JAYANTI
('77', 6, 3, 12, 15090) Thakkar Bapa, the father of Harijans and all those who are almost like them and classified as semi civilized races, animists and what not, completes his seventy years on 29th November next.
('77', 6, 3, 13, 15280) The inmates of Harijan Nivas in Delhi have planned to celebrate the event in a manner that must delight Thakkar Bapa’s heart.
('77', 6, 3, 14, 15406) They want to collect the modest sum of Rs. 7,000 to be presented to Thakkar Bapa on his birhtday for the Harijan cause.
('77', 6, 3, 15, 15526) They want me to bless and advertise the effort.
('77', 6, 3, 16, 15574) I have written to them accusing them of little faith.
('77', 6, 3, 17, 15628) Thakkar Bapa is a rare worker.
('77', 6, 3, 18, 15659) He is unassuming.
('77', 6, 3, 19, 15677) He wants no praise.
('77', 6, 3, 20, 15697) His work is his sole satisfaction and recreation.
('77', 6, 3, 21, 15747) Old age has not slackened his zeal.
('77', 6, 3, 22, 15783) He is himself an institution.
('77', 6, 3, 23, 15813) I once suggested that he might take a little rest.
('77', 6, 3, 24, 15864) Immediately came the answer, ‘How can I rest when there is so much to do?
('77', 6, 3, 25, 15938) My work must be my rest.’ He puts to shame every young man around him in the energy he expends upon his life mission.
('77', 6, 3, 26, 16056) A purse of Rs. 7,000 is an insult to the cause and to him who carries on his broad shoulders its heavy burden.
('77', 6, 3, 27, 16167) The workers must aim at collecting nothing less than Rs. 70,000 from all India.
('77', 6, 3, 28, 16247) Even that amount is nothing for the cause and its father.
('77', 6, 3, 29, 16305) But it is a respectable enough sum to be collected inside a month.
('77', 6, 3, 30, 16372) How I wish it was possible to collect coppers from Harijans and Bhils.
('77', 7, 0, 1, 16443) 8 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 7, 1, 2, 16483) know him.
('77', 7, 1, 3, 16493) But the monied and middle class men too know Bapa and love him.
('77', 7, 1, 4, 16557) I have no doubt that they will subscribe liberally to the fund both for the cause and for the geat sevak who represents it.
('77', 7, 1, 5, 16681) Subscriptions may be sent to (1) Harijan Nivas, Kingsway, Delhi, (2) Harijan Ashram, Sabarmati, or (3) Segaon via Wardha.

('77', 8, 10, 21, 18620) 10. NOTES
('77', 8, 11, 22, 18630) HINDU MUSLIM CLASHES If proof were wanted to show that the non violence of the Congress was in effect violence in suspension or inactive violence, it is furnished by the effective though quite indisciplined violence exhibited in Hindu Muslim clashes.
('77', 8, 11, 23, 18881) Had the thousands of Hindus and Muslims who took part in the Khilafat agitation been non violent at
('77', 8, 12, 24, 18981) 1 The addressee’s article “Rentia Jayanti in Rajkot” appeared in Harijanbandhu, 22 10 1939. 2 Vide “Notes”, 12 7 1939. 3 From the reference to “article”, presumably, “The Fiction of Majority”, pp.
('77', 8, 12, 25, 19178) 258 61.
('77', 9, 0, 1, 19186) 10 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 9, 1, 2, 19227) heart, they could never have been violent towards one another as they are continually found to be.
('77', 9, 1, 3, 19326) Nor can it be said that those who take part in the clashes are not Congressmen.
('77', 9, 1, 4, 19406) If we rule out all those who resort to violence as non Congressmen, the Congress will cease to be a mass organization.
('77', 9, 1, 5, 19525) For the combatants in these clashes are derived from the masses.
('77', 9, 1, 6, 19590) More over one finds today violence resorted to by rival Congressmen at Congress meetings.
('77', 9, 1, 7, 19680) The gross indiscipline and fraud practised at Congress elections are all illustrations of Congress violence.
('77', 9, 1, 8, 19789) It is difficult to say, therefore, who, if any, are non violent Congressmen.
('77', 9, 1, 9, 19866) If they were in a majority in the Congress and if they played an effective part in Hindu Muslim clashes, they could stop them or at least give their lives in stopping them.
('77', 9, 1, 10, 20039) If the bulk of Congressmen were truly non violent, Muslims would be obliged to confess that Congressmen could not be accused of anti Muslim bias.
('77', 9, 1, 11, 20185) It is not enough for Congressmen to say that they have not been found guilty of incorrect attitude.
('77', 9, 1, 12, 20285) I may be proved to be legally correct but may fail miserably if my action was examined in non violent scales.
('77', 9, 1, 13, 20395) But this non violence has to be non violence of the brave and the strong.
('77', 9, 1, 14, 20469) It must come from inward conviction.
('77', 9, 1, 15, 20506) I have, therefore, not hesitated to say that it is better to be violent if there is violence in our breasts than to put on the cloak of non violence to cover impotence.
('77', 9, 1, 16, 20675) Violence is any day preferable to impotence.
('77', 9, 1, 17, 20720) There is hope for a violent man to become non violent.
('77', 9, 1, 18, 20775) There is no such hope for the impotent.
('77', 9, 2, 19, 20815) NOT TOO LATE Rashtrapati Rajen Babu, Acharya Kirpalani, Shri Shankarrao Dev, Dr. Prafulla Chandra Ghosh and Shri Jairamdas had remained behind for two or three days after the meeting of the A. I. C. C. All of these except Rajen Babu gently complained that I had wronged them by saying that the whole of the Working Committee was against me in the interpretation I had put upon their action in terms of non violence.
('77', 9, 2, 20, 21231) They said that they had hitherto given team work.
('77', 9, 2, 21, 21281) They had always followed Rajen Babu and the Sardar at the meetings of the Working Committee.
('77', 9, 2, 22, 21374) It must be said for them that they had whispered in my ears that they were with me in the interpretation I had put on non violence.
('77', 9, 2, 23, 21506) I had remonstrated that that was not enough.
('77', 9, 2, 24, 21551) They had boldly to assert themselves at this critical juncture.
('77', 9, 2, 25, 21615) But their humility would not allow them to do so.
('77', 9, 2, 26, 21665) But even their vote, if they had cast it in favour of my interpr 
('77', 10, 0, 1, 21731) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 11
('77', 10, 1, 2, 21779) etation, would have been in their individual and not representative capacity.
('77', 10, 1, 3, 21857) As I have made clear in my note on Hindu Muslim clashes, it is not possible to claim non violence for the Congress masses.
('77', 10, 1, 4, 21980) Those Congressmen who believe in non violence as a creed, to be enforced as much in Hindu Muslim quarrels as in defending India, have to begin with the alphabet of non violence and find out how many Congressmen are with them.
('77', 10, 1, 5, 22206) It is highly probable that they will have to retire from the Congress and, like me, serve and convert the Congress from without.
('77', 10, 1, 6, 22335) The new road is straight enough but difficult to negotiate.
('77', 10, 1, 7, 22395) It is overlaid with the bones of lonely seekers.
('77', 10, 1, 8, 22444) They died without finding the way, but they had the inward satisfaction of having lived and died for their faith.
('77', 10, 1, 9, 22558) When I wrote 1 on the formation of peace brigade I had adumbrated a programme for them.
('77', 10, 1, 10, 22646) The brigades died as soon as they were born but the programme abides.
('77', 10, 1, 11, 22716) It is a programme of courting death in preventing Hindu Muslim clashes and the like.
('77', 10, 1, 12, 22801) It is a programme of dying to prevent violence.
('77', 10, 1, 13, 22849) Such death, however, will count as criminal suicide if the suicide has not a heart free from impurity and malice.

('77', 11, 1, 2, 23484) 12. STATEMENT TO THE PRESS 1
('77', 11, 2, 3, 23513) The Viceregal declaration 2 is profoundly disappointing.
('77', 11, 2, 4, 23570) It would have been better if the British Government had declined to make any declaration whatsoever.
('77', 11, 2, 5, 23671) The long statement made by the Viceroy simply shows that the old policy of divide and rule is to continue.
('77', 11, 2, 6, 23778) So far as I can see the Congress will be no party to it, nor can the India of Congress conception be a partner with Britain in her war with Herr Hitler.
('77', 11, 2, 7, 23931) The Indian declaration 3 shows clearly that there is to be no democracy for India if Britain can prevent it.
('77', 11, 2, 8, 24040) Another Round Table Conference is promised at the end of the war.
('77', 11, 2, 9, 24106) Like its predecessor it is bound to fail.
('77', 11, 2, 10, 24148) The Congress asked for bread and it has got a stone.
('77', 11, 2, 11, 24201) What the future has in store for India I dare not foretell.
('77', 11, 2, 12, 24261) I do not blame the Viceroy or the leaders of Britain for the unfortunate result.
('77', 11, 2, 13, 24342) The Congress will have to go into the wilderness again before it becomes strong and pure enough to reach its objectives.
('77', 11, 2, 14, 24463) I have no doubt that Congressmen will await the Working Committee’s decision 4.

('77', 17, 2, 3, 30792) I am glad that you have asked me this question.
('77', 17, 2, 4, 30840) I had better answer it by saying that the present system of primary education was devised without any thought of the economic advancement of the country.
('77', 17, 2, 5, 30994) The State gets no return whatsoever for the money it is spending on primary education.
('77', 17, 2, 6, 31081) That we get a few administrators like Shuklaji 3 as products of the so called higher education is no justi fication for the waste on primary education.
('77', 17, 2, 7, 31233) It only brings into painful relief the pathetic superstition that we cannot carry on the affairs of India except through men with English degrees or possessing a knowledge of English.
('77', 17, 2, 8, 31417) Directors of Public Instruction have admitted that the present system of primary education is a colossal waste, that a very small percentage of the pupils reach the higher classes, that there is nothing like permanency in the literacy imparted and that, even as it is, it touches but a small fraction of the vast rural areas.
('77', 17, 2, 9, 31743) What a small fraction of the C.P. villages, for instance, have even these primary schools?
('77', 17, 2, 10, 31834) And the few schools that there are in the villages bring no kind of return to them.
('77', 17, 2, 11, 31918) The question that you have asked me, therefore, really does not arise.
('77', 17, 2, 12, 31989) But the new scheme is claimed to be based on sound economics, for all education will be through the medium of a craft.
('77', 17, 2, 13, 32108) It is not education plus training in a craft, but it is all education by means of a craft.
('77', 17, 2, 14, 32199) Therefore a boy who receives education, say, through weaving, will surely and must be better than a weaver as a mere craftsman.
('77', 17, 2, 15, 32327) And nobody can say that a weaver is an economic waste.
('77', 17, 2, 16, 32382) This weaver will know the various tools and the technique of all the processes and will produce better results than a weaver craftsman.

('77', 18, 1, 2, 33276) Ashadevi 1. They have gone far beyond our expectations.

('77', 18, 1, 4, 33382) When I used the word ‘self supporting’ I did not mean that all the capital expenditure would be defrayed from it, but that at least the salary of the teacher would be found out of the proceeds of the articles made by the pupils.
('77', 18, 1, 5, 33611) The economic aspect of the basic system of education is thus self evident.
('77', 18, 1, 6, 33686) Then there is another aspect, viz., that of the national awakening.
('77', 18, 1, 7, 33754) I wonder if you have read the Kumarappa Committee’s report 2 on rural industries.
('77', 18, 1, 8, 33836) The traditional figure of the average income per capita is Rs. 70, but he has proved that the per capita income in the C.P. villages does not exceed Rs. 12 to Rs. 14 per year.
('77', 18, 1, 9, 34012) Spinning and other village industries for basic education have been so selected that they answer village wants.
('77', 18, 1, 10, 34124) Therefore the boys who receive their education through village crafts must spread their knowledge in their homes.
('77', 18, 1, 11, 34238) Now you will see that the average income of the villager can be easily doubled by the village crafts being revived.
('77', 18, 1, 12, 34354) Most of the bickerings in the district boards will also cease if you will become servants of the people and interest yourselves actively in the new system.
('77', 18, 1, 13, 34510) As I was coming to the meeting I had a letter from a school where the children had earned out of a four hours’ spinning for 30 days Rs. 75 odd.
('77', 18, 1, 14, 34654) If 30 children earned Rs. 75 in a month, you can easily work out how much would be the earning of crores of primary school children in India.
('77', 18, 1, 15, 34796) And imagine the result of the self confidence and resour cefulness fostered among these children, as also of the consciousness that they are adding to the income of the land and solving the problem of unequal distribution.
('77', 18, 1, 16, 35019) This would lead to an automatic political awakening.
('77', 18, 1, 17, 35072) I would expect the children to know everything about the local affairs, about our corruption and how it can be ended.
('77', 18, 1, 18, 35190) This kind of political education I would wish every one of our children to have.
('77', 18, 1, 19, 35271) That would surely add a cubit to their stature.

('77', 23, 3, 6, 43802) 32. INTERVIEW TO “THE TIMES OF INDIA” 2
('77', 23, 4, 7, 43842) SEGAON, [October 20, 1939] 3
('77', 23, 5, 8, 43871) Requested to give a reply to The times of India’s editorial appeal addressed to him, Mr. Gandhi told me in a special interview that no amount of clarification or explanation of the Viceregal statement 4 would make it acceptable so long as the precise demand of the Congress was not met.
('77', 23, 5, 9, 44158) There was no evidence of a desire or readiness on the part of Great Britain to transfer power to Indians.
('77', 23, 6, 10, 44264) The Times of India’s appeal related to the scope, authority and function of the conference of India’s representatives, proposed to be called at the end of the war.
('77', 23, 7, 11, 44428) The journal drew attention to the following words from the Viceroy’s statement:
('77', 23, 8, 12, 44508) His Majesty’s Government recognize that when the time comes to resume consideration of the plan for the future Federal Government of India, and of the plan destined to give effect to the assurances given in Parliament by the late Secretary of State 5 to which I have just referred, it will be necessary to reconsider in the light of the then circumstances to what extent the details of the plan embodied in the Act of 1935 remained appropriate.
('77', 23, 9, 13, 44953) The Times of India interpreted these words to mean that it would be open to the projected conference at the end of the war to consider Dominion Status.
('77', 23, 9, 14, 45105) It requested Mr. Gandhi and the Congress to appreciate the value of such a conference and, if they had any doubt, to ask for an authoritative clarification of the scope of that conference.
('77', 23, 10, 15, 45294) The words quoted by The Times of India, thought Mr. Gandhi, were “too vague to admit of clarification; they left everything beautifully indefinite.” He added: What the Congress wants is the clearest possible acceptance
('77', 23, 11, 16, 45513) 1 In Delhi 2 This appeared under the title “An Important Interview” as reproduced from The Times of India, 21 10 1939. 3 From Gandhi—1915 1948: A Detailed Chronology 4 Of October 17; vide Appendix “Viceroy’s Declaration”, 17 10 1939. 5 Sir Samuel Hoare
('77', 24, 0, 1, 45766) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 25
('77', 24, 1, 2, 45814) of the fact that India is to be treated as an independent nation.
('77', 24, 1, 3, 45880) For India to become enthusiastic about participation in this war it is necessary to speak to her in the language of precision, admitting of no other meaning.
('77', 24, 1, 4, 46038) Surely what the Congress wants is easy enough to give, if the will is there.
('77', 24, 1, 5, 46115) I miss the will in the Viceregal declaration.
('77', 24, 1, 6, 46161) And whom is the conference to consist of?
('77', 24, 1, 7, 46203) Are they to be those to be invited by the Viceroy or the Secretary of State?
('77', 24, 1, 8, 46280) How can they be called representative in the true sense of the term ?
('77', 24, 1, 9, 46350) In order to avoid any doubt, the Congress had suggested a representative assembly of men and women elected on the widest possible franchise.
('77', 24, 1, 10, 46491) Such an assembly the Congress described by the accepted phraseology, namely, a constituent assembly.
('77', 24, 1, 11, 46592) How can this be objected to by any party which desires freedom for India?
('77', 24, 1, 12, 46666) Is it right to invite people to say whether they want freedom or not?
('77', 24, 1, 13, 46736) Should a slave be consulted as to the desirability of his freedom?
('77', 24, 1, 14, 46803) He might be asked as to the manner thereof.
('77', 24, 1, 15, 46847) This the constituent assembly can do.

('77', 24, 1, 17, 46964) It may be more or less.
('77', 24, 1, 18, 46988) The people’s representatives should have the fullest freedom to decide upon the nature and content of the freedom.
('77', 24, 1, 19, 47103) It is surprising how the minorities are being played against the Congress.
('77', 24, 1, 20, 47178) Surely the Congress has no quarrel with any of them.
('77', 24, 1, 21, 47231) The Congress will safeguard the rights of every minority so long as they do not advance claims inconsistent with India’s independence.
('77', 24, 1, 22, 47366) The Muslims, the Scheduled Classes and every other class will be fully represented in the constituent assembly and they will have to decide their own special rights.
('77', 24, 1, 23, 47532) Even the Princes and the zamindars have nothing to fear if they become, and appear, as representatives of the ryots.
('77', 24, 1, 24, 47649) Independent India will not tolerate any interests in conflict with the true interests of the masses, whether the latter are known as Muslims, Scheduled Classes, Christians, Parsis, Jews, Sikhs, Brahmins and non Brahmins, or any other.
('77', 24, 1, 25, 47884) But I blame neither the Viceroy not the British War Cabinet.
('77', 24, 1, 26, 47945) Independence is not to depend upon the British or anyone else’s mercy.
('77', 24, 1, 27, 48016) It will come when the people are ready for it.
('77', 24, 1, 28, 48063) Evidently British statesmen think that the people of India are not ready.
('77', 24, 1, 29, 48137) The Congress or any other organization that seeks to represent the millions has to consolidate its strength and resources for the purpose.
('77', 25, 0, 1, 48276) 26 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 25, 1, 2, 48317) Mr. Gandhi said he had hoped that British statesmen, from the bitter experience of European turmoil, had turned over a new leaf; that hope was for the time being dashed to pieces.
('77', 25, 2, 3, 48497) Mr. Gandhi, proceeding, remarked that The Times of India should direct its appeal to the Englishmen and ask them to do the right thing by India in keeping with the professed war aims of Britain.
('77', 25, 2, 4, 48692) He said he was grieved to find that the paper which had till the other day been urging the authorities to make a generous gesture “had suddenly changed its front”.
('77', 25, 2, 5, 48856) Judged by the paper’s own past demands, the Viceroy’s statement was a poor response.
('77', 25, 2, 6, 48941) Yet The Times of India praised it.
('77', 25, 3, 7, 48976) Mr. Gandhi concluded with the reply to the personal reference made to him in The Times of India editorial.
('77', 25, 3, 8, 49083) He denied that he had been inconsistent or that he had deviated from his first statements 1 in which he had expressed his sympathy for England and France.
('77', 25, 3, 9, 49238) He said he still held the view.
('77', 25, 3, 10, 49270) But now that the issue has been raised, he expected England to face the issue and give a satisfactory answer.
('77', 25, 4, 11, 49380) His advice to the Congress did not mean that India’s support to the Allied cause should be at the expense of her own freedom.
('77', 25, 4, 12, 49506) He would not be a party to India being tied to the chariot wheel of Britain.
('77', 25, 4, 13, 49583) His prayer still was not only that Britain and France should win, but also that Germany should not be ruined.
('77', 25, 5, 14, 49693) He had no desire to rear India’s freedom on the ashes of any of the belligerent Powers, even as he did not want the freedom of the European Powers to be built upon the ruins of India’s freedom.

('77', 25, 6, 16, 49907) 33. AM I A MESSENGER OF GOD?
('77', 25, 7, 17, 49936) A Muslim friend writes a long letter which pruned down reads as follows:
('77', 25, 8, 18, 50009) The chief difficulty that stands in your way of right thinking is that your heart has so hardened by looking at and interpreting things in the light of your self assumed principles, that you cannot bring to bear an open mind on anything howsoever valuable it may be.
('77', 25, 9, 19, 50276) If God has not appointed you as his messenger, what you say or teach cannot be claimed to be a word of God.
('77', 25, 9, 20, 50384) No one would contest the truthfulness of truth and non violence as teachings of the prophets, and principles of very high spiritual value; but their true understanding and application require a soul that is in direct communion with God.
('77', 25, 9, 21, 50621) Any person who has only polished his
('77', 25, 10, 22, 50658) 1 Vide “Statement to the Press”, 5 9 1939 and “Source of my Sympathy”, 11 9 1939.
('77', 26, 0, 1, 50740) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 27
('77', 26, 1, 2, 50788) soul by suppressing or acting against the desires and cravings of the flesh and the self is not a prophet.
('77', 26, 2, 3, 50895) The fact that you stand as a teacher of the world and claim to have diagnosed the disease from which the world is suffering, and proclaim that the truth of your choice and practice and the non violence of your conviction and application are the only cures for the afflicted world, betrays your utter disregard and misconception of the truth.
('77', 26, 2, 4, 51237) You admit you make mistakes.
('77', 26, 2, 5, 51266) Your non violence is actually a concealed violence as it is not based on actual spiritual life and is not the earnest of true inspiration from God.
('77', 26, 3, 6, 51414) As a true believer and in pursuance of that teaching of Islam which enjoins on every Muslim to convey the truth to every human being, I would request you to clear your mind of all complexes, to place yourself in the position of an ordinary human being who wants to learn and not to teach, and to become a real seeker after truth.
('77', 26, 4, 7, 51744) If you wish to find out the truth, I would request you to study the Koran and the life of the Prophet Mohammed (Peace of God be upon him) written by Shebli Nowani and M. Sulaiman Nadwi with an open mind.
('77', 26, 5, 8, 51948) As for unity among the different communities inhabiting India, it can never come in terms of a single nation.
('77', 26, 5, 9, 52058) Broad minded toleration of each other’s religion and practices and an agreement based on the recognition of the Muslims as a nation with their own complete code of life and culture to guide them and an equality of status in political life, shall bring harmony and peace to India.
('77', 26, 5, 10, 52338) I have omitted no argument used by the writer.
('77', 26, 5, 11, 52385) I have not hardened my heart.
('77', 26, 5, 12, 52415) I have never claimed to be a messenger of God except in the sense in which all human beings are.
('77', 26, 5, 13, 52512) I am a mortal as liable to err as any other.
('77', 26, 5, 14, 52557) Nor have I claimed to be a teacher.
('77', 26, 5, 15, 52593) But I cannot prevent admirers from calling me a teacher or a mahatma, as I cannot prevent traducers from calling me all sorts of names and ascribing to me vices to which I am a stranger.
('77', 26, 5, 16, 52780) I lay both praise and blame at the feet of the Almighty and go my way.
('77', 26, 5, 17, 52851) For the information of my correspondent, who is a schoolmaster in a high school, I may say that I have reverently studied the works he mentions and also many other works on Islam.
('77', 26, 5, 18, 53031) I have more than once read the Koran.
('77', 26, 5, 19, 53069) My religion enables me, obliges me, to imbibe all that is good in all the great religions of the earth.
('77', 26, 5, 20, 53173) This does not mean that I must accept the interpretation that my correspondent may put upon the message of the Prophet of Islam or any other Prophet.
('77', 26, 5, 21, 53323) I must use the limited intelligence that God has given me to interpret the
('77', 27, 0, 1, 53398) 28 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 27, 1, 2, 53439) teachings bequeathed to mankind by the Prophets of the world.
('77', 27, 1, 3, 53501) I am glad to find that my correspondent agrees that truth and non violence are taught by the holy Koran.
('77', 27, 1, 4, 53606) Surely it is for him, as for every one of us, to apply these principles to daily life according to the light given to us by God.
('77', 27, 1, 5, 53735) The last paragraph in the letter lays down a dangerous doctrine.
('77', 27, 1, 6, 53800) Why is India not one nation?
('77', 27, 1, 7, 53829) Was it not one during, say, the Moghul period?
('77', 27, 1, 8, 53876) Is India composed of two nations?
('77', 27, 1, 9, 53910) If it is, why only two?
('77', 27, 1, 10, 53934) Are not Christians a third, Parsis a fourth, and so on?
('77', 27, 1, 11, 53990) Are the Muslims of China a nation separate from the other Chinese?
('77', 27, 1, 12, 54057) Are the Muslims of England a different nation from the other English?

('77', 27, 1, 21, 54895) Live and let live or mutual forbearance and toleration is the law of life.
('77', 27, 1, 22, 54970) That is the lesson I have learnt from the Koran, the Bible, the Zend Avesta and the Gita.

('77', 29, 4, 6, 57648) 37. VIRTUES OF SILENCE
('77', 29, 5, 7, 57671) Thus writes Dr. Rajan 2 to Mahadev Desai:
('77', 29, 6, 8, 57713) The other day when I was at Segaon to see Mahatmaji, I found him observing silence.
('77', 29, 6, 9, 57797) You know he wrote on a slip of paper to the following effect, referring to his silence: “This has become a health necessity with me”.
('77', 29, 6, 10, 57931) These few words have made me ponder over the idea of silence in relation to physical health.
('77', 29, 6, 11, 58024) As a piece of scientific information it will be good to have a record of his personal experience.
('77', 29, 7, 12, 58122) I should like to know as a result of his observing silence,
('77', 29, 8, 13, 58182) 1. whether there is any visible drop in the blood pressure variation;
('77', 29, 9, 14, 58252) 2. whether after a period of silence he feels physically better and is able to put forth greater energy and application to his work; and
('77', 29, 10, 15, 58389) 3. whether he feels mental recuperation also pari passu with that of his body while he is observing silence.
('77', 29, 11, 16, 58498) To observe silence is indeed a difficult self imposed restriction.
('77', 29, 11, 17, 58565) But it is worth while in the interests of physical and mental well being to make this possible.
('77', 29, 11, 18, 58661) 3 You know that I never write or indulge in such speculative writing to a busy person like Gandhiji.
('77', 29, 11, 19, 58762) You will therefore appreciate as to why I am writing to you.
('77', 29, 11, 20, 58823) If you think the information which I seek is worth while, I shall be glad if you can publish it in Harijan.
('77', 29, 12, 21, 58931) Before I answer the questions let me say that for me silence is
('77', 29, 13, 22, 58995) 1 Viyogi Hari of Harijan Nivas, New Delhi 2 Dr. T. S. S. Rajan, Minister of Public Health, Madras 3 As in the source
('77', 30, 0, 1, 59112) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 31
('77', 30, 1, 2, 59160) no strain and no effort.
('77', 30, 1, 3, 59185) Indeed I am so tired of arguing and talking that I speak only when I feel I must.
('77', 30, 1, 4, 59267) Generally, therefore, I am nowadays silent except to visitors who come by appointment and on some business connected with activities with which I am identified.
('77', 30, 1, 5, 59428) In the Segaon Ashram I am silent to everybody except in cases of sickness and the like.
('77', 30, 1, 6, 59516) I observe too that I get easily irritated if members of the Ashram act in a manner contrary to expectation.
('77', 30, 1, 7, 59624) I find that silence avoids irritation.
('77', 30, 1, 8, 59663) Now for the questions.
('77', 30, 1, 9, 59686) 1. There is a perceptible drop in blood pressure when I observe silence.
('77', 30, 1, 10, 59759) Medical friends have therefore advised me to take as much silence as I can.
('77', 30, 1, 11, 59835) 2. There is no doubt whatsoever that after every silence I feel recuperated and have greater energy for work.
('77', 30, 1, 12, 59945) The output of work during silence is much greater than when I am not silent.
('77', 30, 1, 13, 60022) 3. The mind enjoys a peace during silence which it does not without it.
('77', 30, 1, 14, 60094) That is to say, the decision to be silent itself produces a soothing effect on me.
('77', 30, 1, 15, 60177) It lifts a burden off my mind.
('77', 30, 1, 16, 60208) My experience tells me that silence soothes the nerves in a manner no drugs can.
('77', 30, 1, 17, 60289) With me it also induces sleep.
('77', 30, 1, 18, 60320) Caution : I have noticed in the jails that prisoners get moody when, deprived of company, they have to observe enforced silence.
('77', 30, 1, 19, 60449) To produce the effect I have described, silence has to be liked.
('77', 30, 1, 20, 60514) No one, therefore, need be silent out of love of imitation or merely for the knowledge that it produces on me the effect described by me.
('77', 30, 1, 21, 60652) The best thing would be to take silence on medical advice.
('77', 30, 1, 22, 60711) Needless to say that here I do not refer to the spiritual need and effects of silence.
('77', 30, 1, 23, 60798) SEGAON, October 22, 1939 Harijan, 28 10 1939
('77', 30, 2, 24, 60843) 38. ON BRAHMACHARYA
('77', 30, 3, 25, 60863) One may say I have long ago stopped writing for Harijan bandhu.
('77', 30, 3, 26, 60927) The will is not absent; but lack of time has stood in the way.
('77', 30, 3, 27, 60990) I have been waiting for a long time to write on this subject.
('77', 30, 3, 28, 61052) Today I shall dwell on it briefly.
('77', 30, 3, 29, 61087) A friend has pointed out to me that in an earlier article I had promised to state my views on brahmacharya.
('77', 30, 3, 30, 61195) I do not recollect the exact words.
('77', 30, 3, 31, 61231) But I had certainly said that I would try to write
('77', 31, 0, 1, 61282) 32 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 31, 1, 2, 61323) something.
('77', 31, 1, 3, 61334) My definition of brahmacharya still stands.
('77', 31, 1, 4, 61378) According to it, a man who is affected by passion even mentally has fallen from brahmacharya.
('77', 31, 1, 5, 61472) One who is not free from passion [even] in thought can never be considered a perfect brahmachari.
('77', 31, 1, 6, 61570) I do not consider myself an ideal brahmachari since I have not reached that ideal.
('77', 31, 1, 7, 61653) Though I am far away from this ideal I think I have progressed from what I was when I started.
('77', 31, 1, 8, 61748) Freedom from passion in thought cannot be achieved until one gets a vision of the Supreme.
('77', 31, 1, 9, 61839) 1 When one achieves complete control over one’s thoughts, ‘man’ and ‘woman’ include each other.
('77', 31, 1, 10, 61935) I believe in the possibility of such a brahmachari athough I have not come across one.
('77', 31, 1, 11, 62022) I still continue my strenuous efforts to become such a brahmachari.
('77', 31, 1, 12, 62090) So long as such brahmacharya is not attained, man cannot realize the full potentialities of ahimsa.
('77', 31, 1, 13, 62190) I have not recognized the permanent need for the conventional restrictions on a brahmachari.
('77', 31, 1, 14, 62283) One who needs outer restrictions is not a perfect brahmachari.
('77', 31, 1, 15, 62346) On the contrary, one who is on the look out for opportunities to waive the restrictions is not a brahmachari but a fraud.
('77', 31, 1, 16, 62468) How to achieve such fearless brahmacharya?
('77', 31, 1, 17, 62511) I do not have the right key to it for I have not attained perfection in it.
('77', 31, 1, 18, 62587) But I may state what I have found essential for myself.
('77', 31, 1, 19, 62643) One should keep the mind engaged in pure thoughts.
('77', 31, 1, 20, 62694) Constant repetition of Ramanama should go on all the twenty four hours as naturally as breathing, even during sleep.
('77', 31, 1, 21, 62811) One should engage oneself in reading good books and thinking about one’s own work, which again should be infused with public spirit.
('77', 31, 1, 22, 62944) Those who are married should not seek privacy.
('77', 31, 1, 23, 62991) They should not sleep in one room or in one bed.
('77', 31, 1, 24, 63040) If their passion is aroused on seeing each other, they should live separately.
('77', 31, 1, 25, 63119) If they experience passionate feelings while talking to each other, they should stop talking.
('77', 31, 1, 26, 63213) One who is aroused at the sight of any woman should abandon the thought of brahmacharya and have restrained marital relations with his wife.
('77', 31, 1, 27, 63354) If he is not married, he should think of marrying.
('77', 31, 1, 28, 63405) None should insist on exceeding one’s own capacity.
('77', 31, 1, 29, 63457) I can think of many instances when men have fallen in attempting to exceed their capacity.
('77', 31, 1, 30, 63548) Anyone who gleefully listens to obscene talk, indulges in staring
('77', 31, 2, 31, 63614) 1 Bhagavad Gita, II.
('77', 32, 0, 1, 63635) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 33
('77', 32, 1, 2, 63683) at women, reads dirty books and gloats over filthy stories violates brahmacharya.
('77', 32, 1, 3, 63765) Many students and teachers fail in practising brahmacharya because they are not aware of the discipline in hearing, seeing, reading, speaking and so on.
('77', 32, 1, 4, 63918) And they ask me how they should practise brahmacharya.
('77', 32, 1, 5, 63973) They do not even try to observe it.
('77', 32, 1, 6, 64009) Let us bear in mind that a man who on any pretext touches a woman with passion violates brahmacharya.
('77', 32, 1, 7, 64111) Those who strictly observe the above discipline can observe brahmacharya without difficulty.
('77', 32, 1, 8, 64204) An idle man can never practise brahmacharya.
('77', 32, 1, 9, 64249) One who conserves his vital fluid acquires unfailing power.
('77', 32, 1, 10, 64309) He must put his body and mind ceaselessly to work.
('77', 32, 1, 11, 64360) Hence every seeker should select such service as would leave him no time for indulging the senses.
('77', 32, 1, 12, 64459) The seeker has to have complete control over his diet.
('77', 32, 1, 13, 64514) Whatever he eats he should eat as medicine, for the preservation of the body, never to pamper the palate.
('77', 32, 1, 14, 64620) He should, therefore, never take intoxicants, spices, etc.
('77', 32, 1, 15, 64679) A person practising brahmacharya should be not merely temperate but abstemious in eating.
('77', 32, 1, 16, 64769) Everyone should prescribe his own restrictions.
('77', 32, 1, 17, 64817) Fasting, etc., do have a place in the observance of brahma charya.
('77', 32, 1, 18, 64884) But those who attach undue importance to fasting, etc., and think that they have done their duty if they have fasted are gravely mistaken.
('77', 32, 1, 19, 65023) When a man starves his senses, the objects of those senses disappear from him, but not the yearning for them.
('77', 32, 1, 20, 65133) 1 Fasting is beneficial for physical health.
('77', 32, 1, 21, 65178) An abstemious person may also make mistakes and hence occasional fasts will certainly benefit him.
('77', 32, 1, 22, 65277) Why should I lose my vitality for the sake of a momentary pleasure?
('77', 32, 1, 23, 65345) Why should I deceive God by misusing His gift, i.
('77', 32, 1, 24, 65395) e., by wasting my vitality which has the power of generating progeny?
('77', 32, 1, 25, 65465) Since I can gain power by conserving my vitality, why should I lose that power by wasting it?
('77', 32, 1, 26, 65559) If a seeker always meditates on these lines and prays for God’s grace, it is possible for him to retain his vitality and be a brahmachari during this very life.
('77', 32, 1, 27, 65720) I live in this hope.
('77', 32, 1, 28, 65741) [From Gujarati] Harijanbandhu, 22 10 1939
('77', 32, 2, 29, 65783) 1 Bhagavad Gita, II.

('77', 33, 1, 2, 65845) 39. NOTE TO POLICE SUPERINTENDENT AND DEPUTY COMMISSIONER 1
('77', 33, 2, 3, 65905) October 22, 1939 I have been thinking hard over the proposal.

('77', 36, 3, 7, 70505) 45. CAUSES
('77', 36, 4, 8, 70516) The best way of losing a cause is to abuse your opponent and to trade upon his weakness.
('77', 36, 4, 9, 70605) Whatever may be true of other modes of warfare, in satyagraha it had been held that the causes for failure are to be sought within.
('77', 36, 4, 10, 70737) The refusal by the British Government to fulfil the Congress hope, that they would make the expected declaration, is solely due to the weaknesses in the Congress organization and Congressmen.
('77', 36, 4, 11, 70929) The greatest weakness lies in our want of full appreciation of non violence and its many implications.
('77', 36, 4, 12, 71032) All our other weaknesses are to be derived from that one grave defect.
('77', 36, 4, 13, 71103) Whilst we have fairly observed physical non violence, our breasts have harboured violence.
('77', 36, 4, 14, 71194) Hence our non violence in respect of the Government is a result of our incapacity for effective violence.
('77', 36, 4, 15, 71300) But therefore we have been betrayed into violence in our dealings with one another.
('77', 36, 4, 16, 71384) We have quarrelled with one another in committees; sometimes we have even come to blows.
('77', 36, 4, 17, 71473) We have refused to carry out instructions of the Working Committee.
('77', 36, 4, 18, 71541) We have formed rival groups wanting to seize power.
('77', 36, 4, 19, 71593) Hindus and Muslims have come to blows on the slightest pretext.
('77', 36, 4, 20, 71657) Congressmen must be held partly responsible for the failure to compose communal differences.
('77', 36, 4, 21, 71750) It is all very well to blame the British Government for our disunity.
('77', 36, 4, 22, 71820) But that way we prolong the agony.
('77', 36, 4, 23, 71855) We knew that the policy of divide and rule was there in 1920, and yet we made Hindu Muslim unity part of our constructive programme.
('77', 36, 4, 24, 71988) We did so because we had expected that, in spite of the Government being in our way, we would achieve unity.
('77', 36, 4, 25, 72097) What is more we seemed for the time being to have attained it.
('77', 36, 4, 26, 72160) These examples of our weaknesses are terrible.
('77', 36, 4, 27, 72207) They have prevented the Congress from rising to its full height, and reduced our professions of non violence to a mockery.
('77', 36, 4, 28, 72330) If my analysis of the causes of our failure is correct, there is the solid consolation that the remedy is dependent not upon any extraneous circumstance but upon
('77', 37, 0, 1, 72492) 38 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 37, 1, 2, 72533) ourselves.
('77', 37, 1, 3, 72544) We must put our own organization in order and make it pure enough and strong enough to command respect, not by inspiring fear among those who impede our march towards the goal but by the indubitable evidence of our non violent speech and action.
('77', 37, 1, 4, 72790) The Working Committee’s resolution, if it is evidence of Congress earnestness in vindicating India’s freedom, is also a test of Congressmen’s discipline and non violence.
('77', 37, 1, 5, 72961) Though nothing is said in the resolution, the control and management of civil disobedience has been left in my hands at the will of the Committee.
('77', 37, 1, 6, 73108) Needless to say I have no sanction, never had any, save the willing and knowing obedience of the vast mass of Congressmen, registered and unregistered, to the instruction issued to them through the Committee, or through Young India and Navajivan, whilst they were published, and now through Harijan.
('77', 37, 1, 7, 73408) When, therefore, I find that my instructions have no running power, Congressmen will find me retiring from the field without ado.
('77', 37, 1, 8, 73538) But if I am to retain the general control of the struggle, I shall want the strictest adherence to discipline.
('77', 37, 1, 9, 73649) So far as I can see there is no possibility of civil resistance on a large scale unless Congressmen show perfect discipline and greater appreciation than hitherto of non violence and truth.
('77', 37, 1, 10, 73839) There need be none unless we are goaded into it by the authorities.
('77', 37, 1, 11, 73907) We are engaged in a life and death struggle.
('77', 37, 1, 12, 73952) Violence surrounds us.
('77', 37, 1, 13, 73975) It is a time of great trial for the country.
('77', 37, 1, 14, 74020) No camouflage will answer our purpose.
('77', 37, 1, 15, 74059) If Congressmen find that they have no non violence in them, if they cannot cast out bitterness against the English officials or the countrymen who may oppose the Congress, they must say so openly, discard non violence and displace the present Working Committee.
('77', 37, 1, 16, 74321) Such dismissal will be no calamity.
('77', 37, 1, 17, 74357) But it will be a calamity of the first magnitude to keep the Committee without full faith in them and in their instructions.
('77', 37, 1, 18, 74482) So far as I can see, there is no independence for India except through the strictest adherence to truth and non violence.
('77', 37, 1, 19, 74604) My generalship is of no use whatsoever if I have an army which doubts the efficacy of the weapons with which I arm them.
('77', 37, 1, 20, 74725) I am as determined a foe of the exploitation of my country as anyone can be.
('77', 37, 1, 21, 74802) I am as impatient as the hottest Congressman for the complete deliverance of the country from the foreign yoke.
('77', 37, 1, 22, 74914) But I have no hate for a single Englishman and for that matter for anybody on earth.
('77', 37, 1, 23, 74999) If I may not help the Allies, I do not wish disaster to them.
('77', 37, 1, 24, 75061) Though the British Government have grievously disappointed the Congress hope, my hope, I do not seek any gain from their
('77', 38, 0, 1, 75182) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 39
('77', 38, 1, 2, 75230) embarrassment.
('77', 38, 1, 3, 75245) My attempt and my prayer are, and will be, for an honourable peace between the belligerent nations in the least possible time.
('77', 38, 1, 4, 75372) I had nursed the hope that there would be an honourable peace and partnership between Britain and India, and that I might be able to play a humble part in finding a way out of the awful carnage that is disgracing humanity and making life itself a burden.
('77', 38, 1, 5, 75627) But God had willed it otherwise.

('77', 41, 1, 7, 79543) We had a very fine discussion in the Working Committee yesterday, and we discussed threadbare the position of the members as individuals and as representatives of the Congress and the people.
('77', 41, 1, 8, 79735) The question with you is different.
('77', 41, 1, 9, 79771) For you are here in your individual capacity and you have to decide your conduct no matter what Congress or Congress men may think.
('77', 41, 1, 10, 79903) The question is thus much simpler for you.
('77', 41, 1, 11, 79946) Will you adopt an attitude of brotherliness to one who has done your dear ones a grievous injury?
('77', 41, 1, 12, 80044) Supposing Rajendra Babu was attacked, would you retaliate or rather stand between Rajendra Babu and the assailant and bear cheerfully the blows meant for him?
('77', 41, 1, 13, 80203) You will do the latter if you have shed all fear of death and injury to limbs, and all considerations for the domestic ties that bind you.
('77', 41, 1, 14, 80342) But unless you have nothing but brotherliness for those that despitefully use you, your resolution that you would stand by the principle of non violence through thick and thin will have no meaning.
('77', 41, 1, 15, 80540) It would be far better to wind up the Sangh than to have an empty resolution.
('77', 41, 1, 16, 80618) Non violence is not a cloistered virtue, confined only to the rishi and the cave dweller.
('77', 41, 1, 17, 80708) It is capable of being practised by the millions, not with full knowledge of its implications, but because it is the law of our species.
('77', 41, 1, 18, 80845) It distinguishes man from the brute.
('77', 41, 1, 19, 80882) But man has not shed the brute in him.
('77', 41, 1, 20, 80921) He has to strive to do so.
('77', 41, 1, 21, 80948) This striving applies to the practice of non violence, not to the belief in it.
('77', 41, 1, 22, 81028) I cannot strive to believe in a principle; I either believe in it or I do not.
('77', 41, 1, 23, 81107) And if I believe in it, I must bravely strive to practise it.
('77', 41, 1, 24, 81169) Ahimsa is an attribute of the brave.
('77', 41, 1, 25, 81206) Cowardice and ahimsa do not go together any more than water and fire.
('77', 41, 1, 26, 81276) It is that ahimsa that every member of the Gandhi Seva Sangh has to make a conscious effort to develop in himself.
('77', 41, 1, 27, 81391) We have often thought about this question but the hour of our trial has arrived today, as much with reference to war as with the struggle for swaraj and equally with reference to Hindu Muslim unity.
('77', 41, 1, 28, 81590) Remember also that your non violence cannot operate effectively unless you have faith in the spinning wheel.

('77', 42, 1, 3, 81894) You cannot build non violence on a factory civilization, but it can be built on self contained villages.

('77', 42, 3, 9, 82420) 53. LETTER TO JAWAHARLAL NEHRU
('77', 42, 4, 10, 82451) SEGAON, WARDHA, October 26, 1939
('77', 42, 5, 11, 82484) MY DEAR JAWAHARLAL, I could see that though your affection and regard for me remain undiminished, differences in outlook between us are becoming most marked.
('77', 42, 5, 12, 82642) Perhaps this is the most critical period in our history.
('77', 42, 5, 13, 82699) I hold very strong views on the most important questions which occupy our attention.
('77', 42, 5, 14, 82784) I know you too hold strong views on them but different from mine.
('77', 42, 5, 15, 82850) Your mode of expression is different from mine.
('77', 42, 5, 16, 82898) I am not sure that I carry the other members with me in the views that I hold very strongly.
('77', 42, 5, 17, 82991) I cannot move about.
('77', 42, 5, 18, 83012) I cannot come in direct touch with the masses, not even with the Congress workers.
('77', 42, 5, 19, 83095) I feel that I must not lead if I cannot carry you all with me.
('77', 42, 5, 20, 83158) There should be no divided counsels among the members of the Working Committee.
('77', 42, 5, 21, 83238) I feel that you should take full charge and lead the country, leaving me free to voice my opinion.
('77', 42, 5, 22, 83337) But if you all thought that I should observe complete silence, I should, I hope, find no difficulty in complying.
('77', 42, 5, 23, 83451) If you think it worth while, you should come and discuss the whole thing.

('77', 44, 6, 13, 85717) 57. DISCUSSION WITH EXECUTIVE MEMBERS OF GANDHI SEVA SANGH—II
('77', 44, 7, 14, 85779) WARDHA, October 26, 1939
('77', 44, 8, 15, 85804) QUESTION: How can a believer in the non violence of your conception 2 be a Minister?
('77', 44, 9, 16, 85889) GANDHIJI : I fear he cannot in the present state of things.
('77', 44, 9, 17, 85949) We have seen that our Ministers have had to resort to violence even as the British Government in the pre autonomy days.
('77', 44, 9, 18, 86069) It was inevitable perhaps.
('77', 44, 9, 19, 86096) Had Congressmen been truly non violent, there would have been no resort to force.
('77', 44, 9, 20, 86178) But the Congress majorities were not based on unadulterated non violence.
('77', 44, 9, 21, 86252) A Minister said the other day that although he had not given up an iota of non violence he could not do without resorting to the minimum of firing.
('77', 44, 9, 22, 86400) He had resorted to it only to the extent that it was unavoidable.
('77', 44, 9, 23, 86466) He may have said it then, he may not say it again if I can help it.
('77', 44, 9, 24, 86534) For if he goes in again, he will have
('77', 44, 10, 25, 86572) 1 Of Nawanagar 2 Vide “Discussion with Executive Members of Gandhi Seva Sangh I”, 25 10 1939.
('77', 45, 0, 1, 86666) 46 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 45, 1, 2, 86707) made his position clear and he will represent a House that is predominantly non violent.
('77', 45, 1, 3, 86796) In other words, he will take office if he is sure that the people would let him carry on the Government on a non violent basis.
('77', 45, 2, 4, 86924) But may it not be that whereas a non violent Minister will confine violence to the lowest minimum, one who does not believe in non violence would observe no such restraint?
('77', 45, 2, 5, 87097) That belief is a delusion.
('77', 45, 2, 6, 87124) All those who are using violence today make the same claim.
('77', 45, 2, 7, 87184) Hitler too would say the same thing.
('77', 45, 2, 8, 87221) General Dyer was acclaimed as the hero of the hour by the House of Lords because his object was said to be to prevent the spread of mob violence.
('77', 45, 2, 9, 87367) Soviet Russia believes its violence is a transitional stage to the establishment of an order without violence.
('77', 45, 2, 10, 87478) In the present state of our belief and practice it may be better to wind up the Sangh leaving each one to grow unfettered.
('77', 45, 3, 11, 87601) KISHORELAL MASHRUWALA: But the suggestion is being made that we may confine the membership to those who are engaged in contructive work.
('77', 45, 4, 12, 87738) That suggestion is good, and we can conceivably convert the Sangh into such a body and then try each of us in our individual capacity to purify ourselves as much as we can.
('77', 45, 4, 13, 87911) For non violence is impossible without self purification.
('77', 45, 4, 14, 87969) Let us therefore be members of a self purification association, but no association is necessary for that purpose.
('77', 45, 4, 15, 88083) Therefore let us try each in our own way to face difficulties and problems as they come and see how far we can go.
('77', 45, 4, 16, 88198) In Hudli, two years ago, I asked 1 you to help in the elections and in sending the best possible men to the legislatures.
('77', 45, 4, 17, 88320) I gave advice in the atmosphere as it exised then.
('77', 45, 4, 18, 88371) I cannot give you that advice today.
('77', 45, 4, 19, 88408) In fact the time may have come when it becomes necessary for such of you as believe in the non violence of the brave to retire from the Congress as I did in 1934 2.
('77', 45, 5, 20, 88573) How do you think that the masses can practise non violence when we know that they are all prone to anger, hate, ill will?
('77', 45, 5, 21, 88695) They are known to fight for the most trivial things.
('77', 45, 5, 22, 88748) They are, and yet, I think they can practise non violence for the common good.
('77', 45, 5, 23, 88827) Do you think the thousands of women that collected contraband salt had ill will against anyone?
('77', 45, 5, 24, 88923) They knew that the
('77', 45, 6, 25, 88942) 1 In April 1937. 2 Vide “Statement to the Press”, 30 10 1939.

('77', 46, 1, 2, 89052) Congress or Gandhi had asked them to do certain things, and they did those things in faith and hope.
('77', 46, 1, 3, 89153) To my mind the most perfect demonstration of non violence was in Champaran.
('77', 46, 1, 4, 89229) Did the thousands of ryots who rose up in revolt against the agrarian evils harbour the least ill will against the Government or the planters?
('77', 46, 1, 5, 89372) Their belief in non violence was unintelligent, even as the belief in the earth being round with many is unintelligent.
('77', 46, 1, 6, 89492) But their belief in their leaders was genuine, and that was enough.
('77', 46, 1, 7, 89560) With those who lead it is another matter.
('77', 46, 1, 8, 89602) Their belief has got to be intelligent, and they have to live up to all the implications of the belief.
('77', 46, 2, 9, 89706) But then are not the masses the world over like that?
('77', 46, 2, 10, 89760) They are not, for others have not that background of non violence.
('77', 46, 3, 11, 89827) But if there was non violence ingrained in our masses, how should they have come to this state of slavery?
('77', 46, 3, 12, 89934) There indeed is what I flatter myself is going to be my contribution.
('77', 46, 3, 13, 90004) I want that non violence of the weak to become non violence of the brave.
('77', 46, 3, 14, 90078) It may be a dream, but I have to strive for its realization.

('77', 48, 6, 9, 92089) STATEMENT TO THE PRESS 1
('77', 48, 7, 10, 92114) SEGAON, October 27, 1939 I have read Sir Samuel Hoare’s speech 2 with the attention it deserves.
('77', 48, 7, 11, 92211) I appreciate the conciliatory tone behind it.
('77', 48, 7, 12, 92257) It makes it, therefore, embarrassing for me to produce what may appear to be a jarring note.
('77', 48, 7, 13, 92350) But even as he speaks from a sense of duty I hope I shall receive the same credit.
('77', 48, 7, 14, 92433) Has Dominion Status for India any meaning unless it is synonymous with independence?
('77', 48, 7, 15, 92518) Has the India of his imagination the right to secede from the Commonwealth?
('77', 48, 7, 16, 92594) I like the declaration that the British have shed imperialistic ambition.
('77', 48, 7, 17, 92668) Will he allow the people of India to judge for themselves whether in reality that ambition has been shed?
('77', 48, 7, 18, 92774) If it is, the proof of it should be forthcoming even before India is statutorily declared independent.
('77', 48, 7, 19, 92877) When the protection of minorities is pleaded against the declaration required by the Congress, the great pronouncement made
('77', 48, 8, 20, 93001) 1 This appeared under the title “Found Wanting”.
('77', 48, 8, 21, 93050) The statement was also published in The Bombay Chronicle and The Hindu on October 28. 2 Replying to the debate on India, in the House of Commons, on October 26; vide Appendix “Sir Samuel Hoare’s Speech”, 26 10 1939.

('77', 49, 1, 2, 93307) by Sir Samuel Hoare sounds unreal.
('77', 49, 1, 3, 93342) What the Congress has asked is not any sounding of Indian opinion but a declaration of Britain’s intention.
('77', 49, 1, 4, 93450) I have endeavoured 1 to show that there is no such thing as real minorities in India whose rights can be endangered by India becoming independent.
('77', 49, 1, 5, 93597) With the exception of the Depressed Classes there is no minority which is not able to take care of itself.
('77', 49, 1, 6, 93704) I observe that Sir Samuel Hoare has mentioned the Europeans also as a minority.
('77', 49, 1, 7, 93784) The very mention of Europeans, in my opinion, condemns the cry of the interest of minorities.
('77', 49, 1, 8, 93878) But the protection of minorities, whatever they are, is common cause between the British Government and the Congress.
('77', 49, 1, 9, 93996) I would like the British Government to remember that there is every prospect of Congress India, to use Sir Samuel’s phrase, being a hopeless minority.
('77', 49, 1, 10, 94147) I like Sir Samuel’s division of India into Congress and non Congress.
('77', 49, 1, 11, 94217) And if non Congress India contains not merely the Princes but the people of Princes’ India, all the Mussalmans, all those who might be represented by the Hindu Mahasabha and others who refuse to be classified as part of Congress India, it is Congress India which will be in danger of a non Congress majority.
('77', 49, 1, 12, 94526) And the Congress has got to make good its position even though it may represent a minority wholly unarmed, partly by outside force but largely by its own will.
('77', 49, 1, 13, 94686) I am glad that Sir Samuel Hoare has declared that the present British policy is to be judged in the moral scales suggested by me.
('77', 49, 1, 14, 94816) I venture to suggest that if Sir Samuel’s speech is the last word on behalf of the British Government, British political morality will be found wanting.
('77', 49, 1, 15, 94969) Sir Samuel has laughed at non co operation as a barren doctrine.
('77', 49, 1, 16, 95034) I am convinced that it is not as barren as he thinks.
('77', 49, 1, 17, 95088) It has proved its worth in the eyes of millions of Indians and will do so again if the Congress remains truly non violent, as I hope it will.
('77', 49, 1, 18, 95230) The Congress decision 2 is an imperative call of duty.
('77', 49, 1, 19, 95285) It puts both the Congress and the British Government on their trial.
('77', 49, 1, 20, 95354) Nothing but good will come out of it if both will play the game.
('77', 49, 2, 21, 95419) SEGAON, October 27, 1939 Harijan, 4 11 1939

('77', 51, 16, 23, 98320) 63. NOTES
('77', 51, 17, 24, 98330) THAKKAR BAPA AND SERVANTS OF INDIA SOCIETY A friend who loves the Servants of India Society as himself, in sending his donation of Rs. 10 for the Thakkar Bapa Fund, writes:
('77', 51, 18, 25, 98503) I endorse every word of your praise 2 of Thakkar Bapa.
('77', 51, 18, 26, 98558) The only suggestion I would venture to make is that his membership of the Servants of India Society might have been mentioned.
('77', 51, 18, 27, 98685) The Society may not take credit for his meritorious work; but it has kept him there without a demur and indeed taken pride in his great services to humanity.
('77', 51, 18, 28, 98843) The rebuke is well merited.
('77', 51, 18, 29, 98871) To tell the truth, I did not even know that I had omitted to mention among Bapa’s many merits that he had given up his office of Road Engineer for the Bombay Municipal Corporation to become a Servant of India.
('77', 51, 18, 30, 99081) He is a loan to the Harijan Sevak Sangh by the Society.
('77', 51, 18, 31, 99137) The Society needs no advertisement from me.
('77', 51, 18, 32, 99181) And since I call myself an unofficial self appointed member of the Society, to mention the latter is, in a way, advertising myself.
('77', 51, 18, 33, 99313) But I am quite capable of performing that somewhat delicate task.
('77', 51, 19, 34, 99379) 1 Vide Appendix “Congress Working Committee Resolution”, 22 10 1939. 2 Vide “Bapa Jayanti”, 16 10 1939.

('77', 52, 1, 2, 99531) reason for omitting the mention was, however, accidental.
('77', 52, 1, 3, 99589) I work under tremendous pressure and though it was my intention to connect Bapa with the Society, I evidently failed to carry it out.
('77', 52, 1, 4, 99723) I hope that this belated reference will bring more funds to the Bapa purse, which is Harijan purse.
('77', 52, 1, 5, 99823) Let the Servants of India too, official and unofficial, set apart some time daily for the collection of the purse.

('77', 52, 2, 13, 100459) 64. MESSAGE TO POONA BASIC EDUCATION CONFERENCE 2
('77', 52, 3, 14, 100509) SEGAON, October 28, 1939 I hope that the Poona Educational Conference will, in all it does, keep steadily in view the newness of the Nai Talim, rendered in English as Basic Education.
('77', 52, 3, 15, 100693) Just as we may neither reduce nor increase ingredients in a chemical experiment, so also we may not add to or discard anything from the essentials of the Wardha Scheme.
('77', 52, 3, 16, 100862) The newness of this scheme is that education is to be given through a village craft.
('77', 52, 3, 17, 100947) The end in view is not to be accomplished by merely adding a village craft to the current syllabus.
('77', 52, 4, 18, 101047) M. K. G Harijan, 4 11 1939
('77', 52, 5, 19, 101074) 1 Bal Gangadhar Tilak died on July 31, 1920. 2 This appeared under “Notes”, sub title “Basic Education” as a “translation of the message in Hindi”.
