('77', 111, 14, 20, 207204) 146. THE ONLY WAY
('77', 111, 15, 21, 207222) Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru has compelled me to study, among other things, the implications of a Constituent Assembly.
('77', 111, 15, 22, 207337) When he first introduced it 1 in the Congress resolutions, I reconciled myself to it
('77', 111, 16, 23, 207422) 1 At the Congress Working Committee meeting on September 14, 1939; vide Appendix “Working Committee’s Manifesto”, 14 9 1939.
('77', 112, 0, 1, 207547) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 113
('77', 112, 1, 2, 207596) because of my belief in his superior knowledge of the technicalities of democracy.
('77', 112, 1, 3, 207679) But I was not free from scepticism.
('77', 112, 1, 4, 207715) Hard facts have, however, made me a convert and, for that reason perhaps, more enthusiastic than Jawaharlal himself.
('77', 112, 1, 5, 207832) For I seem to see in it a remedy, which Jawaharlal may not, for our communal and other distempers, besides being a vehicle for mass political and other education.
('77', 112, 1, 6, 207995) The more criticism I see of the scheme, the more enamoured I become of it.
('77', 112, 1, 7, 208070) It will be the surest index to the popular feeling.
('77', 112, 1, 8, 208122) It will bring out the best and the worst in us.
('77', 112, 1, 9, 208170) Illiteracy does not worry me.
('77', 112, 1, 10, 208200) I would plump for unadulterated adult franchise for both men and women, i.
('77', 112, 1, 11, 208275) e., I would put them all on the register of voters.
('77', 112, 1, 12, 208327) It is open to them not to exercise it if they do not wish to.
('77', 112, 1, 13, 208389) I would give separate vote to the Muslims; but, without giving separate vote, I would, though reluctantly, give reservation, if required, to every real minority according to its numerical strength.
('77', 112, 1, 14, 208587) Thus the Constituent Assembly provides the easiest method of arriving at a just solution of the communal problem.
('77', 112, 1, 15, 208701) Today we are unable to say with mathematical precision who represents whom.
('77', 112, 1, 16, 208777) Though the Congress is admittedly the oldest representative organization on the widest scale, it is open to political and semi political organizations to question, as they do question, its overwhelmingly representative character.
('77', 112, 1, 17, 209007) The Muslim League is undoubtedly the largest organization representing Muslims, but several Muslim bodies—by no means all insignificant—deny its claim to represent them.
('77', 112, 1, 18, 209177) But the Constituent Assembly will represent all communities in their exact proportion.
('77', 112, 1, 19, 209264) Except it there is no other way of doing full justice to rival claims.
('77', 112, 1, 20, 209335) Without it there can be no finality to communal and other claims.
('77', 112, 1, 21, 209401) Again, the Constituent Assembly alone can produce a constitution indigenous to the country and truly and fully representing the will of the people.
('77', 112, 1, 22, 209549) Undoubtedly such a constitution will not be ideal, but it will be real, however imperfect it may be in the estimation of the theorists or legal luminaries.
('77', 112, 1, 23, 209705) Self government to be self government has merely to reflect the will of the people who are to govern themselves.
('77', 112, 1, 24, 209818) If they are not prepared for it, they will make a hash of it.
('77', 112, 1, 25, 209880) I can conceive the possibility of a people fitting themselves for right government through a series of wrong experiments, but I cannot conceive a people governing themselves rightly through a government imposed from without, even as the fabled jackdaw could
('77', 113, 0, 1, 210138) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 114
('77', 113, 1, 2, 210180) not walk like a peacock with feathers borrowed from his elegant companion.
('77', 113, 1, 3, 210255) A diseased person has a prospect of getting well by personal effort.
('77', 113, 1, 4, 210324) He cannot borrow health from others.
('77', 113, 1, 5, 210361) The risks of the experiment are admitted.
('77', 113, 1, 6, 210403) There is likely to be impersonation.
('77', 113, 1, 7, 210440) Unscrupulous persons will mislead the illiterate masses into voting for wrong men and women.
('77', 113, 1, 8, 210533) These risks have to be run, if we are to evolve something true and big.
('77', 113, 1, 9, 210605) The Constituent Assembly, if it comes into being—as I hope it will—as a result of an honourable settlement between us and the British people, the combined wit of the best men of the two nations will produce an Assembly that will reflect fairly truly the best mind of India.
('77', 113, 1, 10, 210879) Therefore the success of the experiment at the present stage of India’s history depends upon the intention of the British statesmen to part with power without engaging India in a deadly unorganized rebellion.
('77', 113, 1, 11, 211088) For I know that India has become impatient.
('77', 113, 1, 12, 211132) I am painfully conscious of the fact that India is not yet ready for non violent civil disobedience on a mass scale.
('77', 113, 1, 13, 211249) If, therefore, I cannot persuade the Congress to await the time when non violent action is possible, I have no desire to live to see a dog fight between the two communities.
('77', 113, 1, 14, 211423) I know for certain that if I cannot discover a method of non violent action or inaction to the satisfaction of the Congress and there is no communal adjustment, nothing on earth can prevent an outbreak of violence resulting for the time being in anarchy and red ruin.
('77', 113, 1, 15, 211691) I hold that it is the duty of all communities and Englishmen to prevent such a catastrophe.
('77', 113, 1, 16, 211783) The only way out is a Constituent Assembly.
('77', 113, 1, 17, 211827) I have given my own opinion on it, but I am not tied down to the details.
('77', 113, 1, 18, 211901) When I was nearly through with this article, I got the following wire from Syed Abdulla Brelvi 1;
('77', 113, 2, 19, 211999) Considerable misapprehensions among minorities (about) Constituent Assembly.
('77', 113, 2, 20, 212076) Strongly urge clarification details, franchise, composition, methods arriving decision.
('77', 113, 2, 21, 212164) I think I have said sufficient in the foregoing to answer Syed Saheb’s question.
('77', 113, 2, 22, 212245) By minorities he has Muslims principally in mind as represented by the Muslim League.
('77', 113, 2, 23, 212331) If once the proposition that all communities desire a charter of independence framed by a Constituent Assembly and that they will not be satisfied with anything else is accepted, the settling of details surely becomes easy.
('77', 113, 2, 24, 212555) Any other
('77', 113, 3, 25, 212565) 1 Editor, The Bombay Chronicle
('77', 114, 0, 1, 212596) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 115
('77', 114, 1, 2, 212645) method must lead to an imposed constitution mostly undemocratic.
('77', 114, 1, 3, 212710) It would mean an indefinite prolongation of imperialistic rule sustained by the help of those who will not accept the fully democratic method of a Constituent Assembly.
('77', 114, 1, 4, 212879) The principal hindrance is undoubtedly the British Government.
('77', 114, 1, 5, 212942) If they can summon a Round Table Conference as they propose to do after the war, they can surely summon a Constituent Assembly subject to safeguards to the satisfaction of minorities.
('77', 114, 1, 6, 213126) The expression ‘satisfactionof minorities’ may be regarded as vague.
('77', 114, 1, 7, 213195) It can be defined beforehand by agreement.
('77', 114, 1, 8, 213238) The question thus resolves itself into whether the British Government desire to part with power and open a new chapter in their own history.
('77', 114, 1, 9, 213379) I have already shown 1 that the question of the Princes is a red herring across the path.
('77', 114, 1, 10, 213469) European interests are absolutely safe so long as they are not in conflict with ‘the interests of India’.
('77', 114, 1, 11, 213575) I think this expression finds place in the Irwin Gandhi Pact 2. Look at the question from any standpoint you like, it will be found that the way to democratic swaraj lies only through a properly constituted Assembly, call it by whatever name you like.
('77', 114, 1, 12, 213827) All resources must, therefore, be exhausted to reach the Constituent Assembly before direct action is thought of.
('77', 114, 1, 13, 213941) A stage may be reached when direct action may become the necessary prelude to the Constituent Assembly.
('77', 114, 1, 14, 214045) That stage is not yet.
('77', 114, 1, 15, 214068) ALLAHABAD, November 19, 1939 Harijan, 25 11 1939

('77', 114, 3, 21, 214514) She had a

('77', 115, 1, 3, 214893) Congressmen have gained the reputation of being agitators only and not being capable of constructive work, but such critics are now inclined to change their opinion.

('77', 115, 3, 21, 216266) 148. RAJKOT REFORMS
('77', 115, 4, 22, 216286) Having once offended, however unwittingly, against the Thakore Saheb of Rajkot and Durbar Shri Virawala, I have restrained myself against saying anything by way of criticism of the Durbar’s doings in that State.
('77', 115, 4, 23, 216498) 3 But duty to the people of Rajkot who have shown exemplary discipline demands a word from me on the reforms just announced.
('77', 115, 4, 24, 216623) They expect me to give my opinion on them.
('77', 115, 4, 25, 216666) It pains me to have to say that they have undone what the late Thakore Saheb had done.
('77', 115, 4, 26, 216753) The adult franchise which it was the late Thakore Saheb’s boon lasting 15 years has been revoked, and it has been reduced to the
('77', 115, 5, 27, 216882) 1 On May 22, 1935. Kamala Nehru died in Geneva on February 28, 1936. 2 Vide also “Notes”, 20 11 1939. 3 The reference is to Gandhiji’s four days’ fast from May 3, which was given up after the Viceroy’s assurance.
('77', 116, 0, 1, 217095) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 117
('77', 116, 1, 2, 217144) possession of property qualifications and a stiff residential test.
('77', 116, 1, 3, 217212) The elected President gives place to the Dewan as permanent President.
('77', 116, 1, 4, 217283) The original Sabha which was wholly composed of elected representatives is to contain 40 elected members against 20 nominated.
('77', 116, 1, 5, 217410) The elected members will be sub divided into minorities.
('77', 116, 1, 6, 217467) The so called majority will thus become really a minority.
('77', 116, 1, 7, 217526) The natural course of reforms is progressive increase of popular control.
('77', 116, 1, 8, 217600) Here without the slightest justification popular control has been materially reduced.
('77', 116, 1, 9, 217686) The original Sabha had wide powers of legislation.
('77', 116, 1, 10, 217737) These have been curtailed.
('77', 116, 1, 11, 217764) There was a definite announcement that the privy purse was to be fixed.
('77', 116, 1, 12, 217836) The reforms ignore the announcement.
('77', 116, 1, 13, 217873) The Notification of December 26th last was to transfer to the people ‘the widest powers possible’.
('77', 116, 1, 14, 217972) My reading of them leads me to the conclusion that not only have the powers already possessed by the people been taken away but they have been limited as much as possible.
('77', 116, 1, 15, 218144) In one word, the Thakore Saheb’s, i.
('77', 116, 1, 16, 218181) e., the Dewan’s, will is to by the Supreme Law in Rajkot.
('77', 116, 1, 17, 218239) I am sorry to have to write these lines.
('77', 116, 1, 18, 218280) I do not know whether these reforms are the last act of the tragedy for which my violence is responsible.
('77', 116, 1, 19, 218386) A fast is a remedy to be applied only by an expert.
('77', 116, 1, 20, 218438) It interrupts the even course of a movement for better.
('77', 116, 1, 21, 218494) The slightest touch of violence damages it.
('77', 116, 1, 22, 218538) I have admitted that my appeal to the Viceroy against the acts of the Thakore Saheb whilst the fast was pending was violence and vitiated the fast.
('77', 116, 1, 23, 218686) I had thought that I had paid the penalty by repentance, and that the happy relations established between the Thakore Saheb and Durbar Shri Virawala and me would open a new and bright chapter for the people of Rajkot.
('77', 116, 1, 24, 218904) The durbar held in my honour after my public repentance seemed to have set the seal on the good that the repentance had done.
('77', 116, 1, 25, 219030) I see, I was mistaken.
('77', 116, 1, 26, 219053) Men’s natures are not changed in a moment.
('77', 116, 1, 27, 219096) I apologize to the people of Rajkot.
('77', 116, 1, 28, 219133) But I do not repent of my repentance.
('77', 116, 1, 29, 219171) I am quite sure that what was morally right was also politically right.
('77', 116, 1, 30, 219243) My repentance saved the people of Rajkot from a worse fate.
('77', 116, 1, 31, 219303) It averted a communal clash.
('77', 116, 1, 32, 219332) I am quite sure that in the end the people of Rajkot will come to their own.
('77', 116, 1, 33, 219409) Meanwhile the evil that the reforms in my opinion are, must be allowed to work itself out.
('77', 116, 1, 34, 219500) Those citizens of Rajkot who have any sense of self respect must abstain from co operation in working them.
('77', 117, 0, 1, 219608) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 118
('77', 117, 1, 2, 219650) They will, if they take my advice, watch, wait, pray and literally spin.
('77', 117, 1, 3, 219723) They will find that they will be also spinners of real liberty in Rajkot in the non violent way which is the only true way.

('77', 117, 2, 5, 219896) 149. NOTES
('77', 117, 3, 6, 219907) KAMALA NEHRU MEMORIAL On the 19th instant I had the privilege of laying the foundation stone of the Kamala Nehru Memorial Hospital in Allahabad before a large gathering.
('77', 117, 3, 7, 220077) 1 This hospital will be not only a fitting remembrance of the memory of a true devotee of her country and a woman of great spiritual beauty, it will be a redemption of the promise made to her by me that I would do what lay in my power to see that the work for which she had made herself responsible was carried on even after her death.
('77', 117, 3, 8, 220413) She was going to Europe in search of health.
('77', 117, 3, 9, 220458) The visit proved to be a search of death.
('77', 117, 3, 10, 220500) As she was going she had invited me, if I could, either to join her for a brief talk during part of her journey to Bombay or to see her in Bombay.
('77', 117, 3, 11, 220647) I went to Bombay.
('77', 117, 3, 12, 220665) During the time that I was able to give her she asked me, if she died in Europe, to try to see that the hospital which Jawaharlal had commenced in Swaraj Bhavan and which she had laboured to keep alive was put on a permanent footing.
('77', 117, 3, 13, 220899) I told her I would do what I could.
('77', 117, 3, 14, 220935) That promise was partly the foundation for the appeal, to which I had become party, for funds for the Memorial.
('77', 117, 3, 15, 221047) Owing to circumstances beyond my control I was not able to take much active part in collecting the funds.
('77', 117, 3, 16, 221153) The appeal was made for five lacs and only half the amount has come in.
('77', 117, 3, 17, 221225) At the ceremony of foundation laying, I made an appeal to the large audience composed of the wealthy as also the poor to share the burden of making up the deficit.
('77', 117, 3, 18, 221389) By judicious organization it ought to be easy to make the collection for a cause so worthy and for a memory so sacred.
('77', 117, 3, 19, 221508) Able doctors of all India reputation like Jivraj Mehta and Bidhan Chandra Roy are among the trustees.
('77', 117, 3, 20, 221610) They have made themselves responsible for the proper construction, organization and management of the hospital.
('77', 117, 3, 21, 221722) I hope that not only will the deficit be soon made up but the doctors will have no difficulty in securing a
('77', 117, 4, 22, 221830) 1 Vide “Speech at Kamla Nehru Memorial Hospital, Allahabad”, 19 11 1939.

('77', 118, 1, 2, 221952) suitable staff for the efficient management of the hospital.
('77', 118, 2, 3, 222013) A REMINDER Narandas Gandhi tells me that I should remind the readers that all those who want to take part in the spinning yajna against the rentia jayanti should send in their names at once.
('77', 118, 2, 4, 222204) The yajna took effect from the 11th October last.
('77', 118, 2, 5, 222254) Those who have not yet sent in their names are already behindhand.
('77', 118, 2, 6, 222321) But better late than never.
('77', 118, 2, 7, 222349) Those who are behindhand can make up by spinning more than the stipulated quantity till they have made up for the past neglect.
('77', 118, 2, 8, 222477) Narandas Gandhi has specialized in this class of khadi work.
('77', 118, 2, 9, 222538) He loves figures at which he is quick.
('77', 118, 2, 10, 222577) To keep an exact record of names and addresses of sacrificial spinners and register their output does not tire him.
('77', 118, 2, 11, 222693) On the contrary he delights in this work.
('77', 118, 2, 12, 222735) He believes in method.
('77', 118, 2, 13, 222758) He thinks that the mere keeping of such registers systematizes the work of which a register is kept, and stimulates workers.
('77', 118, 2, 14, 222883) If a fairly large number will spin for sacrifice, they can help in bringing about a material reduction in the price of khadi.
('77', 118, 2, 15, 223009) The scheme is rich with possibilities.
('77', 118, 2, 16, 223048) I hope, therefore, that it will meet with the response it deserves.
('77', 118, 3, 17, 223116) A GOOD SUGGESTION A khadi lover says:
('77', 118, 4, 18, 223154) Now that the Ministers have resigned in what are called Congress provinces, will they not be most usefully employed if they will make it a point to sell khadi by hawking or otherwise?
('77', 118, 4, 19, 223338) Khadi is in the centre of the Congress programme.
('77', 118, 4, 20, 223388) Thousands of Congressmen can occupy themselves with it as with no other.
('77', 118, 4, 21, 223461) Will you not put my humble suggestion before the ex Ministers in particular and all Congressmen in general?
('77', 118, 4, 22, 223569) In every province there is a surplus stock.
('77', 118, 4, 23, 223613) Spinning is consequently being cut down.
('77', 118, 4, 24, 223654) It should not be so.
('77', 118, 4, 25, 223675) I endorse every word of what the khadi lover suggests.
('77', 118, 4, 26, 223730) Congressmen should make it their duty to see that all surplus khadi is sold without delay.

('77', 119, 3, 4, 223961) MY DEAR SHUMMY, Have mercy on poor Amrit.
('77', 119, 3, 5, 224003) She finds her soul with me.
('77', 119, 3, 6, 224031) She has got what she has been yearning for years.
('77', 119, 3, 7, 224081) With her it is not a question of what service I want from her, it is a question with her of how she can serve me, i.

('77', 119, 3, 32, 225297) I am likely to be in Allahabad till Wednesday.

('77', 120, 1, 2, 225596) 151. CONGRESS WORKING COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 1
('77', 120, 2, 3, 225641) [November 22, 1939] 2
('77', 120, 3, 4, 225663) The Working Committee have noted with pleasure the response of the country to the policy enunciated 3 by them regarding the war in Europe and its repercussions in India.
('77', 120, 3, 5, 225833) This policy, based on numerous declarations of the Congress, was laid down in a statement 4 issued by the Committee on September 14, and subequent events have amply justified its wisdom and expediency.
('77', 120, 3, 6, 226035) The course of the war and the policy pur sued by the British and French Governments, in particular the declara tions made on behalf of the British Government regarding India, seem to demonstrate that the present war, like the World War of 1914 18,is being carried on for imperialist ends, and British imperialism is to remain entrenched in India.
('77', 120, 3, 7, 226382) With such a war and with this policy the Congress cannot associate itself, and it cannot countenance the exploitation of India’s resources to this end.
('77', 120, 3, 8, 226534) The Working Committee’s unequivocal demand was for a declaration of war aims in regard to democracy and imperialism and, in particular, how these aims were going to be applied to India.
('77', 120, 3, 9, 226720) These aims could only be considered worthy, if they included the elimination of imperialism and the treatment of India as an independent nation whose policy would be guided in accordance with the wishes of her people.
('77', 120, 3, 10, 226938) The answer to this demand has been entirely unsatisfactory, and an attempt has been made on behalf of the British Government to create misunderstandings and to befog the main and moral issue.
('77', 120, 3, 11, 227130) In justification of this refusal to make a declaration in terms of the Working Committee’s resolution, communal pleas have been advanced and the rights of the minorities and of the Princes pleaded as barriers to India’s freedom.
('77', 120, 3, 12, 227359) The Committee wish to declare with all emphasis that no communal considerations arise in meeting the demand of the
('77', 120, 4, 13, 227474) 1 A report dated “Allahabad, November 22” in The Hindustan Times read; “The Congress Working Committee considered for seven hours today the draft resolution prepared by Mahatma Gandhi on the present political crisis in India.” 2 ibid 3Vide Appendix “Congress Working Committee Resolution”, after 18 7 1939. 4Vide Appendix “Working Committee’s Manifesto”, 14 9 1939.
('77', 121, 0, 1, 227840) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 122
('77', 121, 1, 2, 227882) Congress, and the minorities, whatever their other differences might be, do not oppose India’s right to freedom and independence.
('77', 121, 1, 3, 228012) The Princes are represented by, and are emblems of, the Paramount Power in India.
('77', 121, 1, 4, 228094) In the end, it will be the people of the Indian States who will determine what part they will take in a free India, though the British Government have consistently ignored their wishes in the matter which vitally affects them.
('77', 121, 1, 5, 228321) In any event, the wishes of those who may oppose India’s independence are, and must be, irrelevant to the declaration of the British Government’s intentions.
('77', 121, 1, 6, 228479) The Committee can only interpret this attempt to avoid a statement of their war aims and Indian freedom by taking shelter under irrelevant issues, as a desire to maintain their imperialist domination in India in alliance with reactionary elements in the country.
('77', 121, 1, 7, 228742) The Congress has looked upon the war crisis and the problems it raises as essentially a moral issue, and has not sought to profit by it in any spirit of bargaining.
('77', 121, 1, 8, 228907) The moral and dominant issue of war aims and India’s freedom have to be settled satisfactorily before any other subsidiary question can be considered.
('77', 121, 1, 9, 229058) In no event can the Congress accept responsibility of the Government, even in the transitional period, without real power being given to popular representatives.
('77', 121, 1, 10, 229220) The Working Committee, therefore, approve of and endorse the reply dated November 3 1 , 1939, sent by the Congress President to the Viceroy.
('77', 121, 1, 11, 229361) The Committee wish to declare again that recognition of India’s independence and the right of her people to frame their constitution through a Constituent Assembly is essential in order to remove the taint of imperialism from Britain’s policy and to enable the Congress to consider further co operation.
('77', 121, 1, 12, 229665) They hold that the Constituent Assembly is the only democratic method of determining the constitution of a free country, and no one who believes in democracy and freedom can possibly take exception to it.
('77', 121, 1, 13, 229870) The Working Committee believe, too, that the Constituent Assembly alone is the adequate instrument for solving communal and other difficulties.
('77', 121, 1, 14, 230014) This, however, does not mean that the Working Committee will relax their efforts for arriving at a solution of the communal problem.
('77', 121, 1, 15, 230147) This Assembly can frame a constitution in which the rights of accepted minorities would be protected to their satisfaction and, in the event of
('77', 121, 2, 16, 230291) 1 The source, however, has “4”; vide Appendix “Letter from the Congress President to the Viceroy”, 3 11 1939.
('77', 122, 0, 1, 230401) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 123
('77', 122, 1, 2, 230450) some matters relating to minority rights not being mutually agreed to, they can be referred to arbitration.
('77', 122, 1, 3, 230558) The Constituent Assembly should be elected on the basis of adult suffrage, the existing separate electorates being retained for such minorities as desire them.
('77', 122, 1, 4, 230718) The number of these members in the Assembly should reflect their numerical strength.
('77', 122, 1, 5, 230803) The declarations 1 made on behalf of the British Government, being inadequate, have compelled the Congress to dissociate itself from British policy and war efforts, and, as a first step in non co operation, to bring about the resignations of all the Congress Governments in the Provinces.
('77', 122, 1, 6, 231092) That policy of non co operation continues and must continue unless the British Government revises its policy and accepts the Congress contention.
('77', 122, 1, 7, 231238) The Working Committee would remind Congressmen that it is inherent in every form of satyagraha that no effort is spared to achieve an honourable settlement with the oppponent.
('77', 122, 1, 8, 231414) While a satyagrahi is ever ready for a non violent fight, if it has to come, he never relaxes his efforts for peace and always works for its attainment.
('77', 122, 1, 9, 231567) The Working Committee will, therefore, continue to explore the means of arriving at an honourable settlement, even though the British Government have banged the door in the face of the Congress.
('77', 122, 1, 10, 231762) The Committee must, however, resist, by the non violent methods of the Congress, all attempts to coerce the people of India along paths which are not of their choice and everything that is against the dignity and freedom of India.
('77', 122, 1, 11, 231993) The Working Committee appreciate and express their pleasure at the readiness exhibited by Congressmen for launching civil disob edience, should this become necessary.
('77', 122, 1, 12, 232160) But civil disobedience requires the same strict discipline as an army organized for an armed conflict.
('77', 122, 1, 13, 232263) The army is helpless unless it possesses its weapons of destruction and knows how to use them; so also an army of non violent soldiers is ineffective unless it understands and possesses the essentials of non violence.
('77', 122, 1, 14, 232481) The Working Committee desire to make it clear that the true test of preparedness for civil disobedience lies in Congressmen themselves
('77', 122, 2, 15, 232616) 1 Vide Appendices “Viceroy’s Declaration”, 17 10 1939, “Sir Samuel Hoare’s Speech”, 26 10 1939, “Viceroy’s Broadcast Declaration”, 5 11 1939, “Viceroy’s Prefatory Remarks on Correspondence with Leaders”, 5 11 1939 and “Lord Zetland’s Statement”, 7 11 1939.
('77', 123, 0, 1, 232873) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 124
('77', 123, 1, 2, 232915) spinning and promoting the cause of khadi to the exclusion of mill cloth, and deeming it their duty to establish harmony between the communities by personal acts of service to those other than members of their own community, and individual Hindu Congressmen seeking an occasion for fraternizing with the Harijans as often as possible.
('77', 123, 1, 3, 233250) The Congress organizations and Congressmen should, therefore, prepare for future action by promoting this programme.
('77', 123, 1, 4, 233367) They should explain to the people the message and policy and implications of the Constituent Assembly which is the crux of the Congress programme for the future.

('77', 124, 4, 14, 235100) 154. DISCUSSION WITH U.P.P.C.C. EXECUTIVE COUNCIL MEMBERS 1
('77', 124, 5, 15, 235160) ALLAHABAD, [November 23, 1939] 2
('77', 124, 6, 16, 235193) QUESTION: You seem to be placing an exaggerated emphasis on non violence today.
('77', 124, 6, 17, 235273) Surely you will not suggest that we were more ready or more non violent in 1920 21 and in 1930?
('77', 124, 6, 18, 235369) Or will you say that your standard has now gone up?
('77', 124, 7, 19, 235421) ANSWER: Both.
('77', 124, 7, 20, 235435) There was not then so much violence as is to be seen on the surface today.
('77', 124, 7, 21, 235510) And my standard too has gone up.
('77', 124, 7, 22, 235543) I was not so rigid in my conditions then as I am now.
('77', 124, 7, 23, 235597) If you accept my generalship, you have to accept not only my conditions but my judgment as to whether we are ready or not.
('77', 124, 7, 24, 235720) It is quite likely that there is really no difference between the conditions of those days and of today; but it is equally true that I did not know then that I was walking on a mine, today I am haunted by that consciousness and I cannot help it.
('77', 124, 8, 25, 235966) Is there not a fear that, if we do not strike the nail while it is hot, we may never be able to do so at all?
('77', 124, 8, 26, 236076) There is that psychology of readiness among the people.
('77', 124, 8, 27, 236132) If we do notseize the opportunity, their enthusiasm may be damped and their readiness may vanish.The best thing, therefore, today is for you to suggest a programme whereby we may prepare the field and yet keep up the spirit of the people.
('77', 124, 8, 28, 236371) I have always been impatient of this kind of language.
('77', 124, 8, 29, 236426) I cannot understand a readiness which would vanish if it was not availed of at once.
('77', 124, 8, 30, 236511) That is no readiness at all.
('77', 124, 8, 31, 236540) Ready is he who is ready at all times

('77', 125, 1, 2, 236781) and at all places—whenever and wherever he is called.
('77', 125, 1, 3, 236835) The only meaning of readiness is readiness to carry out the command of the general.
('77', 125, 1, 4, 236919) To use military language, we should be so prepared as to make war unnecessary.

('77', 125, 1, 25, 238476) It is likely that there may not be the nccessary intellectual conviction, but it will follow faith as a necessary consequence.
('77', 125, 1, 26, 238603) I say this because I have acted in that spirit.

('77', 125, 1, 28, 238871) In that case you have but to give up my leadership.

('77', 125, 1, 30, 238998) It is possible that you may be able to evolve some new technique of satyagraha.

('77', 125, 2, 36, 239409) 1 On March 12, 1930. 2 In Natal; Gandhiji led an Indian Stretcher bearer Corps.

('77', 126, 1, 2, 239538) We have proceeded on an altogether different ideology.
('77', 126, 1, 3, 239593) Well, there’s the rub.
('77', 126, 1, 4, 239616) That is why I am repeating again and again my suggestion of a change in the leadership.

('77', 126, 3, 11, 240284) To die in quelling it.

('77', 126, 4, 16, 240636) They cannot indefinitely do so.
('77', 126, 4, 17, 240668) I have enough faith in Mussalmans to hope that they would rebel against being an obstacle in the way of independence.

('77', 126, 5, 20, 241044) Why little time?
('77', 126, 5, 21, 241061) Is it essential that we should start the movement in three months or six months?
('77', 126, 5, 22, 241142) Let it take six years.
('77', 126, 5, 23, 241165) What is essential is the preparation, I would ask you to get rid of impatience.
('77', 126, 5, 24, 241245) The test for me is not a formal spinning by you all for half an hour or even an hour a day in order to satisfy me or to secure my leadership, but the universalization of spinning so that there may be no mill cloth— indigenous or foreign—in your province.

('77', 130, 1, 2, 246836) 161. SWARAJ THROUGH WOMEN
('77', 130, 2, 3, 246862) Now that the Working Committee has accepted 1 spinning as an indispensable condition of civil disobedience, the women of India have a rare opportunity of serving the country.
('77', 130, 2, 4, 247037) The salt campaign brought out tens of thousands from their seclusion and showed that they could serve the country on equal terms with men.
('77', 130, 2, 5, 247176) It gave the village woman a dignity which she had never enjoyed before.
('77', 130, 2, 6, 247248) The restoration of spinning to its central place in India’s peaceful campaign for deliverance from the imperial yoke gives her women a special status.
('77', 130, 2, 7, 247399) In spinning they have a natural advantage over men.
('77', 130, 2, 8, 247451) Since the beginning of time there has been a division of labour between men and women.
('77', 130, 2, 9, 247538) Adam wove and Eve span.
('77', 130, 2, 10, 247562) The distinction persists to the present day.
('77', 130, 2, 11, 247607) Men spinners are an exception.
('77', 130, 2, 12, 247638) In the Punjab when during 1920 21 I asked men to spin, they used to tell me that men considered spinning to be beneath their dignity and that it was solely women’s occupation.
('77', 130, 2, 13, 247814) Men nowadays do not object on the ground of dignity.
('77', 130, 2, 14, 247867) There are thousands who spin for sacrifice.
('77', 130, 2, 15, 247911) It was when men took up spinning from a patriotic motive that spinning was reduced to a science and inventions as great as in any other field were made.
('77', 130, 2, 16, 248064) Nevertheless experience shows that spinning will remain woman’s speciality.
('77', 130, 2, 17, 248140) I believe there is a good reason behind the experience.
('77', 130, 2, 18, 248196) Spinning is essentially a slow and comparatively silent process.
('77', 130, 2, 19, 248261) Woman is the embodiment of sacrifice and therefore non violence.
('77', 130, 2, 20, 248326) Her occupations must therefore be, as they are, more conducive to peace than war.
('77', 130, 2, 21, 248408) That she is now being dragged down for purposes of violent war is no credit to modern civilization.
('77', 130, 2, 22, 248508) I have no doubt that violence so ill becomes woman that presently she will rebel against the violation of her fundamental nature.
('77', 130, 2, 23, 248638) I feel that man too will repent of his folly.
('77', 130, 2, 24, 248684) Equality of the sexes does not mean equality of occupations.
('77', 130, 2, 25, 248745) There may be no legal bar against a woman hunting or wielding a lance.
('77', 130, 2, 26, 248816) But she instinctively recoils from a function that belongs to man.
('77', 130, 2, 27, 248883) Nature has created sexes as complements of each other.
('77', 130, 2, 28, 248938) Their functions are defined as are their forms.
('77', 130, 2, 29, 248986) But a proof of the different functions of the sexes is unnecessary for my purpose.
('77', 130, 2, 30, 249069) The fact stands, at any rate in India, that millions of women regard spinning as their natural occupation.
('77', 130, 2, 31, 249176) The Working Committee’s resolution automatically shifts the burden from
('77', 130, 3, 32, 249248) 1 Vide "Congress Working Committee Resolution", 22 11 1939.
('77', 131, 0, 1, 249308) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 132
('77', 131, 1, 2, 249350) men to women and gives to them an opportunity of showing their mettle.
('77', 131, 1, 3, 249421) I would love to find that my future army contained a vast preponderance of women over men.
('77', 131, 1, 4, 249512) If the fight came, I should then approach it with much greater confidence than if men predominated.
('77', 131, 1, 5, 249612) I would dread the latter’s violence.
('77', 131, 1, 6, 249649) Women would be my guarantee against such an outbreak.
('77', 131, 2, 7, 249703) SEGAON, November 27, 1939 Haijan, 2 12 1939

('77', 131, 4, 9, 249758) WHY NOT HINDU MAHASABH?
('77', 131, 4, 10, 249782) A correspondent writes :
('77', 131, 5, 11, 249807) I have read your comments 1 on the speech delivered by Lord Zetland in the Lords’ debate on India in which he declared the Congress to be a Hindu organization.
('77', 131, 5, 12, 249967) I cannot help saying that the attitude of the Congress itself is partly responsible for the mistake into which Lord Zetland has fallen.
('77', 131, 5, 13, 250103) If the Congress is a national organization, as it undoubtedly is, with what propriety did it enter into a discussion with the Muslim League alone, which is a purely communal organization, for solving the communal question generally and the Hindu Muslim question particularly?
('77', 131, 5, 14, 250379) The Congress ought to have remained neutral and permitted Jinnah Saheb to negotiate with Shri Savarkar, the President of the Hindu Mahasabha, or, if it was not practicable, to convene a conference of the representatives of the several communal organizations in the country and to play the role of umpire at such a conference.
('77', 131, 5, 15, 250705) Any attempt on the part of the Congress leaders to have direct and exclusive talks with the leaders of a single community with a view to the solution of Hindu Muslim problem was bound to give a handle to the opponents of the Congress, of which they could not be expected to be slow to take full advantage.
('77', 131, 5, 16, 251011) In my opinion this step on the part of the Congress has lowered the status of the Congress as a national organization.
('77', 131, 5, 17, 251130) I have already admitted the force of the correspondent’s argument.
('77', 131, 5, 18, 251197) I have also shown how the Congress could not shirk a duty devolving upon it.
('77', 131, 5, 19, 251274) I must dissent from the view that the status of the Congress has been lowered by its attempt to solve a difficult national problem.
('77', 131, 5, 20, 251406) I invite all well wishers to refrain from doing anything to
('77', 131, 6, 21, 251466) 1 Vide “Interview to The Manchester Guardian”, 4 11 1939 and “Is Congress a Hindu Organization”, 13 11 1939 .

('77', 133, 3, 9, 254903) WHEN IS PICKETING PEACEFUL?
('77', 133, 4, 10, 254931) A correspondent writes :
('77', 133, 5, 11, 254956) I find that here in Bombay this weapon of ‘peaceful picketing’ is being misused on the ground that peaceful picketing, with whatsoever just or unjust object it may be resorted to, is no offence.
('77', 133, 5, 12, 255151) The aggrieved party against whom such picketing is aimed at, fails to get any protection either from the police or law.
('77', 133, 5, 13, 255271) For instance, A happens to be a shopkeeper.
('77', 133, 5, 14, 255315) B, an employee of A, having no legal claim against A, threatens A with picketing his shop in case A does not accede to B’s demands and actually, with the help of C and D posing as ‘leaders’, starts picketing A’s shop, and misleads A’s customers, with a view to dissuading them from patronising A’s shop.
('77', 133, 5, 15, 255619) Would such picketing, even though there be no actual physical force used, be termed ‘peaceful’?
('77', 133, 5, 16, 255715) I cannot speak about the legality of such picketing, but I can say that such picketing cannot be called peaceful, i.
('77', 133, 5, 17, 255832) e., non violent.
('77', 133, 5, 18, 255849) All picketing without indubitably just cause is violent even though no physical force is used.
('77', 133, 5, 19, 255944) Picketing without such cause becomes a nuisance and interferes with the exercise of private right.
('77', 133, 5, 20, 256043) Generally no picketing should be resorted to by individuals unless it is promoted by a responsible organization.
('77', 133, 5, 21, 256156) Picketing like civil disobedience has its well defined limits without a strict observance of which it becomes illegitimate and reprehensible.
('77', 133, 5, 22, 256298) SEGAON, November 27, 1939 Harijan, 2 12 1939
('77', 133, 6, 23, 256343) 1 Vide “Notes”, sub title, “Award or Decision”, 14 11 1939.

('77', 134, 5, 10, 256994) 164. THE PITY OF IT
('77', 134, 6, 11, 257014) The following is taken from a letter by a wise and learned Englishman to an English friend who has forwarded it to me :
('77', 134, 7, 12, 257134) Gandhiji seems to me to have completely departed from his original position which was that he would not tolerate any bargaining with the British Government to which in this war he was prepared to give complete support.
('77', 134, 7, 13, 257353) He seems to me now to have veered round completely to the Congress extreme position, namely, that unless complete and unconditional independence is promised to India now, they will not co operate in any way with the Government, but where they are in power will resign thus to dissociate themselves completely from the Government which has declared that India is at war with Germany.
('77', 134, 7, 14, 257736) This seems to me to be sheer bargaining, the exploiting of British need, to secure not only Dominion Status which has been promised in clear and unmistakable terms but absolute independence.
('77', 134, 7, 15, 257927) Further, I find it hard to reconcile Congress assertion that it contemplates no constitution which does not carry with it the protection of real minorities to their satisfaction and the complete failure of the Congress to come to an understanding with the Muslim League.
('77', 134, 7, 16, 258198) Surely this failure gives little encouragement to the Muslims to believe and trust the Congress with the supreme power that Indian independence would give them.

('77', 134, 8, 18, 258494) 16 3 Vide also “Bapa Jayanti”, 16 10 1939.
('77', 135, 0, 1, 258537) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 136
('77', 135, 1, 2, 258579) As I have stated before 1 I have not departed a tittle from my original position which was taken, as I then said, because I was an out and out believer in non violence.
('77', 135, 1, 3, 258748) In offering my sympathy (I did not use the word ‘support’) I had the same end in view that the Congress has.
('77', 135, 1, 4, 258857) I put my position before the Working Committee.
('77', 135, 1, 5, 258905) It could not honestly adopt it.
('77', 135, 1, 6, 258937) Desiring independence, it could not take up any other attitude.
('77', 135, 1, 7, 259001) The Congress position was as good from its own, as mine from my premises.
('77', 135, 1, 8, 259075) The Congress had a perfect right to know British intentions, if the British Government desired its help in the prosecution of the war.
('77', 135, 1, 9, 259210) As a subject nation, India, if she was resolved upon securing her liberty, could not be expected willingly to help the dominant nation without knowing where she stood.
('77', 135, 1, 10, 259378) If india was violently inclined and had the strength, she would be bound to take advantage of Britain’s difficulty and declare her independence and defend it with arms if she was resisted.
('77', 135, 1, 11, 259567) And she would have commanded the admiration of the world including Britain for seizing the opportunity.
('77', 135, 1, 12, 259671) But the Congress has chosen the better way—the way of non violence, however diluted it is.
('77', 135, 1, 13, 259762) I own too that India is not ready for armed revolt.
('77', 135, 1, 14, 259814) But this is no matter of credit either for Britain or for India.
('77', 135, 1, 15, 259879) India is too weak for armed revolt.
('77', 135, 1, 16, 259915) Britain’s connection has made her weaker.
('77', 135, 1, 17, 259957) Her disarmament is a black chapter in British history.
('77', 135, 1, 18, 260012) God has blessed me with the mission to place non violence before the nation for adoption.
('77', 135, 1, 19, 260102) For better or for worse the Congress has adopted it and, for the past nineteen years the Congress, admittedly the most popular and powerful organization, has consistently and to the best of its ability tried to act up to it.
('77', 135, 1, 20, 260327) Hence the sting of forced disarmament has not been felt as it would have been otherwise.
('77', 135, 1, 21, 260416) It is futile to guess what it would have done if it had not accepted non violence as its chief means for the attainment of swaraj.
('77', 135, 1, 22, 260547) The Congress has allowed itself to be judged from the non violent standpoint.
('77', 135, 1, 23, 260625) It is possible to question the propriety of the Congress attitude only from that standpoint.
('77', 135, 1, 24, 260718) Judged according to the ordinary standard, the Congress stands fully justified in the attitude it has taken.
('77', 135, 1, 25, 260827) I hope the learned critic does not wish to suggest that as the Congress did not accept my position I should have dissociated myself entirely from the Congress and refused to guide it.
('77', 135, 1, 26, 261011) My associationen ables the Congress to pursue the technique of corporate non violent

('77', 136, 1, 2, 261188) action.
('77', 136, 1, 3, 261196) The writer seems to cavil at the demand for independence as distinguished from Dominion Status.
('77', 136, 1, 4, 261292) Surely India cannot be satisfied with anything less if she is to rank as a free nation.
('77', 136, 1, 5, 261380) I had thought that Dominion Status according to the Status of Westminster was equivalent to independence.
('77', 136, 1, 6, 261486) The expression Dominion Status has a special connotation.
('77', 136, 1, 7, 261544) It refers to a commonwealth of whites who are themselves pillars of imperialism engaged in exploiting the non European races whom they regard as uncivilized.
('77', 136, 1, 8, 261702) India free will be no party to such exploitation.
('77', 136, 1, 9, 261752) But there is nothing to prevent free India from entering into an alliance with British for the protection of the freedom of all, whether black, brown or white.
('77', 136, 1, 10, 261912) Therefore, if Dominion Status is less than independence, India cannot be satisfied with less.
('77', 136, 1, 11, 262006) If it is synonymous with independence, then India has to choose how she would describe her status.
('77', 136, 1, 12, 262105) The critic then condemns the Congress for not coming to terms with the Muslim League.
('77', 136, 1, 13, 262191) It is a pity that even responsible Englishmen will not take the trouble to study questions which they judge freely.
('77', 136, 1, 14, 262307) The Congress has never given up the effort to solve the communal question.
('77', 136, 1, 15, 262382) It is even now engaged in the difficult task.
('77', 136, 1, 16, 262428) But it is wrong to use Congress inability to reach a solution for keeping India from her destined goal.
('77', 136, 1, 17, 262532) British officials including Viceroys have admitted that they have ruled by following the policy of ‘divide and rule’.
('77', 136, 1, 18, 262650) The British established themselves by taking advantage of our internal quarrels and have remained by keeping them alive.
('77', 136, 1, 19, 262771) It is unnecessary for my argument to prove that the policy is being followed deliberately.
('77', 136, 1, 20, 262862) The British have made themselves believe that they are ruling because of our quarrels, and that they will gladly retire when we have ceased to quarrel.
('77', 136, 1, 21, 263014) Thus they are moving in a vicious circle.
('77', 136, 1, 22, 263056) The British rule must be permanent if the adjustment of the communal quarrel is a condition precedent to India becoming independent.
('77', 136, 1, 23, 263189) It is a purely domestic problem which we are bound to solve if we are to live at peace with one another.
('77', 136, 1, 24, 263294) May I remind the critic and those who argue like him that only a short while ago it was said that if the British withdrew, Hindus would be left to the mercy of the virile races from the north, that not a virgin would be safe or a monied man retain his wealth?
('77', 136, 1, 25, 263554) Now Princes and Muslims, who are able enough to protect themselves against the unarmed millions whom the Congress claims
('77', 137, 0, 1, 263675) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 138
('77', 137, 1, 2, 263717) specially to represent, are sought to be protected by the British bayonet against the latter!
('77', 137, 1, 3, 263811) Be that as it may, the Congress must pursue its even course.
('77', 137, 1, 4, 263872) It must work for communal unity in spite of odds against it.
('77', 137, 1, 5, 263933) It is a plank in its programme.
('77', 137, 1, 6, 263965) It is part of the non violent technique.
('77', 137, 1, 7, 264006) Another English critic has put the problem in a truer way.
('77', 137, 1, 8, 264065) He says among many other things: “British people feel that Great Britain needs to carry the Muslim world with her at this time of immense struggle.” I have no difficulty in sympathizing with this position.
('77', 137, 1, 9, 264271) Only let us clear the issues.
('77', 137, 1, 10, 264301) Great Britain cannot afford to risk defeat for the sake of doing justice.
('77', 137, 1, 11, 264375) This is just what an overwhelming number of Indians feel.
('77', 137, 1, 12, 264433) The Congress, before it can offer ungrudging support to Britain, wants to feel sure that hers is an absolutely just cause.
('77', 137, 1, 13, 264556) The recent events have created a grave doubt about it.
('77', 137, 1, 14, 264611) Absolute protection of the rights of minorities is a greater concern of the Congress than it ever can be of Great Britain.
('77', 137, 1, 15, 264734) The Congress dare not seek and cannot get justice, if it is not prepared to do it itself.
('77', 137, 1, 16, 264824) To be above suspicion is the only way open to non violent organizations.
('77', 137, 1, 17, 264897) But British policy may make a just solution impossible at the present moment.
('77', 137, 2, 18, 264975) SEGAON, November 28, 1939 Harijan, 2 12 1939
('77', 137, 3, 19, 265020) 165. BAFFLING SITUATION
('77', 137, 4, 20, 265044) Jawaharlal, born democrat as he is, had arranged for a free talk 1
('77', 137, 5, 21, 265111) between the Executive Council of the U. P. P. C. C. and me.
('77', 137, 5, 22, 265171) We had three such talks.
('77', 137, 5, 23, 265196) I had expected that the talks would result in a parting of the ways.
('77', 137, 5, 24, 265265) Among the Congressmen whom I was facing there were some who had laughed at the charkha and non violence.
('77', 137, 5, 25, 265370) But to my utter astonishment I found them reconciled to both.
('77', 137, 5, 26, 265432) It is a baffling situation both for Congressmen and me.
('77', 137, 5, 27, 265488) I do not know whether I am wise in bearing the heavy responsibility of leading Congressmen who only the other day had no faith in me.
('77', 137, 5, 28, 265622) Are they not paying too great a price for my leadership in
('77', 137, 6, 29, 265681) 1 Vide “Discussion with U.P.P.C.C. Executive Council Members”, 23 11 1939.

('77', 138, 1, 2, 265805) a battle?
('77', 138, 1, 3, 265815) If they render obedience without faith, is it good for them or me?
('77', 138, 1, 4, 265882) Can I lead them to success?
('77', 138, 1, 5, 265910) If I was not good enough in peace, how can I be good in war?
('77', 138, 1, 6, 265971) There was no peace.
('77', 138, 1, 7, 265991) The Congress is at war with Great Britain till independence is won.
('77', 138, 1, 8, 266059) War had never ceased; only civil disobedience had been suspended for better and greater preparation.
('77', 138, 1, 9, 266160) Congressmen who did not obey instructions during the preparatoryperiod were surely not fit soldiers on active duty.
('77', 138, 1, 10, 266276) And yet I could not distrust the responsible men who faced me in Allahabad.
('77', 138, 1, 11, 266352) What is true of them is true of the other Congressmen in the other provinces.
('77', 138, 1, 12, 266430) And so I am shouldering the burden.
('77', 138, 1, 13, 266466) Let me then think aloud.
('77', 138, 1, 14, 266491) I hope that Congressmen will make it a point to read Harijan as if it was a weekly bulletin containing instructions for them.
('77', 138, 1, 15, 266617) To the impatient Congressmen I say: I see no immediate prospect of declaring civil disobedience.
('77', 138, 1, 16, 266714) There can be no civil disobedience for the sake of embarrassing Great Britain.
('77', 138, 1, 17, 266793) It will come when it becomes clearly inevitable.
('77', 138, 1, 18, 266842) Probably it will come by the goading of the official world.
('77', 138, 1, 19, 266902) I do not doubt the honesty of the Viceroy or that of the Secretary of State.
('77', 138, 1, 20, 266979) At the same time I have no doubt whatsoever that they are in error because they cannot get out of the old rut to which they are used.
('77', 138, 1, 21, 267113) We must give them time to collect themselves.
('77', 138, 1, 22, 267159) We must do real propaganda by way of educating the public both here and abroad.
('77', 138, 1, 23, 267239) We cannot all of a sudden dispel the surrounding misunderstandings, not merely on the part of the British people but of our own countrymen.
('77', 138, 1, 24, 267379) There is no mistaking the fact that many non Congress Muslims honestly think that the Congress Ministers did not pay enough heed to Muslim complaints.
('77', 138, 1, 25, 267530) Congressmen wedded to non violence have to give special heed to the complaints of non Congress Muslims.
('77', 138, 1, 26, 267634) It is no use saying that they are frivolous.
('77', 138, 1, 27, 267679) I know myself that many complaints have been frivolous.
('77', 138, 1, 28, 267735) But we have to be patient and courteous enough to take them seriously and endeavour to show clearly that they are frivolous.
('77', 138, 1, 29, 267860) I do not wish to suggest that pains were not taken to deal with them.
('77', 138, 1, 30, 267930) I am just now concerned with the phenomenon that the complaints persist.
('77', 138, 1, 31, 268003) We must, therefore, give time to demonstrating that there never has been anything in the complaints.
('77', 138, 1, 32, 268104) If in the course of further investigation we discover errors, we must make amends.
('77', 138, 1, 33, 268187) We must prove to the Muslim countrymen and to the world that the Congress does not want independence at the sacrifice of a single legitimate interest, be it Muslim or other.
('77', 138, 1, 34, 268361) We may leave no stone unturned to
('77', 139, 0, 1, 268395) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 140
('77', 139, 1, 2, 268437) carry the minorities with us.
('77', 139, 1, 3, 268467) This meticulous care for the rights of the least among us is the sine qua non of non violence.
('77', 139, 1, 4, 268562) If it is true, as it is, that for the British Government to plead want of communal unity as a bar to independence is wrong, it is equally true that this discord is, nevertheless, a serious handicap in our march towards swaraj.
('77', 139, 1, 5, 268789) If we had the Muslim League and others with us, our demand would become irresistible.
('77', 139, 1, 6, 268875) So much for the external difficulties.
('77', 139, 1, 7, 268914) Not till we have given sufficient time to their solution, can we possibly think of civil disobedience.
('77', 139, 1, 8, 269017) The internal weakness is no less great.
('77', 139, 1, 9, 269057) I see a vital connection between the charkha and non violence.
('77', 139, 1, 10, 269120) Even as certain minimum qualifcations are indispensable in a soldier in arms, so are certain other and even opposite qualifications indispensable in a non violent soldier, i.
('77', 139, 1, 11, 269295) e., a satyagrahi.
('77', 139, 1, 12, 269313) One of these latter is adequate skill in spinning and its anterior processes.
('77', 139, 1, 13, 269391) A satyagrahi occupies himself in productive work.
('77', 139, 1, 14, 269441) There is no easier and better productive work for millions than spinning.
('77', 139, 1, 15, 269515) What is more, it has been an integral part of the non violent programme since its commencement.
('77', 139, 1, 16, 269611) Civilization based on non violence must be different from that organized for violence.
('77', 139, 1, 17, 269698) Let not Congressmen trifle with this fundamental fact.
('77', 139, 1, 18, 269753) I repeat what I have said a thousand times that, if millions spun for swaraj and in the spirit of non violence, there will probably be no necessity for civil disobedience.
('77', 139, 1, 19, 269925) It will be a constructive effort such as the world has not witnessed before.
('77', 139, 1, 20, 270002) It is the surest method of converting the ‘enemy’.
('77', 139, 1, 21, 270053) The Working Committee desired to appoint me as its sole representative to carry on negotiations that may be necessary and to conduct the campaign of civil disobedience if they failed.
('77', 139, 1, 22, 270237) It was a burden I could not carry.
('77', 139, 1, 23, 270272) Being boxed up in Segaon, I have no direct touch with the people.
('77', 139, 1, 24, 270338) I have no confidence, I should have none, in my unaided judgment requiring an accurate first hand knowledge of many facts.
('77', 139, 1, 25, 270461) I could only act with the constant guidance and direction of the Working Committee.
('77', 139, 1, 26, 270545) I shall carry on no negotiations to finality.
('77', 139, 1, 27, 270591) I should be pleased if I was relieved of the burden.
('77', 139, 1, 28, 270644) But I shall not shrink from any responsibility, so long as I carry the confidence and affection of the Working Committee and Congressmen in general and so long as I feel that I have the requisite qualifications.

('77', 140, 1, 2, 270950) 166. SIND RIOTS
('77', 140, 2, 3, 270966) I have been following the riots 1 in Sind with painful interest.
('77', 140, 2, 4, 271031) Many people delude themselves with the belief that I possess powers to remedy all wrongs.
('77', 140, 2, 5, 271121) I wish I had them, though I am not sure that such possession will be an unmixed blessing.
('77', 140, 2, 6, 271211) I should make people helpless if I made an indiscriminate use of such powers.
('77', 140, 2, 7, 271289) And they would be of no use, if I might not use them freely.
('77', 140, 2, 8, 271350) As it is, I use what powers I have to the fullest extent.
('77', 140, 2, 9, 271408) Thank God, they are too limited to be harmful.
('77', 140, 2, 10, 271455) My chief work, however, is to teach people to help themselves.
('77', 140, 2, 11, 271518) Here is a pathetic wire from Shikarpur :
('77', 140, 3, 12, 271559) Riots, loot, incendiarism, Sukkur District villages Hindus mercilessly
('77', 140, 4, 13, 271630) butchered, women and girls raped and kidnapped.
('77', 140, 4, 14, 271678) Hindu life, property unsafe.
('77', 140, 5, 15, 271707) Situation most critical.
('77', 140, 5, 16, 271732) Government policy not firm.
('77', 140, 5, 17, 271760) Pray send enquiry
('77', 140, 6, 18, 271778) committee immediately to see situation personally.
('77', 140, 6, 19, 271829) It is the third of its kind from Sind.
('77', 140, 6, 20, 271868) I took no notice of the first two mainly because I was preoccupied in Allahabad and I had no concrete consolation to offer.
('77', 140, 6, 21, 271992) The Shikarpur Panchayat has come to the wrong person for help.
('77', 140, 6, 22, 272055) For I am myself helpless.
('77', 140, 6, 23, 272081) The Congress has not yet sufficiently advanced in non violence to deal with riots and the like.
('77', 140, 6, 24, 272177) It must develop it enough to deal with such situations if it is to retain its prestige.
('77', 140, 6, 25, 272265) I suggested ‘peace brigades’, but the suggestion proved premature if not unworkable.
('77', 140, 6, 26, 272350) No doubt the Sind Government should be able to protect life and property of the people within their jurisdiction.
('77', 140, 6, 27, 272464) Evidently the matter has gone beyond their control.
('77', 140, 6, 28, 272516) Sind is nominally autonomous and to that extent less able to protect life and property than the preceding Government.
('77', 140, 6, 29, 272634) For it has never had previous training in the police or the military arts.
('77', 140, 6, 30, 272709) I have shown in previous writings that the Central Government is impotent to prevent loss of life, property and worse during riots.
('77', 140, 6, 31, 272841) It is able to check their spread and punish the wrongdoers when it wishes.
('77', 140, 6, 32, 272916) It is organized solely for the protection of imperial trade and therefore for the maintenance of peace in so far as it is necessary for the safety of that
('77', 140, 7, 33, 273071) 1 The riots broke out on October 1, 1939, when Muslims at Sukkur launched a satyagraha with a view to securing possession of Manzalgah and, on November 20, the Sind Government had to meet the acts of violence by opening of fire.
('77', 141, 0, 1, 273300) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 142
('77', 141, 1, 2, 273342) Hence it is ill equipped for real protection of the people.
('77', 141, 1, 3, 273402) Such protection involves the training of the people in the art of self defence and securing their co operation in quelling riots, etc.
('77', 141, 1, 4, 273537) This would be putting imperial rule in jeopardy.
('77', 141, 1, 5, 273586) Now the only effective way in which I can help the Sindhis is to show them the way of non violence.
('77', 141, 1, 6, 273686) But that cannot be learnt in a day.
('77', 141, 1, 7, 273722) The other way is the way the world has followed hitherto, i.
('77', 141, 1, 8, 273783) e., armed defence of life and property.
('77', 141, 1, 9, 273823) God helps only those who help themselves.
('77', 141, 1, 10, 273865) The Sindhis are no exception.
('77', 141, 1, 11, 273895) They must learn the art of defending themselves against robbers, raiders and the like.
('77', 141, 1, 12, 273982) If they do not feel safe and are too weak to defend themselves, they should leave the place which has proved too inhospitable to live in.

('77', 145, 8, 12, 278402) 174. THE MORAL ISSUE
('77', 145, 9, 13, 278423) I release the following correspondence 3 between a Western friend and me as of general interest.
('77', 145, 10, 14, 278520) The Congress resolution 4 calling upon the British to define their objectives, especially as regards the subordinated peoples of the Empire, and India in particular, seemed to me very fine.
('77', 145, 10, 15, 278710) It put the moral issues squarely up to the Imperial Government, and made India stand forth with a wonderful dignity in the midst of the evil atmosphere of selfish and unidealistic expendiency that seems at present to govern statesmen in their handling of world relations.
('77', 145, 11, 16, 278982) I find myself cent per cent at one with the attitude and action of the Congress.
('77', 145, 11, 17, 279063) But there are certain other matters in which I am unable to see quite eye to eye.
('77', 145, 12, 18, 279145) To begin with it seems to me that there has been a certain ten dency to treat the question as if it were merely one of “helping” the
('77', 145, 13, 19, 279278) 1 Maganlal Gandhi’s daughter, married to Benarsilal Bazaj 2 Addressee’s younger sister 3 Only extracts from the correspondent’s letter are reproduced here.
('77', 145, 13, 20, 279434) 4 Dated September 14, 1939; vide Appendix “Working Committee’s Mani festo”, 14 9 1939.

('77', 146, 1, 2, 279570) British, and that, if the British wanted India to help them, it was up to them to give way to India’s just demands.

('77', 148, 10, 16, 285497) 177. MY HANDICAP 1
('77', 148, 11, 17, 285516) I wonder if all journalists, having to write in English, feel the handicap which I do.
('77', 148, 11, 18, 285603) The reflection arises from a stupid use I made of the verb ‘cavil’ in my note on a learned Englishman’s letter partly reproduced in Harijan of 2nd December.
('77', 148, 11, 19, 285760) 2 In my comment I said,
('77', 148, 12, 20, 285784) 1 This appeared under “Notes”.
('77', 148, 12, 21, 285815) 2 Vide “The Pity of It”, 28 11 1939.
('77', 149, 0, 1, 285852) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 150
('77', 149, 1, 2, 285894) “The writer seems to cavil at the demand for independence as distinguished from Dominion Status.” The learned writer draws my attention to the meaning of the word ‘cavil’ as implying captious criticism of which, he says, he was wholly unconscious.
('77', 149, 1, 3, 286142) I take great care in the use of English words.
('77', 149, 1, 4, 286189) With all my care, however, I cannot make up for my imperfect knowledge of a foreign tongue.
('77', 149, 1, 5, 286281) I had never known the dictionary meaning of the word.
('77', 149, 1, 6, 286335) I must have picked up the word in the course of reading or hearing.
('77', 149, 1, 7, 286403) I had hitherto given it an innocent meaning in the sense of strongly objecting.
('77', 149, 1, 8, 286483) Knowing the writer as I do, I could never think of him as raising captious objection.
('77', 149, 1, 9, 286569) I have apologized to him for the unconscious error.
('77', 149, 1, 10, 286621) 3 It is good that he drew my attention to it.
('77', 149, 1, 11, 286667) Heaven only knows how often, though wholly unconsciously, I must have offended persons simply because of my ignorance of the English language and its subtle idiom and usage.
('77', 149, 1, 12, 286841) The language expands with the expansion of its people.
('77', 149, 1, 13, 286896) I must struggle in the best manner I can and expect the indulgence of the English readers who, knowing my limitations, should believe that, where my language seems to offend, the offence is wholly unintended.

('77', 151, 6, 11, 289549) 182. TO CORRESPONDENTS AND MESSAGE SEEKERS 3
('77', 151, 7, 12, 289594) I have often enough said in these columns that I am not in a position to read or acknowledge letters or send messages for numerous celebrations or functions.
('77', 151, 7, 13, 289752) I have neither the time nor energy for the task.
('77', 151, 7, 14, 289801) My helpers too cannot cope with the volume of correspondence that comes daily.
('77', 151, 7, 15, 289880) Often there are pamphlets and reports accompanying the correspondence in the various languages of India besides English.
('77', 151, 7, 16, 290001) The result is that only the correspondence that must be seen by me is placed before me.
('77', 151, 7, 17, 290089) The balance is disposed of by Mahadev Desai, Pyarelal and Rajkumari Amrit Kaur, when she happens to be with me, or Dr. Sushila Nayyar when she has time from her medical work and when there is an overflow.
('77', 151, 7, 18, 290294) In these circumstances I must ask my correspondence to spare me.
('77', 151, 7, 19, 290359) Time was when I used to read every letter that was received and acknowledge most.
('77', 151, 7, 20, 290441) That gave me an insight into the Indian mind that I would never have had otherwise.
('77', 151, 7, 21, 290525) But I was then in possession of youth and health.
('77', 151, 7, 22, 290575) Age has now overtaken me, and health requires a watchful care.
('77', 151, 7, 23, 290638) Yet both the correspondence and the problems have increased.
('77', 151, 7, 24, 290699) I would request correspondents to write only when there is something which, in their opinion, I alone can attend to.
('77', 151, 7, 25, 290816) But what is more needed is forbearance on their part.
('77', 151, 7, 26, 290870) If they do not receive answers or
('77', 151, 8, 27, 290904) 1 Daughter of Abbas Tyabji 2 Sarojini Nanavati 3 This appeared under “Notes”.

('77', 152, 1, 5, 291206) I was not able to cope with it.

('77', 152, 2, 19, 292238) 183. INDEPENDENCE
('77', 152, 3, 20, 292256) From a correspondent’s letter I take the following extract:
('77', 152, 4, 21, 292316) While you ask for India’s independence you promise nothing in return.
('77', 152, 4, 22, 292386) Don’t you think a promise of active partnership would show a spirit of reciprocity and may well be given?
('77', 152, 4, 23, 292492) Co operation and interdependence, is the law of life.
('77', 152, 4, 24, 292546) India is in no position, even if it gets independence, to be able to retain it.
('77', 152, 4, 25, 292626) In Anglo Indian partnership is our best hope, and a ‘Constituent Assembly’ on a wide franchise will only make confusion worse confounded.
('77', 152, 4, 26, 292764) This work can only be rightly done by a few wise men.
('77', 152, 4, 27, 292818) In the first place, the Congress has not asked for independence.
('77', 152, 4, 28, 292883) It has asked for a declaration of Britain’s war aims.
('77', 152, 4, 29, 292937) Secondly, independence, when it comes, will come because India is ripe for it.
('77', 152, 4, 30, 293016) Therefore there can be no consideration to be given for it.
('77', 152, 4, 31, 293076) It is not a marketable thing.
('77', 152, 4, 32, 293106) It is a status.
('77', 152, 4, 33, 293122) This, however, does not mean a frog in the well status.
('77', 152, 4, 34, 293178) There may or may not be an alliance with Britain.
('77', 152, 4, 35, 293228) My hope is that there will be.
('77', 152, 4, 36, 293259) So long as I have a share in the attainment of independence, it will be through non violent means and,
('77', 153, 0, 1, 293362) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 154
('77', 153, 1, 2, 293404) therefore, a result of an honourable treaty or settlement with Britain.
('77', 153, 1, 3, 293476) I must dissent from the correspondent’s view that “India is in no position, even if it gets independence, to be able to retain it.” This is surely a contradiction in terms.
('77', 153, 1, 4, 293649) The correspondent has involved himself in it because he thinks that independence can be a gift from someone.
('77', 153, 1, 5, 293758) India will never have it until it is able to keep it against the whole world.
('77', 153, 1, 6, 293836) The alliance with Britain will be not for India’s protection but for mutual benefit.
('77', 153, 1, 7, 293921) So long as she needs Britain’s protection for whatever cause, her status will be less than indepen dence.
('77', 153, 1, 8, 294027) We see the mockery of it going on in Europe today among the small nations.
('77', 153, 1, 9, 294102) Their independence is on the sufferance of big nations.
('77', 153, 1, 10, 294158) I attach little importance to such independence.
('77', 153, 1, 11, 294207) So long as the basis of society is force, smaller nations must hold their status on sufferance.
('77', 153, 1, 12, 294303) I should not be interested in India being in such a position.
('77', 153, 1, 13, 294365) And India is not a small nation.
('77', 153, 1, 14, 294398) I would far rather have India engaged indefinitely in a non violent fight for gaining her indepen dence than be satisfied with anything less as her goal.
('77', 153, 1, 15, 294552) She can settle down to peace only when she has independence which she can hold against any combination.
('77', 153, 1, 16, 294656) This is possible only on a non violent basis.
('77', 153, 1, 17, 294702) It may be far off.
('77', 153, 1, 18, 294721) It may not be realized in my lifetime.
('77', 153, 1, 19, 294760) It may even take generations.
('77', 153, 1, 20, 294790) I have patience enough to wait.
('77', 153, 1, 21, 294822) Joy lies in the fight, in the attempt, in the suffering involved, not in the victory itself.
('77', 153, 1, 22, 294915) For, victory is implied in such an attempt.
('77', 153, 1, 23, 294959) I see no difficulty in a Constituent Assembly elected on a wide franchise.
('77', 153, 1, 24, 295034) But I do in an Assembly of wise men.
('77', 153, 1, 25, 295071) Where are they?
('77', 153, 1, 26, 295087) Who will certify to their wisdom?
('77', 153, 1, 27, 295121) SEGAON, December 17, 1939 Harijan, 23 12 1939
('77', 153, 2, 28, 295167) 184. FAITH v.
('77', 153, 3, 29, 295181) Circumstances have placed me here in the midst of some ‘ultramodern’, ‘rational minded’ young officers, who jeer at me, pooh pooh me and consider me a brainless idiot for I cannot fall in with them and consider ‘good’ and ‘bad’, vice and virtue as mere matters of social expediency.
('77', 153, 3, 30, 295464) Something in me tells me that they are wrong and I am right.
('77', 153, 3, 31, 295525) I still believe that a moral code on the basis of something like ‘absolute good’ does exist.
('77', 153, 3, 32, 295618) My friends argue with me to convince me that drinking of wine is as bad as drinking of tea or coffee.
('77', 153, 3, 33, 295720) They insist that morality cannot depend on what a person eats or drinks.
('77', 154, 0, 1, 295793) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 155
('77', 154, 1, 2, 295842) Further,—and it is on this point chiefly that I would pray for your advice—they say that sex taboo was meant to keep the social structure safe.
('77', 154, 1, 3, 295986) Their contention is that sex enjoyment, which harms no person and leads to no trouble is perfectly natural and hence moral.
('77', 154, 1, 4, 296110) Too much indulgence, they say, is as bad as overeating oneself and nothing more.
('77', 154, 1, 5, 296191) A principle which is justifiable with one’s wife cannot be inherently immoral with another person.
('77', 154, 1, 6, 296290) Circumstances must decide, and it is always a question of more or less.
('77', 154, 1, 7, 296362) There is nothing like an absolute code of morals.
('77', 154, 2, 8, 296412) Though my faith gets a shock and I sense some flaw in their argument, yet in actual combat they always corner me, and I have to take shelter under my sixth sense which they call blind prejudice.
('77', 154, 3, 9, 296607) In fact, they have smashed my intellectual comprehension of the matter, and I have begun to doubt the soundness of my position.
('77', 154, 3, 10, 296735) Yet I told them I would prefer to be with men like you and go to hell rather than be with them and enjoy the Kingdom of Heaven.
('77', 154, 4, 11, 296863) So please, Mahatmaji, save me from this intellectual and spiritual torment with a bit of your mind.
('77', 154, 4, 12, 296963) I do hope you would not fail me.
('77', 154, 4, 13, 296996) This is almost the whole of a young officer’s letter.
('77', 154, 4, 14, 297050) His case is typical of many.
('77', 154, 4, 15, 297079) Those who have read my book of experiments 1
('77', 154, 5, 16, 297124) know how I had to pass through similar experiences.
('77', 154, 5, 17, 297176) I would refer all who have difficulties like my correspondent’s to read the relevant chapters in those ‘experiments’.
('77', 154, 5, 18, 297294) Reason is a poor thing in the midst of temptation.
('77', 154, 5, 19, 297345) Faith alone can save us.
('77', 154, 5, 20, 297370) Reason appears to be on the side of those who indulge in drink and free love.
('77', 154, 5, 21, 297448) The fact is that reason is blurred on such occasions.
('77', 154, 5, 22, 297502) It follows the instinct.
('77', 154, 5, 23, 297527) Do not lawyers ranged on opposite sides make reason appear to be on their side?
('77', 154, 5, 24, 297607) And yet one of them must be wrong, or it may be that both are.
('77', 154, 5, 25, 297670) Hence faith in the rightness of one’s moral position is the only bulwark against the attack of reason.
('77', 154, 5, 26, 297773) The arguments advanced by my correspondent’s tempters are plausible.
('77', 154, 5, 27, 297842) There is no such thing as absolute morality for all times.
('77', 154, 5, 28, 297901) But there is a relative morality which is absolute enough for imperfect mortals that we are.
('77', 154, 5, 29, 297994) Thus, it is absolutely immoral to drink spirituous liquors except as medicine, in medicinal doses and under medical advice.
('77', 154, 5, 30, 298118) Similarly, it is absolutely wrong to see lustfully any woman other than one’s wife.
('77', 154, 5, 31, 298202) Both these positions have been proved by cold reason.

('77', 156, 4, 7, 300453) 187. WHO IS A SANATANIST ?
('77', 156, 6, 8, 300480) ¸ A sanatanist is one who follows the sanatana dharma.
('77', 156, 6, 9, 300535) According to Mahabharata it means observance of ahimsa, satya, non stealing, cleanliness and self restraint.
('77', 156, 6, 10, 300644) As I have been endeavouring to follow these to the best of my ability, I have not hesitated to describe myself as a sanatanist.
('77', 156, 6, 11, 300772) But during the anti untouchability campaign my description of myself as a sanatanist was resented by those who opposed me.
('77', 156, 6, 12, 300895) They styled themselves sanatanists.
('77', 156, 6, 13, 300931) I did not engage in a quarrel over the name.
('77', 156, 6, 14, 300976) And so I have described the opponents by the name they have chosen for themselves.
('77', 156, 6, 15, 301059) Now a letter has been received by me from a correspondent writing on behalf of the Sanatana Dharma Pratinidhi Sabha, Punjab, protesting against my calling the opponents sanatanist which, they say, would imply that all sanatanists believe in untouchability and take delight in painting me in black colours.
('77', 156, 6, 16, 301365) The letter proceeds :
('77', 156, 7, 17, 301387) To tell the truth it has pained us very much, and we are afraid our religious and social work in the Punjab will suffer.
('77', 156, 7, 18, 301508) Mahatmaji, you being nearer to Deccan know more of the sanatanists of the South than of us of the North.
('77', 156, 7, 19, 301613) Here, in the Punjab, we have been advocating temple entry and other facilities
('77', 156, 8, 20, 301692) 1 Truth, self restraint, penance, purity, contentment, modesty, forbearance, uprightness, knowledge, serenity, compassion and meditation—this is the eternal (sanatana) dharma.
('77', 156, 8, 21, 301868) Freedom from malice towards all creatures, in thought, word and deed, kindness and charity— this is the eternal dharma of the good.

('77', 159, 1, 2, 306273) was first taken in 1930 1 Ten years is not a short time.
('77', 159, 1, 3, 306330) If Congressmen had honestly lived up to the constructive pro gramme of 1920, there would be purna swaraj today.
('77', 159, 1, 4, 306442) There would be communal harmony, there would be purification of Hinduism and smiling faces in India’s villages.
('77', 159, 1, 5, 306554) These together would produce such a momentum that independence could not be resisted.

('77', 159, 1, 7, 306751) They have not believed that the triple programme is non violence in action.
('77', 159, 1, 8, 306827) They have not believed that civil disobedience could not be successfully carried out without fulfilling it.
('77', 159, 1, 9, 306935) Therefore I have not hesitated to remark in these columns that our non violence has been non violent conduct born of impotence.
('77', 159, 1, 10, 307063) Hence we witness the sorry spectacle of us confessing that, though this non violence of the weak may bring us freedom from English rule, it cannot enable us to resist foreign invasion.
('77', 159, 1, 11, 307248) This fact—and it is a fact—shows that, if the English yield to the non violence, miscalled, of the weak, it would prove that they had almost made up their mind to surrender power and would not hold on to it at the cost of creating frightfulness.
('77', 159, 1, 12, 307494) Congressmen should not be surprised, if I would not declare civil disobedience unless I was morally certain that they had understood the full significance of non violence and that they were carrying out the triple programme with as much zest as they would offer civil disobedience, so called.
('77', 159, 1, 13, 307787) They would perhaps now understand why I call the three items of the programme essentials of non violence.
