('77', 163, 1, 2, 315644) 194. SPINNING WHEELS V. MILLS Congressmen should not weary of my filling these columns with everything about the charkha and khadi.
('77', 163, 1, 3, 315776) Heart peace among communities and reinstatement of the wheel in every home are my politics, for I expect to gain the freedom of the country from political and economic bondage through these means in the place of red rebellion.
('77', 163, 1, 4, 316003) The problem before every Congressman is how to displace mill cloth, whether foreign or indigenous.
('77', 163, 1, 5, 316102) It is often believed in Congress circles that indigenous mill cloth is as good as khadi and superior because of its cheapness.
('77', 163, 1, 6, 316229) The cheapness theory in terms of the crores of artisans has been exploded.
('77', 163, 1, 7, 316304) Mill spun for these millions is dearer than hand spun.
('77', 163, 1, 8, 316359) The former means deprivation of their wages.
('77', 163, 1, 9, 316404) Imagine what would happen if, on the score of foreign wheat being cheaper, the wheat grower was displaced !
('77', 163, 1, 10, 316512) If the village spinners and weavers are to come into their own, and that quickly, every Congressman has to become a master spinner and master weaver.
('77', 163, 1, 11, 316662) He should be able to teach and guide the poor villagers.
('77', 163, 1, 12, 316719) He has to be a khadi technician.
('77', 163, 1, 13, 316752) He has to spin for the sake of the country.
('77', 163, 1, 14, 316796) I have shown that khadi cannot be made cheap enough for the middle class unless there is enough sacrificial yarn or unless the spinner is put upon the old begar 1 wage of one pice to one anna for eight hours’ strenuous spinning.
('77', 163, 1, 15, 317025) No congressman would put in the required labour and skill unless he believed that the indigenous factory, mills had to be and could be replaced by the charkha and the handloom.
('77', 163, 1, 16, 317202) If Congressmen have this faith, all congress organizations will become efficient spinning and weaving schools.
('77', 163, 1, 17, 317313) I remember how in 1921 Congress offices used to collect indifferently spun yarn and expect it to be woven somehow.
('77', 163, 1, 18, 317428) It was all a huge waste.
('77', 163, 1, 19, 317453) Nobody knew how to deal with it nor what to do to ensure good spinning.
('77', 163, 1, 20, 317525) Things are different now.
('77', 163, 1, 21, 317551) Much knowledge and exper ience have been gained by the A. I. S. A. Some literature has also been published.
('77', 163, 1, 22, 317659) Every Congress office should become a model laboratory and spinning and weaving institute for the organization of villages.
('77', 163, 1, 23, 317783) And, as I have suggested, khadi is the centre round which other village industries should revolve and be organized.
('77', 163, 1, 24, 317899) Congressmen will discover the tremendous possibilities of this kind of service.
('77', 163, 1, 25, 317979) It is chiefly mental
('77', 163, 2, 26, 318000) 1 Forced labour
('77', 164, 0, 1, 318016) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 165
('77', 164, 1, 2, 318065) lethargy that is in the way of quick and successful organization of villages.
('77', 164, 1, 3, 318143) I suggest that, if India is to evolve along non violent lines, it will have to decentralize many things.
('77', 164, 1, 4, 318248) Centralization cannot be sustained and defended without adequate force.
('77', 164, 1, 5, 318320) Simple homes from which there is nothing to take away require no policing; the palaces of the rich must have strong guards to protect them against dacoity.
('77', 164, 1, 6, 318476) So must huge factories.
('77', 164, 1, 7, 318500) Rurally organized India will run less risk of foreign invasion than urbanized India, well equipped with military, naval and air forces.
('77', 164, 1, 8, 318636) Assuming then that Congressmen have understood the meaning and implications of the charkha, they would, without a moment’s delay, set about qualifying themselves for the service.
('77', 164, 1, 9, 318815) Assume further that they are novices.
('77', 164, 1, 10, 318853) Then they will procure some cotton, preferably grown in their villages, taluks or districts.
('77', 164, 1, 11, 318946) They should gin it with the hand or at the most on a board with the help of a rod.
('77', 164, 1, 12, 319029) They will keep the seed and, when they have enough, either sell it or use it for their cattle if they have any.
('77', 164, 1, 13, 319141) They will card the cotton with a hand bow, costing next to nothing.
('77', 164, 1, 14, 319209) They can improvise one themselves.
('77', 164, 1, 15, 319244) This carded cotton should be turned into slivers.
('77', 164, 1, 16, 319294) These will be spun on the takli.
('77', 164, 1, 17, 319327) When they have fairly mastered these processess, they can proceed to speedier ones.
('77', 164, 1, 18, 319411) They will also put themselves and the members of their families right regarding the use of khadi.
('77', 164, 1, 19, 319509) They will keep an accurate record of their daily progress and will learn the arithmetic of yarn.
('77', 164, 1, 20, 319606) Congress committees will rearrange their offices with the help of the local A. I. S. A. branch and convert them into spinning and weaving depots.
('77', 164, 1, 21, 319752) I must warn Congressmen against the fatal error of sending to distant depots their yarn for weaving.
('77', 164, 1, 22, 319853) The economics of khadi require that from cultivation of cotton to the manufacture of khadi and its disposal all the processes should, as far as possible, be gone through in the same village or centre.
('77', 164, 1, 23, 320054) Thus, it is wrong to spin yarn in the Punjab, weave it in Bombay, and sell in Malabar the khadi thus manufactured.
('77', 164, 1, 24, 320169) If Congressmen and committees attend to this simple rule when beginning khadi work, they will not find themselves appalled by the difficulty of the task.
('77', 164, 1, 25, 320323) If they succeed in their own district, there is no reason why the other 249 districts should not be successfully organized.
('77', 164, 1, 26, 320447) The reasoning is valid even if villages were treated as units.
('77', 164, 1, 27, 320510) It must be confessed that we have not as yet one single village organized in that fashion.
('77', 164, 1, 28, 320601) Certainly Segaon is not, even though I am supposed to be living in it.
('77', 164, 1, 29, 320672) My failure, however, need not dismay a worker who will make the organization of his own village his sole occupation.

('77', 165, 1, 2, 320877) 195. NOTES
('77', 165, 2, 3, 320888) THE LATE ACHARYA RAMDEVJI The death of Acharya Ramdev removes from our midst a notable Arya Samaj leader and worker.
('77', 165, 2, 4, 321005) Next to Swami Shraddhanandji he was maker of Kangri Gurukul.
('77', 165, 2, 5, 321066) So far as I know he was the Swamiji’s right hand man.
('77', 165, 2, 6, 321120) As a teacher he was very popular.
('77', 165, 2, 7, 321154) Latterly he had thrown himself with his characteristic energy in the running of the Kanya Gurukul in Dehradun and was the guide and supporter of Kumari Vidyavati.
('77', 165, 2, 8, 321317) He was her only collector whilst he was alive.
('77', 165, 2, 9, 321364) She did not have to worry over the financial side of the institution.
('77', 165, 2, 10, 321434) I know what an irreparable deprivation his death is to her and her institution.
('77', 165, 2, 11, 321514) The Gurukul should be put beyond financial stress by those who knew the late Acharya, who value female education, and who know the worth of Kumari Vidyavati and the institution.
('77', 165, 2, 12, 321692) Such a collection would be a most suitable memorial to the departed Acharya.
('77', 165, 2, 13, 321769) SAD NEWS FROM BIHAR I had a wire from Bihar complaining that Harijans, who have hitherto had no complaints against Congressmen, had not been put forward as they might have been as Congress nominees during the recent local board elections, and that those who had come forward had not received fair play.
('77', 165, 2, 14, 322072) The wire further complained that Shri Rajendra Babu who was informed of the fact had interested himself but was not listened to.
('77', 165, 2, 15, 322201) It seems that almost the same thing may be said about Muslims.
('77', 165, 2, 16, 322264) There were honourable exceptions, no doubt.
('77', 165, 2, 17, 322308) The complaint is that the congress has failed to fulfil the expectations raised by it.
('77', 165, 2, 18, 322395) Congressmen have to go out of their way to justify their claim for being national minded and impartial.
('77', 165, 2, 19, 322499) In a matter so simple as this Rajendra Babu’s energy should not be taxed at all.
('77', 165, 2, 20, 322580) Self seekers who want to serve their ends should have no place in the national organization.
('77', 165, 2, 21, 322673) It is any day better for the Congress to do without their influence.
('77', 165, 2, 22, 322742) I suggest that even at this juncture, if the complaint has foundation, the Bihar Provincial Congress Committee might redress the injustice by withdrawing some members to make room for deserving Muslims and Harijans.
('77', 165, 2, 23, 322958) It is never too late to be just.
('77', 165, 2, 24, 322991) SEGAON, December 25, 1939 Harijan, 30 12 1939
('77', 166, 0, 1, 323037) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 167
('77', 166, 1, 2, 323086) 196. A CASE FOR RELIEF 1
('77', 166, 2, 3, 323111) In many parts of India the competition of imported iron has killed the old village industry of iron smelting.
('77', 166, 2, 4, 323221) All round the village of Thettupalli in Chittoor, for example, where fifty years ago the smiths were active, lie ruined iron kilns.
('77', 166, 2, 5, 323353) Bazaar iron has successfully competed with the village iron of the Salahuva Vakkalu of Mysore, and has killed the smelting industry of the Telugu Kammaras.
('77', 166, 2, 6, 323509) In the Central Provinces, the small tribe of Agaria Gonds are in danger of suffering the same fate.
('77', 166, 3, 7, 323609) The Agaria Gonds are an aboriginal tribe of charcoal burners, iron smelters and blacksmiths who live along the heights of the Maikal Hills mainly in the Mandla and Bilaspur Districts, where excellent surface ore may be obtained.
('77', 166, 3, 8, 323838) In their case it is not the competition of foreign iron but an unimaginative and excessive tax that has almost ruined their once flourishing industry and brought its allied institutions to decay.
('77', 166, 3, 9, 324034) In 1867 the Agarias paid a sort of levy of four annas a kiln; today they have to pay ten rupees, or forty times as much.
('77', 166, 4, 10, 324155) Now these people are among the poorest in the world.
('77', 166, 4, 11, 324208) Innocent of possessions, undernourished, malaria ridden, they cannot afford such heavy taxes .
('77', 166, 5, 12, 324303) This is not only disastrous for the economic life of the tribe, but it has had serious repercussions on its religious and social institutions.
('77', 166, 5, 13, 324446) For the iron kiln is the centre, the living focus of the religion and traditions of the Agarias.
('77', 166, 5, 14, 324543) The disappearance of the kilns has had a depressing and disintegrating effect; if the process continues, it will mean not only the loss of useful village industry, but the extinction of a tribe.
('77', 166, 6, 15, 324738) Government is spending vast sums of money on village uplift and on the reorganization of village industries.
('77', 166, 6, 16, 324847) Here is an industry that can be revived immediately and at ridiculously small cost.
('77', 166, 6, 17, 324931) As there are only about one hundred kilns, this reduction of tax will mean a loss to Government of under five hundred rupees.
('77', 166, 6, 18, 325057) Surely this is not an excessive price to pay for the revitalization of a whole tribe.
('77', 166, 7, 19, 325143) At a time when the world is spending crores daily on iron that is destined to destroy mankind, let us be liberal and generous to these poor and simple iron workers who no more than to be allowed to live in peace.
('77', 166, 7, 20, 325356) I hope the required relief will be quickly granted and the poor Agaria Gonds will be saved from the impending disaster.
('77', 166, 7, 21, 325476) SEGAON, December 25, 1939 Harijan, 20 1 1940

('77', 169, 7, 18, 328921) 204. DISCUSSION WITH NAGPUR CONGRESS WORKERS 2
('77', 169, 8, 19, 328968) WARDHA, December 27, 1939
('77', 169, 9, 20, 328994) One of the things that seemed to trouble [the Nagpur Congressmen] was how, if it was wrong to offer satyagraha to an opponent in difficulty, we could ever offer it against the British Government, for so long as the present war continued, they were bound to be in difficulty.
('77', 169, 10, 21, 329269) 1 Vide “To Correspondents and Message Seekers”, 17 12 1939. 2 Mahadev Desai’s summary, from which this and the following item are reproduced, appeared with the note : “Gandhiji’s talks to the Congressmen who came to Wardha from surrounding places were not meant for publication.
('77', 169, 10, 22, 329548) But as incomplete and inaccurate paragraphs have crept into the Press, it has been thought advisable to give the foregoing summary.”
('77', 170, 0, 1, 329681) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 171
('77', 170, 1, 2, 329730) [GANDHIJI :] Satyagraha is a universal principle of which civil disobedience is one of the many applications.
('77', 170, 1, 3, 329840) Satyagraha goes on no matter whether the opponent is in difficulty or not, for offered in the proper spirit it is service of the opponent.
('77', 170, 1, 4, 329979) What is essential is that we should not embarrass an opponent who is in difficulty and make his difficulty our opportunity.
('77', 170, 1, 5, 330103) That is why civil disobedience, which can be applied only under certain conditions and circumstances, may not be applied against an opponent in difficulty.
('77', 170, 1, 6, 330259) Civil disobedience is not the law of life; satyagraha is.
('77', 170, 1, 7, 330317) Satyagraha, therefore, never ceases; civil disobedience can cease and ought to when there is no occasion for it.
('77', 170, 1, 8, 330430) Then there are two kinds of civil disobedience—aggressive and defensive.
('77', 170, 1, 9, 330503) Defensive civil disobedience becomes a duty when insult or humiliation is imposed upon us by an opponent.
('77', 170, 1, 10, 330609) That duty would have to be done whether the opponent is in difficulty or not.
('77', 170, 1, 11, 330687) An opponent in difficulty may not expect people to obey unjust or humiliating laws or orders.
('77', 170, 1, 12, 330781) Aggressive civil disobedience embar rasses the opponent, whether we mean to embarrass him or not.
('77', 170, 1, 13, 330879) Travelling in a railway train without a ticket—assuming for a moment that it is civil disobedience, which it is not—would be taboo, for it would be merely to embarrass the opponent.
('77', 170, 1, 14, 331061) In brief, there is nothing which being normally justifiable and conducive to swaraj would be taboo even if it seems to embarrass the opponent.
('77', 170, 1, 15, 331204) To do what is morally necessary and beneficial is a duty and quite a different thing from that which may not be morally indefensible but calculated to vex and embarrass an opponent in difficulty.
('77', 170, 1, 16, 331400) To make his difficulty one’s opportunity is in no case justifiable.
('77', 170, 2, 17, 331468) What do you mean by saying that direct action will be a prelude to the Constituent Assembly ?
('77', 170, 3, 18, 331562) GANDHIJI : I do not remember having either said or written this.
('77', 170, 3, 19, 331627) It is likely that you have torn something from its context.
('77', 170, 3, 20, 331687) All that I have said is that we may have to go through the fire of civil resistance in order to win India’s freedom, and even that I am straining every nerve to avoid.
('77', 170, 3, 21, 331855) The Constituent Assembly is a prelude to independence and a natural prelude.
('77', 170, 3, 22, 331932) It has been suggested as a means to obviate all clash of communal and class interest.
('77', 170, 3, 23, 332018) Its main function is to draw up the charter of independence.
('77', 170, 3, 24, 332079) Direct action would be necessary when all progress towards independence becomes impossible and all negotiations with the Government prove fruitless.
('77', 170, 4, 25, 332228) When the M.L.A.s are now unemployed, why should they accept their monthly
('77', 171, 0, 1, 332302) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 172
('77', 171, 1, 2, 332344) allowance ?
('77', 171, 2, 3, 332356) GANDHIJI : I have no doubt that they ought not to draw these allowances.
('77', 171, 2, 4, 332429) It is no use our saying it is Government money.
('77', 171, 2, 5, 332477) There is nothing that belongs to Government.
('77', 171, 2, 6, 332522) There are people who when they go to jail make all kinds of demands and do not hesitate to misuse jail property.
('77', 171, 2, 7, 332635) But they forget that the jails and everything there belongs to us, and that we have to make as sparing use of those things as we do of what we call ours.
('77', 171, 2, 8, 332789) I have, therefore, no doubt that allowances should not be taken and, if they must be, they should be handed to the Congress office.
('77', 171, 2, 9, 332921) It is an essentially moral question to be considered by every Congressman.
('77', 171, 2, 10, 332996) We would enhance our prestige if we decide not to draw these allowances.
('77', 171, 2, 11, 333069) I have hitherto refrained from expressing my opinion because I felt that it might be against the general trend of Congress opinion.
('77', 171, 2, 12, 333201) But now that you have raised the question I would ask you to approach the Congress President and the Working Committee.
('77', 171, 3, 13, 333321) These questions answered, Gandhiji said : I must now come to my favourite theme.
('77', 171, 3, 14, 333402) To take the questions of communal unity first.
('77', 171, 3, 15, 333449) The essence of it is to give to all com munities what is their due without their asking or having to fight for it.
('77', 171, 3, 16, 333564) Satyagraha, as I have said, is the law of life.
('77', 171, 3, 17, 333612) It begins not by assertion of rights but by correct recognition of the rights of our neighbours.
('77', 171, 3, 18, 333709) As regards the Harijans I would put up with their kicks and worse, if they should choose to resort to them.
('77', 171, 3, 19, 333817) For it will take time for them to be convinced that, having used them ill for centuries, we shall now treat them as blood brothers.
('77', 171, 3, 20, 333949) To come to the charkha, my pet obsession, I am not going to be content until you act truly.
('77', 171, 3, 21, 334041) As I came in I heard you haggling about 640 yards or 640 rounds (i.
('77', 171, 3, 22, 334109) e., 840 yards).
('77', 171, 3, 23, 334125) This will not do.
('77', 171, 3, 24, 334143) We have to set the charkha humming in every home and khadi must become universal.
('77', 171, 3, 25, 334225) The sure proof that spinning has become universal will be afforded by the fact that khadi becomes current coin.
('77', 171, 3, 26, 334337) I am thankful that the country will not think of launching civil disobedience until I as General give the signal for it.
('77', 171, 3, 27, 334458) I shall not give the signal until my conditions are fulfilled.
('77', 171, 3, 28, 334521) We need 200 crores of rupees worth of cloth.
('77', 171, 3, 29, 334566) How much do we produce today on our wheels and looms ?
('77', 171, 3, 30, 334621) Not more than a crore of rupees worth.
('77', 171, 3, 31, 334660) How then can I be satisfied by your promise to spin 100 or even 200 yards a day ?
('77', 171, 3, 32, 334742) If people insist on wearing khadi exclusively, they will be
('77', 172, 0, 1, 334802) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 173
('77', 172, 1, 2, 334851) content with even a loin cloth if no more khadi is available.
('77', 172, 1, 3, 334913) I should be content even with that predicament if we cannot produce all the cloth we need.
('77', 172, 1, 4, 335004) But I am sure that, if the demand is there, there will be an automatic supply.
('77', 172, 1, 5, 335083) The universalization will come if we are all true.
('77', 172, 1, 6, 335134) But the fact is that those who profess to believe in khadi will not work for it.
('77', 172, 1, 7, 335215) Maulana Mahomed Ali, when he declared that our yarn cones were the bullets with which we would win swaraj, uttered a great truth and explained for all time the meaning of winning swaraj non violently.
('77', 172, 1, 8, 335416) 1 I will chant the khadi mantra as long as there is life in me, as I believe it will bring deliverance.
('77', 172, 1, 9, 335520) Settle your internal difference, organize yourselves and carry on the constructive programme of khadi, communal unity and Harijan seva 2.
('77', 172, 2, 10, 335658) Addressing the women present, Gandhiji said : Khadi has a unifying influence.
('77', 172, 2, 11, 335736) So, sisters, devote yourselves to it, as you hold the key to swaraj.
('77', 172, 3, 12, 335805) On the question of picketing of liquor shops, he said that there should be no violence.
('77', 172, 3, 13, 335893) He asked them to keep a watch at liquor shops, approach addicts, study their surroundings, and persuade them to give up the evil.
('77', 172, 3, 14, 336023) I am a General, but a taskmaster as well.
('77', 172, 3, 15, 336065) Hence, I appeal to you for complete devotion to the constructive programme before the signal for a fight is given.
('77', 172, 4, 16, 336180) Harijan, 6 1 1940, and The Hindu, 28 12 1939

('77', 173, 2, 9, 337498) 206. LETTER TO JAWAHARLAL NEHRU SEGAON, WARDHA, December 28, 1939

('77', 178, 1, 2, 344196) 216. NOTE TO SUSHILA NAYYAR December 29, 1939 To keep you purely for my own sake would be a crime in my view and a denial of my whole life.
('77', 178, 1, 3, 344336) But I want your presence for a number of reasons.
('77', 178, 1, 4, 344386) These include Pyarelal, you yourself, and looking after the sick.
('77', 178, 1, 5, 344452) If along with these, you continue looking after my physical well being, it will be acceptable to me.
('77', 178, 1, 6, 344553) I cannot be concerned with your reason for staying.
('77', 178, 1, 7, 344605) I can even understand that you can stay here only to serve me.
('77', 178, 1, 8, 344668) For you it would even be creditable.
('77', 178, 1, 9, 344705) In practice, it makes no difference so long as I am in Segaon.
('77', 178, 1, 10, 344768) But when I go out and feel that your presence is necessary here and you feel the opposite you must give in to my view.
('77', 178, 1, 11, 344887) This, as I see it, means that your duty lies in not leaving me.
('77', 178, 1, 12, 344951) Since you consider serving me your primary duty, if there is any difference of opinion when I have to go out, you must bear with me.
('77', 178, 1, 13, 345084) In that alone lie your good and my peace.

('77', 181, 0, 1, 349233) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 182
('77', 181, 1, 2, 349275) 222. THE WHEEL ABIDES
('77', 181, 2, 3, 349297) A collegiate from Baroda tells me that the high school and college students in Baroda rarely use khadi.
('77', 181, 2, 4, 349401) Hardly anyone spins.
('77', 181, 2, 5, 349422) An earnest worker of Berar argues : “Do you not think that swaraj is an impossibility if your condition about khadi is seriously meant ?
('77', 181, 2, 6, 349559) Your second condition about fellowship too seems to be equally incapable of fulfilment.” This friend is himself a lover of khadi, spins regularly, and cultivates fellowship with everybody.
('77', 181, 2, 7, 349748) But he has the honest doubt expressed above.
('77', 181, 2, 8, 349793) The friend could have said with equal force the same thing about non violence apart from the charkha.
('77', 181, 2, 9, 349895) Perhaps he had no doubt about the charkha and goodwill being external and internal signs of non violence.
('77', 181, 2, 10, 350001) My answer to the collegiate and the Berar friend is the same.
('77', 181, 2, 11, 350063) I am not blind to what they say.
('77', 181, 2, 12, 350096) I know the difficulty of fulfilling the conditions within the implied time limit.
('77', 181, 2, 13, 350178) I am helpless.
('77', 181, 2, 14, 350193) I am not obstinate.
('77', 181, 2, 15, 350213) For my own reputation, if for nothing else, I should prescribe other and more feasible conditions, if it were at all possible.
('77', 181, 2, 16, 350340) But even as the condition of producing water is the presence of H2O, so are the charkha and goodwill conditions and signs of non violence.
('77', 181, 2, 17, 350479) Such being my fixed view, I have to insist upon the fulfilment of the two conditions before I can declare mass civil disobedience with any confidence.
('77', 181, 2, 18, 350630) My faith is in God and therefore in the people.
('77', 181, 2, 19, 350678) If He wants me to put up another fight, He will change people’s hearts.
('77', 181, 2, 20, 350750) The conditions prescribed by me are not physically impossible.
('77', 181, 2, 21, 350813) If the people will it, they can take to spinning and khadi today.
('77', 181, 2, 22, 350879) If they will it, they can be good to the whole of mankind.
('77', 181, 2, 23, 350938) The age of miracles is not past.
('77', 181, 2, 24, 350971) But supposing that the conditions are not fulfilled, I shall cheerfully become the laughing stock of India and the world and descend from the pedestal of Generalship.
('77', 181, 2, 25, 351138) I shall have the supreme satisfaction of being true to myself.
('77', 181, 2, 26, 351201) I shall read in the apparent failure a sign from God that the conditions were a hallucination produced by Him to save the nation from a disastrous career.
('77', 181, 2, 27, 351356) Thinking from the purely practical stand point and even apart from my conditions, the Congress organization shows signs of disintegration.
('77', 181, 2, 28, 351495) The Bengal Committee is frankly defiant.
('77', 181, 2, 29, 351536) Orissa is split up into two camps.
('77', 181, 2, 30, 351571) Things are no better in Karnatak.
('77', 181, 2, 31, 351605) A Kerala correspondent says that the Provincial Committee does not believe in the present policy and command and is trying by every means to undermine the influence of
('77', 182, 0, 1, 351773) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 183
('77', 182, 1, 2, 351822) the Working Committee by ridiculing its programme.
('77', 182, 1, 3, 351873) Things are not rosy in the Punjab.
('77', 182, 1, 4, 351908) I know things are, however, not beyond repair.
('77', 182, 1, 5, 351955) I cherish the hope that they will right themselves.
('77', 182, 1, 6, 352007) But if they do not, I cannot lead an indisciplined army to victory.
('77', 182, 1, 7, 352075) I must refuse to subscribe to the easy doctrine that I have but to declare ‘war’ and everything and everybody will be found to be in order.
('77', 182, 1, 8, 352215) Another view has been suggested.
('77', 182, 1, 9, 352248) If there is indiscipline in so many provinces, may it not be that the fault lies with the High Command rather than with the different committees ?
('77', 182, 1, 10, 352395) I am not prepared to reject the hypothesis.
('77', 182, 1, 11, 352439) But what is the High Command to do ?
('77', 182, 1, 12, 352476) They do what they think is their best.
('77', 182, 1, 13, 352515) They cannot abdicate so long as a large majority continues to put faith in them.
('77', 182, 1, 14, 352596) When during the early days of non co operation I had suggested abdication, Maulana Mahomed Ali said, “How can we, if the people want us ?
('77', 182, 1, 15, 352734) Abdication would be cowardly.
('77', 182, 1, 16, 352764) It will be bravery to be kicked out.” I did not go the whole length with him then as I do not now.
('77', 182, 1, 17, 352863) But there is much force in that argument.
('77', 182, 1, 18, 352905) The Congress command has to be held lightly.
('77', 182, 1, 19, 352950) There should be no wire pulling, no attempt made to hold on to office.
('77', 182, 1, 20, 353021) There should be readiness to give up the command at a moment’s notice.
('77', 182, 1, 21, 353092) The Congress command is no command.
('77', 182, 1, 22, 353128) It is an act of service.
('77', 182, 1, 23, 353153) The President is the first servant.
('77', 182, 1, 24, 353189) So far as I know the members of the Working Committee, I believe that they would be glad to be relieved of the responsibility.
('77', 182, 1, 25, 353316) The fresh elections are on.
('77', 182, 1, 26, 353344) The Congressmen’s choice is unfettered.
('77', 182, 1, 27, 353384) Let younger men come forward to take charge.
('77', 182, 1, 28, 353429) But if they will not and will still retain the old team, they should give them implicit obedience.
('77', 182, 1, 29, 353528) The critical situation in the country demands courageous and decisive handling.
('77', 182, 1, 30, 353608) SEGAON, January 1, 1940 Harijan, 6 1 1940
('77', 182, 2, 31, 353650) 223. SINDH TRAGEDY
('77', 182, 3, 32, 353669) I have before me several letters from Sindh and a longish report from Dr. Choithram 1 over the recent riots 2 in Sukkur and Shikarpur.
('77', 182, 3, 33, 353804) The Sindh Hindus should remember that Sindh has a National Government.
('77', 182, 3, 34, 353875) Though for the sake of brevity I have often used the
('77', 182, 4, 35, 353928) 1 Dr. Choithram Gidwani, Vice President of the Sind Provincial Congress Committee 2 Vide “Sind Riots”, 28 11 1939.
('77', 183, 0, 1, 354043) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 184
('77', 183, 1, 2, 354085) term Congress Government, the proper expression is National Democratic Government as distinguished from Foreign Bureaucratic Government, which it replaces.
('77', 183, 1, 3, 354241) Whilst in discussing domestic differences and party politics we have to speak of Congress and Muslim League Governments, we must for all other purposes think and speak in terms of National Government.
('77', 183, 1, 4, 354442) And so those who feel aggrieved must appeal to their Provincial National Governments and cultivate public opinion in favour of justice and public tranquillity.
('77', 183, 1, 5, 354602) It would be wrong always to think in communal terms.
('77', 183, 1, 6, 354655) I know that we may not shut our eyes to hard facts.
('77', 183, 1, 7, 354707) But to attribute everything to the communal spirit is a sign of inferiority complex.
('77', 183, 1, 8, 354792) It may well perpetuate what is yet a temporary distemper in the national life.
('77', 183, 1, 9, 354871) But as I have already suggested, contrasted with irresponsible bureaucracy, National Governments would be found to be weak in action because of their responsibility to the people in whose name and by whose goodwill alone they can rule.
('77', 183, 1, 10, 355107) They can, therefore, deal with crimes with more or less success, but they will be found to be powerless to deal with popular upheavals which communal riots are.
('77', 183, 1, 11, 355268) British military aid will not always be at their disposal.
('77', 183, 1, 12, 355327) National Governments will cease to be national if they have to depend on British military aid.
('77', 183, 1, 13, 355422) Moreover, if the Congress policy of non violence becomes universal among all parties, military and even police aid must become taboo.
('77', 183, 1, 14, 355556) Before the other parties can be expected to become non violent, Congressmen have to express non violence in ample measure in their daily conduct.
('77', 183, 1, 15, 355702) Be that, however, as it may, I can only advise the afflicted people of Sindh in terms of non violence.
('77', 183, 1, 16, 355805) The question in Sindh is not really one between Hindus and Muslims.
('77', 183, 1, 17, 355873) It is essentially one between weak people and strong.
('77', 183, 1, 18, 355927) Muslims fight among themselves as badly as with Hindus.
('77', 183, 1, 19, 355983) Hindus have also been known to fight among themselves.
('77', 183, 1, 20, 356038) It will be wrong to weigh ferocity in golden scales.
('77', 183, 1, 21, 356091) Hinduism has become a synonym for weakness and Islam for physical strength.
('77', 183, 1, 22, 356167) Hindus, although they have been taught to believe in ahimsa, have not shown en masse the strength of ahimsa, have never shown its superiority, when matched against physical strength.
('77', 183, 1, 23, 356350) I have maintained that superiority over physical strength, however overwhelming, is the core of ahimsa, and I have further maintained that this non violence can be exercised as well by individuals as by groups of them, yea, even by millions together.
('77', 183, 1, 24, 356601) The experiment is still
('77', 184, 0, 1, 356625) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 185
('77', 184, 1, 2, 356674) in the making.
('77', 184, 1, 3, 356689) Sufficient evidence has accumulated during the past twenty years to show that the experiment is worth making.
('77', 184, 1, 4, 356799) Nothing can possibly be lost by continuing it, provided of course that the non violence is of the standard brand.
('77', 184, 1, 5, 356913) Nothing has come under my observation to show that there was in Sukkur or Shikarpur even one person who believed in and practised non violence of the strong.
('77', 184, 1, 6, 357071) Had there been one, we would surely have known of him as we know of Ganesh Shankar Vidyarthi.
('77', 184, 2, 7, 357165) One such person can any day give a better account of himself than one armed to the teeth.
('77', 184, 2, 8, 357255) There are many Congressmen in Sukkur and Shikarpur, but they are not non violently organized.
('77', 184, 2, 9, 357349) It is not their fault.
('77', 184, 2, 10, 357372) They know no better.
('77', 184, 2, 11, 357393) As I have been repeatedly saying nowadays, our non violence has not been of the strong.
('77', 184, 2, 12, 357481) Weak people cannot develop it all of a sudden.
('77', 184, 2, 13, 357528) But I have no other drug in my chest.
('77', 184, 2, 14, 357566) I can only prescribe what I have and what has never failed.
('77', 184, 2, 15, 357626) I can only, therefore, say : ‘Try and try again until you succeed.’ In the composition of the truly brave there should be no malice, no anger, no distrust, no fear of death or physical hurt.
('77', 184, 2, 16, 357817) Non violence is certainly not for those who lack these essential qualities.
('77', 184, 2, 17, 357893) Wherever there are such persons they should be able to cover the weak ones, provided of course that they would listen to their helpers.
('77', 184, 2, 18, 358029) Let the weak ones never rely upon armed help.
('77', 184, 2, 19, 358075) Such help will only make them weaker.
('77', 184, 2, 20, 358113) If they have not the capacity for non violent resistance, they should learn the art of defending themselves.
('77', 184, 2, 21, 358222) It does not require a strong body; it requires a stout heart.
('77', 184, 2, 22, 358284) The African Negroes have become, or were 25 years ago, so terror stricken that they could not face a white lad—a pigmy compared to the giant framed Negroes.
('77', 184, 2, 23, 358441) White children were trained from their infancy not to fear the Negroes.
('77', 184, 2, 24, 358513) The first lesson, therefore, for those who will learn how to defend themselves is to shed the fear of being hurt or being killed.
('77', 184, 2, 25, 358643) I would like them to observe the laws of the game.
('77', 184, 2, 26, 358694) Just as there is such a thing as honour among thieves, there should surely be honour between combatants.
('77', 184, 2, 27, 358799) One hears so often of children and old men being butchered, women being outraged.
('77', 184, 2, 28, 358881) If men must become beasts, there might even then be some decency observed.
('77', 184, 2, 29, 358956) Religion is
('77', 184, 3, 30, 358968) 1 Who was killed during the Hindu Muslim riots in Kanpur on March 26/27, 1931. Vide “Speech on Kanpur Riots, Subjects Committee Meeting, Karachi”, 27 3 1931, “Telegram to Balkrishna Sharma”, 1 4 1931 and “Notes”, 9 4 1931.

('77', 185, 1, 2, 359233) outraged when an outrage is perpetrated in its name.

('77', 190, 8, 20, 367028) proselytizing activity without any hindrance ?
('77', 190, 8, 21, 367075) [GANDHIJI :] No legal hindrance can be put in the way of any Christian or of anybody preaching for the acceptance of his doctrine.
('77', 190, 9, 22, 367206) The visitor was anxious to know whether the freedom they were having under the British regime would be allowed to them under the national Government without any interference.
('77', 190, 9, 23, 367381) I can’t answer that question categorically because I do not know what is exactly allowed and what is not allowed under the British regime today.
('77', 190, 9, 24, 367526) That is a legal question.

('77', 190, 10, 27, 367763) 1 From the reference to Kumarappa it is evident that this letter was written after the letter to the addressee dated January 5, 1940; vide “Letter to Jawaharlal Nehru”, 5 1 1940. 2 Reproduced from Pyarelal’s article “A Talk with Christian Friends” dated January 6, 1940 3 ibid
('77', 191, 0, 1, 368040) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 192
('77', 191, 1, 2, 368082) Some of us are under an apprehension that they may have hereafter to labour under.
('77', 191, 1, 3, 368165) disabilities.
('77', 191, 1, 4, 368179) Is there any guarantee that such a thing would not happen ?
('77', 191, 1, 5, 368239) As I wrote in Harijan 1, you do not seem to realize that Chris tians are today enjoying privileges because they are Christians.
('77', 191, 1, 6, 368367) The moment a person here turns Christian, he becomes a Sahib log 2 .
('77', 191, 1, 7, 368436) He almost changes his nationality.
('77', 191, 1, 8, 368471) He gets a job and position which he could not have otherwise got.
('77', 191, 1, 9, 368537) He adopts foreign dress and ways of living.
('77', 191, 1, 10, 368581) He cuts himself off from his own people and begins to fancy himself a limb of the ruling class.
('77', 191, 1, 11, 368677) What the Christians are afraid of losing, therefore, is not their rights but anomalous privileges.
('77', 191, 2, 12, 368776) The visitor admitted the truth of Gandhiji’s remarks, but assured him that whatever might have been the case in the past Christians as a class no longer wished to retain any exceptional privileges.
('77', 191, 3, 13, 368974) Another missionary friend recalling Gandhiji’s well known objection to the prevailing proselytizing practices chimed in : “Why may not I share with others my experience of Jesus Christ which has given me such an ineffable peace ?” Because you cannot possibly say that what is best for you is best for all.
('77', 191, 3, 14, 369280) Quinine may be the only means of saving life in your case, but a dangerous poison in the case of another.
('77', 191, 3, 15, 369386) And again, is it not superarrogation to assume that you alone possess the key to spiritual joy and peace, and that an adherent of a different faith cannot get the same in equal measure from a study of his scriptures ?
('77', 191, 3, 16, 369604) I enjoy a peace and equanimity of spirit which has excited the envy of many Christian friends.
('77', 191, 3, 17, 369699) I have got it principally through the Gita.
('77', 191, 3, 18, 369743) Your difficulty lies in your considering the other faiths as false or so adulterated as to amount to falsity.
('77', 191, 3, 19, 369853) And you shut your eyes to the truth that shines in other faiths and which gives equal joy and peace to their votaries.
('77', 191, 3, 20, 369972) I have not hesitated, therefore, to recommend to my Christian friends a prayerful and sympathetic study of the other scriptures of the world.
('77', 191, 3, 21, 370114) I can give my own humble testimony that, whilst such study has enabled me to give the same respect to them that I give to my own, it has enriched my own faith and broadened my vision.
('77', 191, 4, 22, 370298) Gandhiji’s interlocutor was silent.

('77', 194, 1, 2, 373112) 239. INTERVIEW TO AN ENGLISH REPORTER 1
('77', 194, 2, 3, 373152) SEGAON, [Before January 7, 1940]2
('77', 194, 3, 4, 373186) [REPORTER :] There seems to be a deadlock coming, indeed if one does not already exist.
('77', 194, 3, 5, 373274) Cannot we take advantage of nominated group of a really representative character to come to some sort of an agreed solution ?
('77', 194, 4, 6, 373400) GANDHIJI : A nominated group of a really representative character is a contradiction in terms.
('77', 194, 4, 7, 373495) Such a group can only represent the nominator.
('77', 194, 4, 8, 373542) For the purpose of discussion the nominator would be finally the Viceroy.
('77', 194, 4, 9, 373616) You will not call such a group one of a really representative character.
('77', 194, 4, 10, 373689) If you have in mind a small number of representatives, I for one would accept only one representative, say Jinnah Saheb, provided he is elected by the free vote of the millions as, say, is the President of the U.S.A.
('77', 194, 5, 11, 373906) REPORTER : Would you really ?
('77', 194, 6, 12, 373936) GANDHIJI : Why not ?
('77', 194, 6, 13, 373957) Is there any flaw in this statement ?
('77', 194, 6, 14, 373995) I claim to be the greatest democrat of modern times.
('77', 194, 6, 15, 374048) My faith is built on non violence and therefore I have faith in human nature.
('77', 194, 7, 16, 374126) REPORTER : But while the minorities are deadly opposed to a Constituent Assembly, can you offer them this form of representation now with any hope of their accepting the position ?
('77', 194, 8, 17, 374307) GANDHIJI : Anyone who objects to the right thing, puts himself in the wrong.
('77', 194, 8, 18, 374384) British statesmen have induced the belief that they want to end the imperialistic system and treat those under them as free.
('77', 194, 8, 19, 374509) Having induced that belief the Congress naturally wanted to test its sincerity.
('77', 194, 8, 20, 374589) The answer must, therefore, be irrespective of what India wants or does not want.
('77', 194, 8, 21, 374671) Now the question arises to whom is the answer to be given.
('77', 194, 8, 22, 374730) If there were a rebel power trying to seize the reins of government, it would be the rebel power.
('77', 194, 8, 23, 374828) But here there is no rebellion.
('77', 194, 8, 24, 374860) The Congress is the main organization.
('77', 194, 8, 25, 374899) But I confess that in view of rival organizations, power cannot be transferred to it.
('77', 194, 8, 26, 374985) If then Britain is to make good her declaration, she can easily do it by summoning a Constituent Assembly of elected representatives and enforce the constitution framed by it.
('77', 194, 8, 27, 375161) Representatives of minorities
('77', 194, 9, 28, 375191) 1 The report by Amrit Kaur, date lined “Segaon, January 7, 1940”, appeared under the caption “World Conscience the Supreme Arbiter”.
('77', 195, 0, 1, 375324) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 196
('77', 195, 1, 2, 375366) will frame safeguards for their protection.
('77', 195, 1, 3, 375410) It is possible that even the representatives may fail to reach a constitution acceptable to an overwhelming majority, including safeguards for minorities.
('77', 195, 1, 4, 375565) Even so, Britain will have proved her bonafides.
('77', 195, 1, 5, 375614) I hold, however, that a properly elected assembly is bound to produce a workable constitution.
('77', 195, 2, 6, 375709) REPORTER : Supposing a referendum were taken and it was found that a Constituent Assembly was not wanted, would you accept the verdict ?
('77', 195, 3, 7, 375846) GANDHIJI : I must.
('77', 195, 4, 8, 375865) REPORTER : If a generally accepted scheme is prepared by nominated persons, would you accept it ?
('77', 195, 4, 9, 375963) Or do you object to nomination as such ?
('77', 195, 5, 10, 376004) GANDHIJI : There is no meaning in my acceptance or rejection.
('77', 195, 5, 11, 376066) Acceptance to be valid must be by a properly elected body.
('77', 195, 5, 12, 376125) It takes the place of the existing Government or their nominee or nominees.
('77', 195, 6, 13, 376201) REPORTER : Supposing you could be sure of achieving democracy through a nominated assembly, would you reject it ?
('77', 195, 6, 14, 376315) Why not wait and see what form of nomination could be offered ?
('77', 195, 7, 15, 376379) GANDHIJI : I would always suspect nomination, for it can never satisfy all.
('77', 195, 7, 16, 376455) Election is the only satisfactory method.
('77', 195, 7, 17, 376497) In spite of Congress claim and boast the Congress is an organization representing only 3 million voters out of a population of over 300 millions.
('77', 195, 7, 18, 376643) Therefore the Secretary of State would be justified if he said that the Congress was not representative of the whole nation.
('77', 195, 7, 19, 376768) And therefore the Congress challenges all to go to the people.
('77', 195, 7, 20, 376831) Even the Princes can as individuals, and so can Europeans domiciled in India.
('77', 195, 7, 21, 376909) That they will not is not our fault.
('77', 195, 8, 22, 376946) REPORTER : What place would you assign to the Princes in democratic India ?
('77', 195, 9, 23, 377022) GANDHIJI : I would give them a fat commission as trustees of their people.
('77', 195, 9, 24, 377097) I would say to them, however, that they must work for this commission.
('77', 195, 9, 25, 377168) They would have the same privileges as the British King enjoys.
('77', 195, 9, 26, 377232) They are after all his vassals.
('77', 195, 9, 27, 377264) They cannot be greater than he.
('77', 195, 9, 28, 377296) The King of England cannot hang a man.
('77', 195, 9, 29, 377335) He can only act through proper channels.
('77', 195, 9, 30, 377376) He is a private citizen, though the first one.
('77', 195, 9, 31, 377423) If I can like monarchy at all, I would like the limited monarchy of England.
('77', 195, 9, 32, 377500) And why should not the people of the States determine what they want ?
('77', 195, 9, 33, 377571) As far as justice for the people is concerned, I have already said 1 that their supreme courts must be subject to the High Court of India.
('77', 195, 10, 34, 377710) 1 Vide “To the Princes”, 8 7 1939
('77', 196, 0, 1, 377744) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 197
('77', 196, 1, 2, 377793) REPORTER : Might it not be that the English form of democracy will be unsuited to India ?
('77', 196, 2, 3, 377883) GANDHIJI : That is for the Constituent Assembly to decide.
('77', 196, 2, 4, 377942) The time when self styled representatives or nominees could decide for India is gone for ever.
('77', 196, 3, 5, 378037) REPORTER : Do you think the Assembly would suggest an economic form of democracy ?
('77', 196, 4, 6, 378120) GANDHIJI : I give the Assembly credit for sanity.
('77', 196, 4, 7, 378170) So far as I can see this is the best method.
('77', 196, 4, 8, 378215) But if a better can be produced, I would accept it.
('77', 196, 5, 9, 378267) REPORTER : May it not be that, while Britain is sincere, the delay is due to the terrible situation of war in which she finds herself today ?
('77', 196, 6, 10, 378409) GANDHIJI : I have not lost faith in their sincerity and that is why I am still wooing them.
('77', 196, 6, 11, 378501) I am wooing my own people to build up their power.
('77', 196, 6, 12, 378552) I am preparing for a fight, if it must come, but I am doing my level best to stave it off.
('77', 196, 6, 13, 378643) I believe that Britain’s past is responsible for all the prevailing dissensions.
('77', 196, 7, 14, 378724) REPORTER : What if Britain lost the war ?
('77', 196, 8, 15, 378766) GANDHIJI : I would be sorry if Britain lost.
('77', 196, 8, 16, 378811) But I would not feel helpless.
('77', 196, 8, 17, 378842) Supposing Russia, Germany, Italy and Japan formed a combination to seize India, I should not feel perturbed if India, as a whole, had accepted non violence as her fixed policy.
('77', 196, 8, 18, 379019) Through non co operation India could defy any combination.
('77', 196, 8, 19, 379078) So you see my sympathy for Britain is absolutely selfless.
('77', 196, 8, 20, 379137) If Britain is really right, God will inspire her to make the declaration about India and put herself right with India.
('77', 196, 8, 21, 379256) I do not wish Britain to win right or wrong.
('77', 196, 8, 22, 379301) If India were wrong, India must perish.
('77', 196, 8, 23, 379341) I have often said that Hinduism will perish if Hinduism allows the practice of untouchability to remain.
('77', 196, 8, 24, 379446) I would go so far as to pray for India’s destruction if she went wrong, even as Stead 1 prayed for England’s defeat in the Boer War.
('77', 196, 8, 25, 379579) In spite of all her great resources it is wrong on Britain’s part to strain too much her faith in her strong arm.
('77', 196, 8, 26, 379693) I rejoice that she still prays to the God of love and not to the God of gunpowder, and therefore I still hope that she will call to her aid the moral support of a free India.
('77', 196, 8, 27, 379868) She gets today material support from
('77', 196, 9, 28, 379905) 1 A British journalist who publicly prayed and invited others to pray that God might decree the English a defeat in the Boer War.
('77', 196, 9, 29, 380035) Vide “Satyagraha in South Africa Chapter II”.
('77', 197, 0, 1, 380081) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 198
('77', 197, 1, 2, 380123) India because she is a dependency.
('77', 197, 1, 3, 380158) What I want Britain to do is to get the moral support of India and win.
('77', 197, 1, 4, 380230) Would to God that the war ended on a moral issue and the conscience of the world became the final arbiter !
('77', 197, 1, 5, 380338) That can only happen if Britain had the moral support of a free India.
('77', 197, 1, 6, 380409) Anyway, that is my view.
('77', 197, 1, 7, 380434) Harijan, 13 1 1940
('77', 197, 2, 8, 380453) 240. LETTER TO MUNNALAL G. SHAH
('77', 197, 3, 9, 380485) January 7, 1940
('77', 197, 4, 10, 380501) MUNNALAL, I am not dissatisfied with you.
('77', 197, 4, 11, 380543) I would indeed miss you if you were to leave this place.
('77', 197, 4, 12, 380600) I know your virtues, but have become impatient to see that you get rid of your shortcomings.
('77', 197, 4, 13, 380693) Get rid of them.
('77', 197, 4, 14, 380710) My criticism was made good humouredly, for didn’t I say nine hours ?
('77', 197, 4, 15, 380779) The facts which you have stated are correct.
('77', 197, 4, 16, 380824) And now about the other letter.
('77', 197, 4, 17, 380856) I will inquire about the damage to the books.
('77', 197, 4, 18, 380902) That was a terrible thing.
('77', 197, 4, 19, 380929) The money matter too was a terrible thing.
('77', 197, 4, 20, 380972) I will inquire about that also.
('77', 197, 4, 21, 381004) There is lack of order, no doubt.
('77', 197, 4, 22, 381038) The blame for that is primarily mine.
('77', 197, 4, 23, 381076) This is the simple truth.
('77', 197, 4, 24, 381102) The disorder that you see is all due to me.
('77', 197, 4, 25, 381146) I will see.
('77', 197, 4, 26, 381158) If you recover your peace of mind, you can give me much help.

('77', 198, 8, 13, 382165) MATHURADAS, Sonavate, a Harijan, is a clerk in your office on a salary of Rs. 79. He is a B. A., LL.B. Is it possible to give him a promotion there?
('77', 198, 8, 14, 382314) What are the reports about his behaviour?
('77', 198, 8, 15, 382356) As no Hindus are offering him any accommodation, he is staying with a Muslim family.
('77', 198, 8, 16, 382441) Should not the Corporation reserve a chawl or a building for such people?
('77', 198, 8, 17, 382515) Would there be any opposition to it?
('77', 198, 8, 18, 382552) It should not entail financial loss.
('77', 198, 8, 19, 382589) But even if it does, I think we should bear it.
('77', 198, 8, 20, 382637) Think about it from all points of view and write to me.

('77', 199, 8, 16, 383427) 246. NOTES
('77', 199, 9, 17, 383438) ANOTHER HARIJAN SEVAK GONE I regret to have to report the death of Shri Venkatasubbiah, an old member of the Servants of India Society.
('77', 199, 9, 18, 383574) He was the Secretary of the Madras Harijan Sevak Sangh.
('77', 199, 9, 19, 383630) He was a most unassuming and conscientious worker.
('77', 199, 9, 20, 383681) He never spared himself in anything he took up.
('77', 199, 9, 21, 383729) He was of a retiring nature.
('77', 199, 9, 22, 383758) His opposition to untoucha bility was uncompromising.
('77', 199, 9, 23, 383812) His death is a distinct loss to the Harijan cause.
('77', 199, 9, 24, 383863) I tender my condolences to the deceased reformer’s family.

('77', 199, 10, 27, 384127) 6 Dr. Rajendra Prasad has issued an appeal for funds for the sufferers.
('77', 199, 10, 28, 384199) It is to be hoped that the appeal will receive an enthusiastic

('77', 200, 0, 1, 384507) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 201
('77', 200, 1, 2, 384556) response from the public.
('77', 200, 1, 3, 384582) A correspondent has suggested the despatch of a medical mission to Turkey in order to relieve the sufferings of the distressed Turks.
('77', 200, 1, 4, 384716) The Idea is worthy of consideration.
('77', 200, 1, 5, 384753) If a mission is to be sent at all, it should be a national mission, not sectarian.
('77', 200, 1, 6, 384836) In the face of the triple calamity all differences of religion must be sunk.
('77', 200, 1, 7, 384913) Human distress knows no distinctions.
('77', 200, 1, 8, 384951) Such unprecedented distress as Turkey has experienced makes one realize the oneness of the human family.
('77', 200, 1, 9, 385056) This visitation should humble and chasten us.
('77', 200, 1, 10, 385102) It should enable Hindus and Muslims to sink their differences and make them realize that though they profess different faiths they are all children of the same God, and as such it is theirs to live in perfect fellowships with one another.
('77', 200, 2, 11, 385341) A WISE STEP The Hyderabad State Congress has had great difficulty in functioning.
('77', 200, 2, 12, 385423) The State would not recognize it as a constitutional body so long as it continued to style itself Congress although it has no affiliation with the Indian National Congress.
('77', 200, 2, 13, 385596) The world is nobody’s monopoly.
('77', 200, 2, 14, 385628) It is a common word used by many organizations in the world.
('77', 200, 2, 15, 385689) But somehow or other the National Congress has become anathema in many States.
('77', 200, 2, 16, 385768) Therefore the word itself has become suspect in Hyderabad.
('77', 200, 2, 17, 385827) The matter was referred by the leaders to me, and I had no hesitation in advising them that there was no virtue in merely fighting for the name if their lawful activities were not otherwise interfered with.
('77', 200, 2, 18, 386034) The leaders after correspondence with the authorities have acted according to my advice and adopted the name Hyderabad National Conference.
('77', 200, 2, 19, 386174) Thus all’s well that ends well.
('77', 200, 2, 20, 386206) I hope that the Conference will concentrate on the many constructive activities that are healthful and necessary for mass uplift and consciousness.
('77', 200, 2, 21, 386354) They should find the authorities co operating whole heartedly with them in such work.
('77', 200, 2, 22, 386440) Their goal of responsible government under the aegis of H. E. H. the Nizam remains the same as before.
('77', 200, 2, 23, 386543) I am sure every activity that promotes co operation among the people, their education and their economic and social uplift brings them nearer their goal in a most solid manner one can think of.
('77', 200, 3, 24, 386737) THREE ITEMS The Harijan Sevak Sangh has been for some time issuing a monthly circular letter containing a brief account of the Sangh’s activities.
('77', 200, 3, 25, 386884) Like Bapa, its Secretary, the letter is business like.
('77', 200, 3, 26, 386939) I take from the interesting letter for November and December the following
('77', 201, 0, 1, 387014) 202 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 201, 1, 2, 387056) three most interesting items :
('77', 201, 2, 3, 387087) (1) History was made at Munyali, a Harijan village near Nand Prayag, when a Harijan bride was carried in a dandi (palanquin) for the first time in the locality with the consent of the caste Hindus.
('77', 201, 3, 4, 387285) (2) It is understood that the work of the Committee appointed by the last Congress Government for inquiry into the wages and living conditions of the sweepers has been suspended by the present Governor’s Government.
('77', 201, 4, 5, 387501) (3) The Report of the Municipal Sweepers’ Inquiry Committee, appointed by the C. P. Government in 1938 under the chairmanship of Shri A. V. Thakkar, has been published.
('77', 201, 4, 6, 387670) Among the important recommendations are (1) a minimum wage of 4 as.
('77', 201, 4, 7, 387738) per day, (2) an eight hours’ working day, (3) employment of Welfare Officers for big municipalities, and (4) granting of privilege, casual and sick leave, and half holiday on week ends.
('77', 201, 4, 8, 387924) Regarding the housing of sweepers the Committee recommends as follows :
('77', 201, 5, 9, 387996) 1. It should be obligatory on the Municipal Committee to provide houses to sweepers.
('77', 201, 5, 10, 388081) 2. The Government should provide nazul 1 land for the purpose.
('77', 201, 5, 11, 388144) The report costs Re.
('77', 201, 5, 12, 388165) 1 and can be had from the Government Press, Nagpur.
('77', 201, 5, 13, 388217) When the taking of a Harijan bride in a dandi makes history we know how far we are from root and branch removal of untoucha bility.
('77', 201, 5, 14, 388349) For the expiation of their sin against humanity the so called caste Hindus should make it a point of themselves carrying in dandis Harijan brides in villages in all parts of India.
('77', 201, 5, 15, 388530) I hope the report in the item two is wrong, or that there is a sound reason for suspending the inquiry.
('77', 201, 5, 16, 388634) One had hoped that no lawful activity inaugurated by the Congress Ministries would be stopped or suspended by the interim Governments.
('77', 201, 5, 17, 388769) The recommendations (item three) of the Municipal Sweepers’ Committee (C.P.) are so sensible and moderate that there should be no delay in their being carried out in their entirety.
('77', 201, 5, 18, 388951) The report should not share the fate that befalls many such reports, i.
('77', 201, 5, 19, 389023) e., of being shelved.
('77', 201, 5, 20, 389045) It should be remembered that Thakkar Bapa’s was a labour of love.
('77', 201, 5, 21, 389111) He does not put his hands to anything for praise or show.
('77', 201, 5, 22, 389169) SEGAON, January 8, 1940 Harijan, 13 1 1940
('77', 201, 6, 23, 389212) 1 Belonging to Government
('77', 202, 0, 1, 389238) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 203
('77', 202, 1, 2, 389287) 247. CONGRESS M.L.A.S AND REMUNERATION
('77', 202, 2, 3, 389326) An M.L.A. from U. P. writes a letter which I abridge as follows : In U. P. we are getting Rs. 75 a month.
('77', 202, 2, 4, 389432) During the two and a half years in which the Congress was in power the Assem bly sessions were sometimes concluded in six days, at others they lasted for some months.
('77', 202, 2, 5, 389599) In addition, there were meetings of select, special and regular committees.
('77', 202, 2, 6, 389675) Some of these are still working and constitute a heavy demand on our time.
('77', 202, 2, 7, 389750) Moreover no one knows when the Assembly may be summoned again.
('77', 202, 2, 8, 389813) Touring in our constituencies entails an expenditure of Rs. 200 a year.
('77', 202, 2, 9, 389885) There are cases in which the constituencies are more than 200 miles away from Lucknow.
('77', 202, 2, 10, 389972) Taking an average of three tours in a year, a member has to spend six weeks for this purpose.
('77', 202, 2, 11, 390066) While at Lucknow, every member has to entertain people from his constituency.
('77', 202, 2, 12, 390144) He also pays Rs. 4 per month to the Congress Legislature Party and the Provincial Congress Committee.
('77', 202, 2, 13, 390246) In these circumstances business or professional life has to be sacrificed, and it is clear that unless a member has private means he is totally unable to give whole time work without some remuneration.
('77', 202, 2, 14, 390448) This question has come up many times before the U.P. M.L.A.s.
('77', 202, 2, 15, 390510) Many of us feel that either the allowance should be raised or the poor among us will have to go out, leaving the field to the rich.

('77', 204, 0, 1, 394215) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 205
('77', 204, 1, 2, 394264) 248. ADULTERATION OF GHEE 1
('77', 204, 2, 3, 394292) Shri Pannalal 2, an old member of Sabarmati Ashram, is a lover of cattle.
('77', 204, 2, 4, 394366) He has for years been a lay farmer and dairyman.
('77', 204, 2, 5, 394415) He has tried to study the cattle question.
('77', 204, 2, 6, 394458) Very few people realize that conservation of cattle wealth of India is a major economic problem beset with many complexities.
('77', 204, 2, 7, 394584) Adulteration of ghee has always been one of them.
('77', 204, 2, 8, 394634) During the last few years it has become a growing menace, owing to the import of cheap vegetable oil miscalled ghee because of its having been congealed and otherwise processed so as to look like ghee.
('77', 204, 2, 9, 394836) Shri Pannalal says that middlemen and sellers of dairy products profusely adulterate real ghee and thus undersell the farmer or cattle keeper.
('77', 204, 2, 10, 394979) He says that it is impossible for farmers to hold out against this competition if the mischief continues for any length of time, especially as such vegetable ‘ghee’ is being manufactured in Bombay and elsewhere on a large scale.
('77', 204, 2, 11, 395208) Shri Pannalal rightly adds that agriculture without dairying and cattle breeding for draught purposes will be an impossibility if real ghee disappears from the market.
('77', 204, 2, 12, 395376) Cattle keeping will then become a luxury instead of a paying occupation.
('77', 204, 2, 13, 395449) Shri Pannalal, therefore, suggests that drastic measures should be taken to prevent adulteration.
('77', 204, 2, 14, 395547) I heartily endorse the suggestion.
('77', 204, 2, 15, 395582) There should be a well regulated public agitation against adulteration, and preventive legislation should be passed if necessary.
('77', 204, 2, 16, 395712) In addition to the economic, this adulteration has a medical aspect which is no less important than the economic.
('77', 204, 2, 17, 395826) It is well known that vegetable ‘ghee’ has a much lower protective value than ghee.
('77', 204, 2, 18, 395910) From the health point of view, doctors say, vegetable ghee can never be a substitute for real ghee.
('77', 204, 2, 19, 396010) This is, therefore, a question for corporations, medical men and humanitarian leagues to tackle without delay.
('77', 204, 2, 20, 396121) If corporations have not adequate powers, they should have them.
('77', 204, 2, 21, 396186) Shri Pannalal says : 3
('77', 204, 3, 22, 396209) It is quite feasible to make it compulsory by law to add some edible colour or flavour to each and every tin of vegetable ghee, whether imported or produced in India.
('77', 204, 3, 23, 396376) This will readily distinguish the vegetable product from the genuine ghee and make detection easy.
('77', 204, 3, 24, 396475) SEGAON, January 8, 1940 Harijan, 20 1 1940

('77', 204, 4, 26, 396549) 2 Pannalal Jhaveri 3 Only an extract is reproduced here.

('77', 210, 5, 8, 409074) 252. TALK WITH BHAI PARAMANAND 1
('77', 210, 6, 9, 409107) SEGAON, [January 9/10, 1940] 2
('77', 210, 7, 10, 409138) [GANDHIJI :] I have come across plenty of revolutionaries during my lifetime.
('77', 210, 7, 11, 409216) I have been arguing with them ever since I wrote Indian Home Rule and ever since the murder of Curzon Wylie 3 when I was in England.
('77', 210, 7, 12, 409349) They come to me knowing that they would get a patient hearing from me, and that in confiding their secrets to me they have a friend whom they can trust.
('77', 210, 7, 13, 409502) As a result, quite a good number of them are today to be found fully converted and among my co workers.
('77', 210, 7, 14, 409606) So Prithvi Singh’s case 4 was not the first one of the conversion of a revolutionary to non violence, and it is my hope that it is not going to be the last.
('77', 210, 7, 15, 409763) Assuming that Hinduism sanctions violence, one great contribution of Hinduism to the world is its varnashrama dharma (not the travesty we see today) which confines the use of arms to Kshatriyas only.
('77', 210, 7, 16, 409963) Therefore, to teach 350 millions of people how to wield the sword is a stupendous, almost an impossible task apart from the wrong and the frightfulness of it.
('77', 210, 7, 17, 410122) Universal violence as a means of getting independence is certainly not easier than my way, as you say,

('77', 215, 1, 2, 418080) 257. WHY ONLY KHADI ?
('77', 215, 2, 3, 418102) Kumarappa has a grouse against me that although I am the author and guide of the A. I. V. I. A. I seem to treat it as a step child.
('77', 215, 2, 4, 418234) I have retorted that the grouse is due to superficial reasoning.
('77', 215, 2, 5, 418299) He will not take a defeat lying down.
('77', 215, 2, 6, 418337) He has returned to the charge again and again, and refuses to be satisfied till I proclaim to the world that the other village industries stand on the same footing with khadi.
('77', 215, 2, 7, 418513) For me the proposition was so self evident as not to need any enunciation.
('77', 215, 2, 8, 418588) But Prof.
('77', 215, 2, 9, 418598) Kumarappa is right so far as practical application is concerned.
('77', 215, 2, 10, 418663) People are not governed by theory.
('77', 215, 2, 11, 418698) Thus several people have recently complained to me that they know men who use khadi but use no other village articles.
('77', 215, 2, 12, 418817) They suggest that many Congressmen wear khadi because it is required by the constitution.
('77', 215, 2, 13, 418907) But having no belief in it they never think of anything but their convenience so far as other articles of use are concerned.
('77', 215, 2, 14, 419032) This I call fulfilling the letter and killing the spirit.
('77', 215, 2, 15, 419090) And where the spirit is killed the letter is of as much use as a body from which life has ebbed away.
('77', 215, 2, 16, 419192) I have often said that khadi is the central sun round which the other village industries revolve like so many planets.
('77', 215, 2, 17, 419311) They have no independent existence.
('77', 215, 2, 18, 419347) Nor will khadi exist without the other industries.
('77', 215, 2, 19, 419398) They are absolutely inter dependent.
('77', 215, 2, 20, 419435) The fact is that we have to make a choice between India of the villages that are as ancient as herself and India of the cities which are a creation of foreign domination.
('77', 215, 2, 21, 419606) Today the cities dominate and drain the villages so that they are crumbling to ruin.
('77', 215, 2, 22, 419691) My khadi mentality tells me that cities must subserve village when that domination goes.
('77', 215, 2, 23, 419780) Exploiting of villages is itself organized violence.
('77', 215, 2, 24, 419833) If we want swaraj to be built on non violence, we will have to give the villages their proper place.
('77', 215, 2, 25, 419934) This we will never do unless we revive village industries by using the products thereof in place of things produced in city factories, foreign or indigenous.
('77', 215, 2, 26, 420092) Perhaps it is now clear why I identify khadi with non violence.
('77', 215, 2, 27, 420156) Khadi is the chief village handicraft.
('77', 215, 2, 28, 420195) Kill khadi and you must kill the villages and with them non violence.
('77', 215, 2, 29, 420265) I cannot prove this by statistics.
('77', 215, 2, 30, 420300) The proof is before our eyes.
('77', 215, 2, 31, 420330) SEGAON, January 14, 1940 Harijan, 20 1 1940

('77', 216, 1, 2, 420454) 258. NO SUPPRESSION
('77', 216, 2, 3, 420474) A Bengali friend came to me during the week and said that though Bengal was ready for battle the Working Committee and especially I were suppressing it and thus damaging the nation’s cause.
('77', 216, 2, 4, 420664) This is a serious charge.
('77', 216, 2, 5, 420690) The Working Committee can take care of itself.
('77', 216, 2, 6, 420737) So far as I know, it has suppressed no province and no person.
('77', 216, 2, 7, 420800) But I can say as the sole authority on satyagraha that I have never suppressed any body or organization.
('77', 216, 2, 8, 420905) Satyagraha does not admit of such suppression.
('77', 216, 2, 9, 420952) Thus though I have been ignorantly accused of suppressing the people of Rajkot, I never suppressed them.
('77', 216, 2, 10, 421057) They were at liberty, as they are now, to civilly resist authority.
('77', 216, 2, 11, 421125) Even one person could do so if he had the conviction.
('77', 216, 2, 12, 421179) If he is wrong, he can only harm himself, not his opponent.
('77', 216, 2, 13, 421239) Hence it is that I have called satyagraha the most harmless, if also the most potent, remedy against wrongs.
('77', 216, 2, 14, 421348) What, however, I did in the case of Rajkot was to use the authority the satyagrahis of Rajkot had given me, to suspend civil resistance.
('77', 216, 2, 15, 421485) It was open to them to reject my advice—it could hardly be dignified by the name of command.
('77', 216, 2, 16, 421578) If they had, and if they had got responsible government, they would have received my congra tulations.
('77', 216, 2, 17, 421681) Some readers may remember that the Working Committee had refused to sanction civil resistance in Chirala Perala 1 but had left the Chirala people to declare it at their own risk.
('77', 216, 2, 18, 421860) Likewise it is open to Bengal, as also to any other province, on its own initiative and at its own risk, to offer civil resistance.
('77', 216, 2, 19, 421992) What it cannot have is my approval or support.
('77', 216, 2, 20, 422039) And if the Bengal Provincial Congress Committee wholly repudiates the authority of the Working Committee, it can, with all the greater force and propriety, do as it likes.
('77', 216, 2, 21, 422211) If it succeeds, it will cover itself with glory, overthrow the present leadership, and rule the Congress organization as it will deserve to.
('77', 216, 2, 22, 422352) I have prescribed the conditions of successful civil resistance.
('77', 216, 2, 23, 422417) But if the Bengal Provincial Congress Committee thinks that the Muslim masses are with the Congress, if it thinks that both Hindus and Muslims are ready for the fight, if it thinks that neither non violence nor the charkha is necessary or that non violence has no connection with the charkha, and if it fails to declare war, it will then be untrue to itself and to the country.
('77', 216, 2, 24, 422795) What I have said applies to every province and part of India.
('77', 216, 2, 25, 422857) But as the most experienced satyagrahi I must be allowed to utter a note of warning to all concerned that whoever declares civil resistance
('77', 216, 3, 26, 422997) 1 Vide “Chirala Perala”, 25 8 1921.
('77', 217, 0, 1, 423033) 218 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 217, 1, 2, 423075) without the proper training and a full appreciation of the conditions of satyagraha is likely to bring disaster to the cause he espouses.

('77', 218, 2, 10, 425805) 260. ENGLISH OPINION ON INDIAN STRUGGLE
('77', 218, 3, 11, 425845) A friend forwards the following two cuttings from The Cambridge Review.
('77', 218, 3, 12, 425917) 1 The signatories are distinguished men and women of letters.
('77', 218, 3, 13, 425979) I publish them to show that thoughtful English men and women who used to be indifferent about India are now studying Indian affairs and are unreservedly supporting the struggle for Indian Independence.
('77', 218, 3, 14, 426181) SEGAON, January 14, 1940 Harijan, 20 1 1940
('77', 218, 4, 15, 426225) 1 Eileen Power, Susan Stebbing, M. H. Dobb, David Hardman, H. L. Elvin, Harold J. Laski, Joseph Needham and J. Robinson had in a letter expressed their keen sympathy with the Indians in their struggle “against indescribable poverty, the persistence of feudal anomalies” and their eagerness to extend their active co operation to the Indian people.
('77', 218, 4, 16, 426573) They had welcomed the setting up of an Indian Independence Committee in Cambridge to provide information about India and to explain and advocate the Congress policy.
('77', 218, 4, 17, 426739) In another letter R. R. Pittam and M. J. C. Hodgart had protested against the policy of the National Government towards India.
('77', 218, 4, 18, 426866) “The Indian people,” they wrote, “demand freedom and democracy in order to overcome the economic and political backwardness which 150 years of foreign rule has done little or nothing to alleviate.
('77', 218, 4, 19, 427063) No formula which does not grant these things can be satisfactory, nor can it produce anything but conflict and disorder.” The writers, advocating the proposal of the Indian National Congress to introduce universal adult franchise, had said, “No minority in India which genuinely believes in freedom objects to this, and it is a demand with which the British people are in full sympathy.” Also, in their opinion, Dominion Status was meaningless, for “the Indian people have no cultural, religious or racial ties with Britain.”
