('77', 220, 3, 8, 429318) 263. DISCUSSION WITH ENGLISH PACIFISTS 1
('77', 220, 4, 9, 429359) SEGAON, [Before January 15, 1940] 2
('77', 220, 5, 10, 429395) Whilst the pacifists appreciated the position taken up by India, their difficulty was how, if Gandhiji accepted the Allied cause as just and said that he would pray for the victory of Britain, he had advised the Congress not to offer its co operation to Britain.
('77', 220, 6, 11, 429658) Gandhiji explained that any co operation or non co operation that the Congress could offer would be moral and not material.
('77', 220, 6, 12, 429782) Materially Britain’s position would not be affected by either attitude, for the contribution in men and money that Britain exacted from India as a subject nation would continue.
('77', 220, 6, 13, 429960) When a non violent India wished Britain victory it was not victory for Britain, right or wrong, but victory for Britain which in going to war against Germany was less in the wrong and more in the right.
('77', 220, 6, 14, 430163) But if there was no satisfactory declaration of the war aims regarding India, the moral support that Britain would gain would not be forthcoming.
('77', 220, 6, 15, 430309) The result would be quite different if the Congress were indifferent as to means.
('77', 220, 6, 16, 430391) She would in that case foment a rebellion and offer effective obstruction.
('77', 220, 7, 17, 430466) [Q.] Now it would be mental violence and not physical violence ?
('77', 220, 8, 18, 430531) [A.] Maybe.
('77', 220, 8, 19, 430543) But the non co operation that may come would be non violent.
('77', 220, 8, 20, 430604) Mental violence has no potency and injures only the person whose thoughts are violent.
('77', 220, 8, 21, 430691) It is otherwise with mental non violence.
('77', 220, 8, 22, 430733) It has potency which the world does not yet know.
('77', 220, 8, 23, 430783) And what I want is non violence of thought and need.
('77', 220, 8, 24, 430836) Such non violent support can be available to Britain only if her cause is demonstrably just, even though from a pacifist standpoint her means are violent and therefore bad.
('77', 220, 8, 25, 431009) Her cause will not be just if she is not just to India, i.e., if of her own accord and without reference to the
('77', 220, 9, 26, 431121) 1 Reproduced from Mahadev Desai’s article “A Pacifist’s Doubts” date January 15, 1940 2 ibid.
('77', 221, 0, 1, 431215) 222 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 221, 1, 2, 431257) parties in India she does not wash her hands clean of the imperialist exploitation of India.
('77', 221, 1, 3, 431350) Therefore, non violent India’s prayer will be for Britain’s victory when she declares in unequivocal terms that India is a free nation in action now, and in law as soon as possible, maybe even during the war.
('77', 221, 1, 4, 431559) This she will do from the heart only when she begins to rely more on the efficacy of the moral support of non violent India than on her own strong arm.
('77', 221, 1, 5, 431711) If England can take this step, the war will end in peace through moral force, rather than through superiority of arms.
('77', 221, 1, 6, 431830) Harijan, 20 1 1940
('77', 221, 2, 7, 431849) 264. A WELCOME MOVE
('77', 221, 3, 8, 431869) On the Deliverance Thanksgiving Day declared by Jinnah Saheb 1 I had the following wire from Gulbarga Muslims : “Deliverance Day greetings, Quaid e Azam Jinnah Zindabad”.
('77', 221, 3, 9, 432040) I took it as a message sent to ruffle my feelings.
('77', 221, 3, 10, 432091) The senders little knew that the wire could not serve its purpose.
('77', 221, 3, 11, 432158) When I received it, I silently joined the senders in the wish “Long Live Quaid e Azam Jinnah.” The Quaid e Azam is an old comrade.
('77', 221, 3, 12, 432289) What does it matter that today we do not see eye to eye in some matters ?
('77', 221, 3, 13, 432363) That can make no difference in my goodwill towards him.
('77', 221, 3, 14, 432419) But the Quaid e Azam has given me special reason for congratulating him.
('77', 221, 3, 15, 432492) I had the pleasure of wiring him congratulations on his excellent Id day broadcast.
('77', 221, 3, 16, 432576) And now he commands further congratu lations on forming pacts with parties who are opposed to the Congress policies and politics.
('77', 221, 3, 17, 432706) He is thus lifting the Muslim League out of the communal rut and giving it a national character.
('77', 221, 3, 18, 432803) I regard his step as perfectly legitimate.
('77', 221, 3, 19, 432846) I observe that the Justice Party and Dr. Ambedkar’s party have already joined Jinnah Saheb.
('77', 221, 3, 20, 432938) The papers report too that Shri Savarkar, the President of the Hindu Mahasabha, is to see him presently.
('77', 221, 3, 21, 433043) Jinnah Saheb himself has informed the public that many non Congress Hindus have expressed their sympathy with him.
('77', 221, 3, 22, 433158) I regard this develop ment as thoroughly healthy.
('77', 221, 3, 23, 433208) Nothing can be better than that we should have in the country mainly two parties— Congress and non Congress or anti Congress, if the latter expression is preferred.
('77', 221, 3, 24, 433373) Jinnah Saheb is giving the word ‘minority’ a new and good content.
('77', 221, 3, 25, 433440) The Congress majority is made up of a combination of
('77', 221, 4, 26, 433493) 1 Vide “Statement to the Press”, 9 12 1939
('77', 222, 0, 1, 433536) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 223
('77', 222, 1, 2, 433585) caste Hindus, non caste Hindus, Muslims, Christians, Parsis and Jews.
('77', 222, 1, 3, 433655) Therefore it is a majority drawn from all classes, representing a particular body of opinion; and the proposed combination becomes a minority representing another body of opinion.
('77', 222, 1, 4, 433835) This may any day convert itself into a majority by commending itself to the electorate.
('77', 222, 1, 5, 433923) Such an alignment of parties is a consummation devoutly to be wished.
('77', 222, 1, 6, 433993) If the Quaid e Azam can bring about the combination, not only I but the whole of india will shout with one acclamation : ‘Long Live Quaid e Azam Jinnah.’ For he will have brought about permanent and living unity for which I am sure the whole nation is thirsting.

('77', 222, 2, 8, 434300) 265. MY SIN
('77', 222, 3, 9, 434312) The following is a summary of a long indictment from a Muslim official of a Punjab Congress Committee : Your public statements show that you are deeply distressed over the differences among the major communities of India.
('77', 222, 3, 10, 434534) Apart from the natural fear of the Mussalmans of a dominant majority at the Centre, it is chiefly your personality which is forcing the Mussalmans to ally themselves with the imperialist Government and thus array themselves against the Congress.
('77', 222, 3, 11, 434780) The student of current events has to thank you for driving the brave and liberty loving Mussalmans into the reactionary fold.
('77', 222, 3, 12, 434906) You claim that “from its very commencement the Congress has been a wholly political organization and never communal.
('77', 222, 3, 13, 435023) It has proved its claim repeatedly and on every relevant occasion.” You have written : “The Congress has refused to represent any but the national cause.” Of course the Indian National Congress was organized as a non communal body for the political emancipation of India.
('77', 222, 3, 14, 435295) But when you say that “if untouchability exists Hinduism cannot survive”, you admit that the uplift of the Harijans is a purely Hindu cause and is a question of the life and death of Hinduism.
('77', 222, 3, 15, 435488) In spite of this for the twenty years of your life in India you have used the Congress platform for the removal of untouchability and have included it in the constructive programme of the Congress.
('77', 222, 3, 16, 435686) The Mussalmans do not grudge you the right to work for the uplift of the
('77', 223, 0, 1, 435759) 224 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 223, 1, 2, 435801) Harijans provided it is on a separate platform.
('77', 223, 1, 3, 435849) But why should you include what you yourself admit to be a purely Hindu cause in the constructive programme of the Congress ?
('77', 223, 1, 4, 435975) You have thus made the background of the Congress so aggressively Hindu that it requires little effort to keep the Mussalmans away from the Congress.
('77', 223, 1, 5, 436125) The misfortune is that most of the Congressmen have been infused with the same narrow mindedness and indiscretion as have characterized your leadership.
('77', 223, 1, 6, 436278) To most of them freedom of India means going back to an age 2,500 years old and thrusting their religion and culture on eight crores of unwilling Mussalmans.
('77', 223, 1, 7, 436436) But the communal question seen from the right perspective is not as insoluble as it appears to be.
('77', 223, 1, 8, 436535) Even now prudence coupled with large heartedness may undo the wrong done to the cause of national unity.
('77', 223, 1, 9, 436640) The Constituent Assembly is not only an expedient for the political problem facing India but is under the present circumstances the best and the only way out of the communal muddle.
('77', 223, 1, 10, 436822) But an article from your pen in Harijan 1 is not sufficient.
('77', 223, 1, 11, 436883) It is necessary to incorporate in the resolution 2 on the Constituent Assembly a clear worded clause assuring the Mussalmans that their representatives to the said Assembly would be elected on separate electorates, and that regarding matter relating to their religion and culture the decision of a two third majority of their representatives would be accepted without hitch or hindrance.
('77', 223, 1, 12, 437271) Then again a mere resolution passed to the above effect would not suffice.
('77', 223, 1, 13, 437346) It would be necessary to carry on continuous, systematic and intensive propaganda in order to bring home to every Mussalman the implication of the Constituent Assembly especially of the clause dealing with the election and powers of the representatives of the Mussalmans.
('77', 223, 1, 14, 437618) Only in this way can the Congress gain the confidence of the Mussalman masses and cut the ground from under the feet of those who try to mislead them by creating the bogey of their religion and culture being in danger.
('77', 223, 1, 15, 437837) India can free itself the very day the Congress succeeds in winning the confidence of the Mussalmans.
('77', 223, 1, 16, 437939) Britain dare not hold in bondage a united India.
('77', 223, 1, 17, 437988) Therefore the fight for freedom should take the form of adopting measures for and putting into practice the ideal
('77', 223, 2, 18, 438102) 1 Vide “The Only Way”, 19 11 1939. 2 ibid.
('77', 224, 0, 1, 438145) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 225
('77', 224, 1, 2, 438194) of Hindu Muslim unity.
('77', 224, 1, 3, 438217) Perhaps one thing has become clear to you now, namely, that Hindu Muslim unity cannot come about by negotiating with the Muslim League or any other organization.
('77', 224, 1, 4, 438379) I have left out nothing relevant from the letter.
('77', 224, 1, 5, 438429) The charge coming from a responsible Congressman is amazing.
('77', 224, 1, 6, 438490) The programme of non co operation was passed 1 in consultation with the Ali Brothers 2
('77', 224, 2, 7, 438577) and at a time when the Congress had the full hearted co operation of the most influential Muslims.
('77', 224, 2, 8, 438676) The programme contained removal of untouchability by Hindus.

('77', 224, 2, 11, 438903) Non violent politics cannot be divorced from moral uplift.
('77', 224, 2, 12, 438962) And why does the correspondent forget that Khilafat itself was a purely religious cause ?
('77', 224, 2, 13, 439052) There were non Congress Hindus then as there are now who thought and think that it was a grave mistake made by the Congress in taking up the Khilafat wrong.
('77', 224, 2, 14, 439209) I have no doubt whatsover as to the correctness of the Congress step.
('77', 224, 2, 15, 439279) And if a similar thing occurred again, I should not hesitate to give my life in aiding my Muslim brethren.
('77', 224, 2, 16, 439386) “A friend in need is a friend indeed.” I hope, therefore, that my correspondent and those who think like him will correct their thought and believe with me that every act of purification in any sect or community promotes the well being of the whole, of which they from a part, and therefore deserves encouragement from all platforms.
('77', 224, 2, 17, 439720) As to the Constituent Assembly everything the correspondent says has been conceded by the Congress.
('77', 224, 2, 18, 439820) Propaganda is also going on.
('77', 224, 2, 19, 439849) But Congressmen and especially Congress Muslims may not sit with folded hands and expect the Working Committee to carry on the work.
('77', 224, 2, 20, 439982) The Working Committee’s function is to supervise, guide and advise the organization and to administer its routine work.
('77', 224, 2, 21, 440102) But propaganda can only be carried on if thousands of Congressmen interest themselves in it.
('77', 224, 2, 22, 440195) If the programme mapped by the Congress is insipid, Congressmen can turn out the present guides in a moment.
('77', 224, 2, 23, 440304) This is true especially because the Congress has accepted non violence as its policy.
('77', 224, 2, 24, 440390) Its success is dependent on the whole hearted co

('77', 225, 1, 2, 440609) operation of every single Congressman.
('77', 225, 1, 3, 440648) In that sense the Congress is the largest instrument of political education in the country.
('77', 225, 1, 4, 440740) Everyone who comes on the Congress register becomes a candidate for political education.
('77', 225, 1, 5, 440829) There should be a hand book to impart such education.

('77', 226, 5, 11, 442820) Shri Jayaprakash Narayan 1 and Shri Sampurnanand 2 have spoken in no uncertain terms against the addendum to the pledge 3 to be taken on the 26th inst.
('77', 226, 5, 12, 442972) I have great regard for them.
('77', 226, 5, 13, 443002) They are able and brave and have suffered for the country.
('77', 226, 5, 14, 443061) I should count it a privilege to have them as companions in arms.
('77', 226, 5, 15, 443127) I should love to win them over to my viewpoint.
('77', 226, 5, 16, 443175) If the battle is to come and I am to lead it, I should not be able to do so with half convinced or doubting lieutenants.
('77', 226, 5, 17, 443296) I am not spoiling for a fight.
('77', 226, 5, 18, 443327) I am trying to avoid it.
('77', 226, 5, 19, 443352) Whatever may be true of the members of the Working Committee, I wholly endorse Subhas Babu’s charge that I am eager to have a compromise with Britain if it can be had with honour.
('77', 226, 5, 20, 443532) Indeed satyagraha demands it.
('77', 226, 5, 21, 443562) Therefore I am in no hurry.
('77', 226, 5, 22, 443590) And yet if the time came and if I had no follower, I should be able to put up a single handed fight.
('77', 226, 5, 23, 443691) But I have not lost faith in Britain.
('77', 226, 5, 24, 443729) I like the latest pronouncement of Lord Linlithgow.
('77', 226, 5, 25, 443781) 4 I believe in his sincerity.
('77', 226, 5, 26, 443811) There are undoubted snags in that speech.
('77', 226, 5, 27, 443853) Many is have to be dotted, many ts have to be crossed.
('77', 226, 5, 28, 443908) But it seems to contain germs of a settlement honourable to both nations.
('77', 226, 5, 29, 443982) Those, therefore, who work with me have to appreciate this side of me.
('77', 226, 5, 30, 444053) Perhaps from the standpoint of the dissentients this compromising nature of mine is a disqualification.
('77', 226, 5, 31, 444157) If it is, the country should know it.

('77', 229, 0, 1, 449607) 230 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 229, 1, 2, 449649) It has been suggested to me by a Congressman wielding great influence that as soon as I declare civil resistance I would find a staggering response this time.
('77', 229, 1, 3, 449808) The whole labour world and the kisans in many parts of India will, he assures me, declare a simultaneous strike.
('77', 229, 1, 4, 449921) I told him that, if that happened, I should be most embarrassed and all my plan would be upset.
('77', 229, 1, 5, 450017) I must confess that I have no positive plan in front of me.
('77', 229, 1, 6, 450077) Let me say that God will send me the plan when He gives the word as He has done before now.
('77', 229, 1, 7, 450169) He has been my unfailing Guide and has sustained me throughout my stormy life.
('77', 229, 1, 8, 450248) This, however, I know that no plan that I may put before the country will admit of unregulated and sporadic strikes, because that must lead to violence and therefore automatic suspension of the non violent struggle.
('77', 229, 1, 9, 450464) It would amount to my dismissal.
('77', 229, 1, 10, 450497) I am sure that socialist leaders and other dissentients do not expect me to embark on a struggle which I know beforehand is likely to end in disaster.
('77', 229, 1, 11, 450648) I ask for lieutenants and men who will act as one mind.
('77', 229, 1, 12, 450704) Even if somehow or other we achieve nominal independence, we cannot conduct national affairs with any degree of success unless we have won the struggle in the manner prescribed by me.
('77', 229, 1, 13, 450888) Without real non violence there would be perfect anarchy.
('77', 229, 1, 14, 450946) I hope I am not expected knowingly to undertake a fight that must end in anarchy and red ruin.

('77', 236, 1, 2, 460274) 281. NOTES
('77', 236, 2, 3, 460285) IMPERIALISM DIES HARD As I do not read newspapers but merely glance through the headings now and then, Pyarelal collects for me cuttings from various sources.
('77', 236, 2, 4, 460444) These I read when I get odd moments.
('77', 236, 2, 5, 460481) I chance upon one which contains the following instructions for bowing for those who were to receive decorations at the hands of H. E. the Governor of the United Provinces on the 16th instant :
('77', 236, 3, 6, 460675) When your name is read out by the Secretary you will kindly move on to the edge of the carpet and you first bow to His Excellency.
('77', 236, 4, 7, 460806) Then advance to the centre of the carpet and bow again.
('77', 236, 5, 8, 460862) Then advance to the foot of the dais on which His Excellency will be standing and bow again.
('77', 236, 6, 9, 460955) You will then be invested by His Excellency.
('77', 236, 6, 10, 461000) His Excellency will then shake hands with you.
('77', 236, 6, 11, 461047) Then you should bow.
('77', 236, 7, 12, 461068) Then proceed four paces backwards and bow again.
('77', 236, 8, 13, 461117) Then turn about and proceed to your seat.
('77', 236, 9, 14, 461159) All officers, military or police.
('77', 236, 9, 15, 461193) attending in head dress will salute and not bow.
('77', 236, 10, 16, 461242) N.B.—The bow should be made by bending the head forward only and should not be made from the waist.
('77', 236, 11, 17, 461342) Sir Samuel Hoare says imperialism is dead.
('77', 236, 11, 18, 461385) Every Congressman knows that it is dying.
('77', 236, 11, 19, 461427) These instructions show that it will die hard.
('77', 236, 11, 20, 461474) I never knew that this process of humiliation still continued.
('77', 236, 11, 21, 461537) Decorations themselves are a symbol of imperialism.
('77', 236, 11, 22, 461589) They are a means of overawing and bribing people, a reward for so called loyal services and sometimes for gaining the applause or the silent approbation of distinguished men and women.
('77', 236, 11, 23, 461774) When these decorations are accompanied by humiliating ceremonial, they excite angry feelings and mad passions of those who come to know about them.
('77', 236, 11, 24, 461922) It is to be hoped that, while a move towards real democracy is being made, those who are in charge will make it a point of removing everything that savours of superiority and the humiliating spirit.
('77', 237, 0, 1, 462121) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 238
('77', 237, 1, 2, 462163) THE CONGRESS AND KHADI I have letters complaining that the khadi clause 1 of the Congress Constitution is honoured more in the breach than in the observance.
('77', 237, 1, 3, 462321) The correspondents’ chief complaint is that, in selecting Congress candidates for municipalities and local boards, the Congress officials do not enforce the khadi clause.
('77', 237, 1, 4, 462492) One correspondent says that the obligation to wear khadi is waived because the Congress officials do not find competent enough candidates among khadi wearers.
('77', 237, 1, 5, 462651) This would be, if the dearth of proper men can be proved, a sound reason for altering the clause, surely not for committing a deliberate breach of the Congress Constitution.
('77', 237, 1, 6, 462825) A writer justifies the waiver by arguing that there is no connection between swaraj and khadi.
('77', 237, 1, 7, 462920) This again may be reason for a change in the Constitution but not for disregarding it.
('77', 237, 1, 8, 463007) Every Congressman is a potential civil resister.
('77', 237, 1, 9, 463056) The right to civil disobedience accrues only to those who perform the duty of voluntarily obeying the laws of the State, more so the laws of their own making.
('77', 237, 1, 10, 463215) Therefore congressmen are taking grave risks when they commit wilful breaches of the Constitution.
('77', 237, 1, 11, 463314) And is there no connection between swaraj and khadi ?
('77', 237, 1, 12, 463368) Were the Congressmen who made themselves responsible for the khadi clause in the Constitution so dense that they did not see the fallacy which is so obvious to some critics ?
('77', 237, 1, 13, 463543) I have not hesitated to say, and I make bold to repeat, that there is no swaraj for the millions, for the hungry and the naked and for the millions of illiterate women without khadi.
('77', 237, 1, 14, 463726) Habitual use of khadi is a sign that the wearer identifies himself with the poorest in the land, and has patriotism and self sacrifice enough in him to wear khadi even though it may not be so soft or elegant in appearance as foreign fineries, nor so cheap.
('77', 237, 1, 15, 463983) SEGAON, January 22, 1940 Harijan, 27 1 1940
('77', 237, 2, 16, 464027) 282. THE INDEPENDENCE DAY
('77', 237, 3, 17, 464053) Though questions regarding the forthcoming Independence Day Pledge should be properly addressed to the congress Secretary and though the President alone can give authoritative answers, they are continually being addressed to me; and as I have undertaken the duty of declaring civil resistance and leading the army, should a struggle
('77', 237, 4, 18, 464386) 1 Vide “Constitution of the Indian National Congress Qualifications”, 28 10 1934.
('77', 238, 0, 1, 464468) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 239
('77', 238, 1, 2, 464517) become necessary, it becomes incumbent on me to answer certain questions before 26th January.
('77', 238, 1, 3, 464611) 1. Let it be remembered that, if civil resistance is to be declared, it will have to be more civil and more non violent than ever before, if only to show the warring nations of the earth that a big people like that of India can fight non violently for regaining their freedom.
('77', 238, 1, 4, 464888) Therefore I shall resolutely refuse to fight unless I have sufficient confidence that Congressmen will render implicit obedience.
('77', 238, 1, 5, 465018) 2. There is as much valour in self denial as there is in rushing into the furnace, provided that the motive is the same in either case.
('77', 238, 1, 6, 465154) 3. The Independence Day is an annual feature in the Congress programme and is unconnected with civil resistance.
('77', 238, 1, 7, 465267) Hence the forthcoming celebration must not be mistaken for declaration of civil resistance.
('77', 238, 1, 8, 465359) Nevertheless it would serve as an index of the discipline among Congressmen and those millions who have hitherto answered the Congress call.
('77', 238, 1, 9, 465500) There should on the one hand be the largest demonstration of all the previous ones we have had, and on the other it should be of a character so peaceful as to disarm all criticism and induce and enable women with babes, little children and aged people to join the demonstration.
('77', 238, 1, 10, 465779) Such was the demonstration on 6th April, 1919, in Bombay.
('77', 238, 2, 11, 465837) 4. Students have asked me what they should do.
('77', 238, 2, 12, 465884) I would expect them individually to take the pledge, for it means their determination to win independence for India through truthful non violent means symbolized in the constructive programme in which the charkha is the central activity.
('77', 238, 2, 13, 466122) The other items are harmony among different communities and eradication of untouchability.
('77', 238, 2, 14, 466213) These do not constitute the struggle but their fulfilment is indispensable for it.
('77', 238, 2, 15, 466296) If the struggle comes, the students will not strike.
('77', 238, 2, 16, 466349) They will leave their schools or colleges for good.
('77', 238, 2, 17, 466401) But the students will not strike on the 26th.
('77', 238, 2, 18, 466447) It will be good if the authorities themselves, as they well might, close their institutions and lead their staff and students in processions and other items of the programme.
('77', 238, 2, 19, 466622) The same thing applies to labour.
('77', 238, 2, 20, 466656) Those who without leave absent themselves from their work will in my opinion be guilty of indiscipline and render themselves unfit for enlisting as soldiers in the satyagraha army.
('77', 238, 2, 21, 466837) Non violence is all
('77', 238, 3, 22, 466857) 1 Vide “Speech on Hindu Muslim Friendship, Bombay”, 6 4 1919.
('77', 239, 0, 1, 466919) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 240
('77', 239, 1, 2, 466961) discipline, wholly voluntary.
('77', 239, 1, 3, 466991) It is clear from the foregoing that those who do not believe in and use khadi cannot take the pledge.
('77', 239, 1, 4, 467093) 5. The pledge is not designed, as some fear, to eliminate strikes and no tax campaigns.
('77', 239, 1, 5, 467181) But I must at once confess that I have in my mind neither strikes nor no tax campaigns as part of the forthcoming struggle, if it comes at all.
('77', 239, 1, 6, 467325) In my opinion the present atmosphere is not conducive to non violent strikes and non violent no tax campaigns on an extensive scale.
('77', 239, 1, 7, 467458) 6. I expect the whole weight of the Congress organization to be devoted to popularizing khadi and clearing the existing stocks.
('77', 239, 1, 8, 467586) 7. For me satyagraha is a method of self purification.
('77', 239, 1, 9, 467641) The word was first used in the A.I.C.C. resolution of 1921. The constructive programme has been designed for that purpose.
('77', 239, 1, 10, 467764) Though the word has fallen into disrepute, I as the author of the programme must have the courage to repeat it.
('77', 239, 1, 11, 467876) We began satyagraha with a 24 hours’ fast in 1919. I propose to observe one myself on the 26th beginning in the evening of the 25th.
('77', 239, 1, 12, 468009) And those who believe in its efficacy will do likewise.
('77', 239, 1, 13, 468065) 8. Though I am preparing myself in the best manner I know and inviting the country to join me for a struggle for the overthrow of the imperialistic spirit and all it means, I am making a despe rate effort to avoid the struggle.
('77', 239, 1, 14, 468293) I believe that the best mind of England, nay, of the world, is sick of the exploitation by the strong of the less strong.
('77', 239, 1, 15, 468415) I believe in the sincerity of Lord Linlithgow.
('77', 239, 1, 16, 468462) In the immediate carrying out of policies it is the individuals who count.

('77', 242, 1, 2, 472025) 287. AHIMSA IN PRACTICE
('77', 242, 2, 3, 472049) Thus writes Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia 1 :
('77', 242, 3, 4, 472087) Does the Independence Pledge necessitate belief in a social order for free India which will be based exclusively on the charkha and the present constructive programme ?
('77', 242, 3, 5, 472256) I personally feel that it does not.
('77', 242, 3, 6, 472292) The pledge is inclusive of the charkha and village crafts, but it is not exclusive of other industries and economic activities.
('77', 242, 3, 7, 472420) Among these industries may be mentioned those of electricity, ship building, machine making and the like.
('77', 242, 3, 8, 472526) The question of emphasis still remains.
('77', 242, 3, 9, 472566) The pledge decides it only to the extent that belief in the charkha and village crafts as an integral part of the future social order is essential and cannot be superseded by other belief.
('77', 242, 4, 10, 472755) Does the pledge immediately necessitate abandonment of every other action except such as is based on the present constructive programme ?
('77', 242, 4, 11, 472893) I personally feel that it does not.
('77', 242, 4, 12, 472929) Agitation against land rents, taxes, interest and other economic obstructions to the advance of our people appears to be permissible.
('77', 242, 4, 13, 473063) It is not, for instance, impossible that you should yourself decide upon a no rent and no tax campaign when you choose to start satyagraha.
('77', 242, 4, 14, 473203) Whether you actually do so or not is not so important from the viewpoint of the pledge as the fact that you may do it.
('77', 242, 4, 15, 473322) At any rate, agitation on economic lines is today permissible.
('77', 242, 5, 16, 473385) These two questions arise in so far as the negative aspect of the pledge is concerned.
('77', 242, 5, 17, 473472) A third question arises in regard to its positive aspect.
('77', 242, 5, 18, 473530) It is undoubtedly necessary that anyone who takes the pledge must be ready to express his positive faith in the principle of decentralized economy.
('77', 242, 5, 19, 473678) The actual forms of this faith may, however, be decided by the march of history.
('77', 242, 5, 20, 473759) Only in regard to the charkha it should be possible for anyone who takes the pledge to believe that the complete decentralization of the textile industry is possible and that it should be attempted.
('77', 242, 6, 21, 473958) I have not at all referred to irregularities of conduct due to indolence and similar causes; that happens in regard to all pledges and faiths.
('77', 242, 6, 22, 474101) Only the wish must be there to remove these irregularities.
('77', 242, 7, 23, 474161) I do not know if this interpretation of the pledge is correct and can meet with your approval.
('77', 242, 7, 24, 474256) I do not also know if my socialist comrades will approve
('77', 242, 8, 25, 474313) 1 (1910 1967); joined the Congress Socialist Party in 1934; Secretary, foreign department of the A.I.C.C., 1936 38; General Secretary, Praja Socialist Party, 1953 54; author of Marx, Gandhi and Socialism and other works
('77', 243, 0, 1, 474533) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 244
('77', 243, 1, 2, 474575) It might perhaps be worth while for the country to know soon your opinion.
('77', 243, 1, 3, 474650) Perhaps it is already too late for the Independence Day.
('77', 243, 1, 4, 474707) I need hardly repeat, what I have said often, that the legal and authoritative interpretation of the pledge can only come from the Working Committee.
('77', 243, 1, 5, 474857) My interpretation has as much authority as my questioners choose to give it.
('77', 243, 1, 6, 474934) On the whole I can say that I have no difficulty in accepting Dr. Lohia’s interpretation.
('77', 243, 1, 7, 475024) Whatever the ultimate outcome of the Congress effort, the discussion that is going on over the pledge provides healthy political education for the public and crystallizes the opinions that rule the various schools of thought in the country.
('77', 243, 1, 8, 475265) Though I am in general agreement with Dr. Lohia, it will be well for me to give the interpretation in my own language.
('77', 243, 1, 9, 475384) The pledge is not exhaustive.
('77', 243, 1, 10, 475414) It represents the limit to which I could carry the Working Committee with me.
('77', 243, 1, 11, 475492) If I can convert the country to my point of view, the social order of the future will be based predominantly on the charkha and all it implies.
('77', 243, 1, 12, 475636) It will include everything that promotes the well being of the villagers.
('77', 243, 1, 13, 475710) It will not exclude the industries mentioned by my correspondent so long as they do not smother the villages and village life.
('77', 243, 1, 14, 475837) I do visualize electricity, ship building, ironworks, machine making and the like existing side by side with village handicrafts.
('77', 243, 1, 15, 475967) But the order of dependence will be reversed.
('77', 243, 1, 16, 476013) Hitherto the industrialization has been so planned as to destroy the villages and village crafts.
('77', 243, 1, 17, 476111) In the State of the future it will subserve the villages and their crafts.
('77', 243, 1, 18, 476186) I do not share the socialist belief that centralization of the necessaries of life will conduce to the common welfare when the centralized industries are planned and owned by the State.
('77', 243, 1, 19, 476372) The socialistic conception of the West was born in an environment reeking with violence.
('77', 243, 1, 20, 476461) The motive lying behind the Western type and the Eastern is the same—the greatest welfare of the whole society and the abolition of the hideous inequalities resulting in the existence of millions of have nots and a handful of haves.
('77', 243, 1, 21, 476694) I believe that this end can be achieved only when non violence is accepted by the best mind of the world as the basis on which a just social order is to be constructed.
('77', 243, 1, 22, 476863) I hold that the coming into power of the proletariat through violence is bound to fail in the end.
('77', 243, 1, 23, 476962) What is gained by violence must be lost before superior violence.
('77', 243, 1, 24, 477028) India is within an ace of achieving the end, if only Congressmen will be true to
('77', 244, 0, 1, 477109) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 245
('77', 244, 1, 2, 477158) their creed of non violence and live up to it.
('77', 244, 1, 3, 477205) The working of the constructive programme is the test.
('77', 244, 1, 4, 477260) Those who play upon the passions of the masses injure them and the country’s cause.
('77', 244, 1, 5, 477344) That they have noble motives is irrelevant.
('77', 244, 1, 6, 477388) Why will not Congressmen work out the programme fully and faithfully ?
('77', 244, 1, 7, 477459) It will be time to consider other programmes when we have come into our own.
('77', 244, 1, 8, 477536) But like the fabled men who quarrelled over the division of the buffalo before it was bought, we argue and quarrel over our different programmes before swaraj has come.
('77', 244, 1, 9, 477705) Decency requires that when a programme is approved by the majority all should carry it out faithfully.
('77', 244, 1, 10, 477808) Most decidedly, the pledge does not necessitate the abandonment of the other items that have hitherto adorned the Congress programme and are adverted to by Dr. Lohia.
('77', 244, 1, 11, 477975) Agitation against every form of injustice is the breath of political life.
('77', 244, 1, 12, 478050) My contention is that, divorced from the constructive programme, it is bound to have the tinge of violence.
('77', 244, 1, 13, 478158) Let me illustrate my point.
('77', 244, 1, 14, 478186) My experiments in ahimsa have taught me that non violence in practice means common labour with the body.
('77', 244, 1, 15, 478291) A Russian philosopher, Bondoref, has called it bread labour.
('77', 244, 1, 16, 478352) It means closest co operation.
('77', 244, 1, 17, 478383) The first satyagrahis of South Africa laboured for the common good and the common purse and felt free like birds.
('77', 244, 1, 18, 478497) They included Hindus, Muslims (Shias and Sunnis), Christians (Protestants and Roman Catholics), Parsis, and Jews.
('77', 244, 1, 19, 478611) They included the English and the Germans.
('77', 244, 1, 20, 478654) By profession they were lawyers and architects, engineers, electricians, printers and traders.
('77', 244, 1, 21, 478749) Practice of truth and non violence melted religious differences, and we learnt to see beauty in each religion.
('77', 244, 1, 22, 478860) I do not remember a single religious quarrel in the two colonies 1 I founded in South Africa.
('77', 244, 1, 23, 478954) The common labour consisted of printing, carpentry, shoe making, gardening, house building, and the like.
('77', 244, 1, 24, 479060) Labour was no drudgery, it was a joy.
('77', 244, 1, 25, 479098) The evenings were devoted to literary pursuits.
('77', 244, 1, 26, 479146) These men, women and boys were the vanguard of the satyagraha army.
('77', 244, 1, 27, 479214) I could not wish for braver or more loyal comrades.
('77', 244, 1, 28, 479266) In India the South African experience was continued and, I trust, improved upon.
('77', 244, 1, 29, 479347) Labour in Ahmedabad is by common consent the best organized in India.
('77', 244, 1, 30, 479417) If it continues to work along the lines on which it began, it will ultimately own the mills in common with the present holders.
('77', 244, 1, 31, 479545) If that is not the natural outcome, its non violence will be found to contain flaws.
('77', 244, 2, 32, 479630) 1 Phoenix Settlement and Tolstoy Farm

('77', 245, 1, 2, 479710) peasants of Bardoli who gave Vallabhbhai the title of ‘Sardar’ and won their battle 3 and of Borsad 1 and Kheda 2 who did likewise, have for years been working the constructive programme.
('77', 245, 1, 3, 479898) They have not deteriorated as satyagrahis by working it.

('77', 245, 2, 10, 480659) 288. UNITY V. JUSTICE
('77', 245, 3, 11, 480681) A visitor came the other day and said, “You have done an irreparable injury to India by saying that there is no swaraj without communal unity.
('77', 245, 3, 12, 480824) You should say instead that there is no swaraj without justice between and to the different communities.” I reasoned with my visitor but he would not be consoled.
('77', 245, 3, 13, 480987) He said, “You have offered to sell your soul to win the favour of your Muslim friends.” I protested and said, “Surely you know, the world knows, that I would not sell my soul to buy India’s freedom.
('77', 245, 3, 14, 481186) And if I want Muslim friendship, it is not for personal gratification but for India’s sake.
('77', 245, 3, 15, 481278) You are unjust to me.” My visitor retorted with some passion, “I know your love for the country.
('77', 245, 3, 16, 481375) If I had not known it, I would not have come to you specially.
('77', 245, 3, 17, 481438) But your love has blinded you to the mistake you have made and are making.
('77', 245, 3, 18, 481513) You do not know what Hindus say and do.
('77', 245, 3, 19, 481553) For fear of offending Muslims, they suffer because they believe in you.
('77', 245, 3, 20, 481625) I do beseech you to replace ‘unity’ with ‘justice’.” It was no use my arguing with my friend.
('77', 245, 3, 21, 481719) And I had no time.
('77', 245, 3, 22, 481738) I promised to deal with the question in these columns.
('77', 245, 3, 23, 481793) The promise soothed him.
('77', 245, 4, 24, 481818) 1 In 1923; vide “Gujarat’s Efforts”, 6 4 1924. 2 In 1918.
('77', 246, 0, 1, 481876) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 247
('77', 246, 1, 2, 481925) I do not know that my answer will.
('77', 246, 1, 3, 481960) My belief is unshaken that without communal unity swaraj cannot be attained through non violence.
('77', 246, 1, 4, 482058) But unity cannot be reached without justice between communities.
('77', 246, 1, 5, 482123) Muslim or any other friendship cannot be bought with bribery.
('77', 246, 1, 6, 482185) Bribery would itself mean cowardice and therefore violence.
('77', 246, 1, 7, 482245) But if I give more than his due to my brother, I do not bribe him nor do I do any injustice.
('77', 246, 1, 8, 482338) I can disarm suspicion only by being generous.
('77', 246, 1, 9, 482385) Justice without generosity may easily become Shylock’s justice.
('77', 246, 1, 10, 482449) I must, however, take care that the generosity is not done at the expense of the very cause for which it is sought to be done.
('77', 246, 1, 11, 482576) I cannot, therefore, drop the idea of unity or the effort for it.
('77', 246, 1, 12, 482642) But what is wanted is not so much justice as right action.
('77', 246, 1, 13, 482701) Quaid e Azam Jinnah’s reply to me, as published in the Press, however, dashes to the ground all hope of unity if he represents the Muslim mind.
('77', 246, 1, 14, 482845) His repudiation of the natural meaning I put upon his action in making common cause with the different political groups 1 has created a unique situation.
('77', 246, 1, 15, 482999) His picture of India as a continent containing nations counted according to their religions, if it is realized, would undo the effort the Congress had been making for over half a century.
('77', 246, 1, 16, 483187) But I hope that Quaid e Azam Jinnah’s opinion is a temporary phase in the history of the Muslim League.
('77', 246, 1, 17, 483291) Muslims of the different provinces can never cut themselves away from their Hindu or Christian brethren.
('77', 246, 1, 18, 483396) Both Muslims and Christians are converts from Hinduism or are descendants of converts.
('77', 246, 1, 19, 483483) They do not cease to belong to their provinces because of change of faith.
('77', 246, 1, 20, 483558) Englishmen who become converts to Islam do not change their nationality.
('77', 246, 1, 21, 483631) I hope Quaid e Azam Jinnah does not represent the considered opinion even of his colleagues.

('77', 248, 4, 11, 487143) 290. SARDAR PRITHVI SINGH 2
('77', 248, 5, 12, 487171) Sardar Prithvi Singh has eschewed violence and taken to ahimsa; but he says it is a new experience for him.
('77', 248, 5, 13, 487279) He is making efforts like Bhagirath 3 to pass the test.
('77', 248, 5, 14, 487335) The future alone can reveal what the outcome will be.

('77', 248, 5, 16, 487435) During his underground days he worked to spread physical culture activities.

('77', 264, 1, 2, 509385) 321. FOURFOLD RUIN
('77', 264, 2, 3, 509404) Mr. F. E. James 1 is reported to have said as follows in a recent speech delivered by him at Madras :
('77', 264, 3, 4, 509506) Mr. James then referred to the Independence Pledge prescribed by the Congress and said that he did not like the following sentence in the pledge :
('77', 264, 4, 5, 509653) ‘The British Government in India has not only deprived the Indian people of their freedom but has based itself upon the exploitation of the masses and has ruined India economically, politically, culturally and spiritually.’
('77', 264, 5, 6, 509877) “Now I have got many friends in the Congress ranks, and I do feel that I have a right to protest against a statement which to my mind is not really necessary for the pledge itself.
('77', 264, 5, 7, 510058) It is a provocative statement and I very much doubt whether it is true in any case.
('77', 264, 5, 8, 510142) You can’t prove it any more than I can disprove it.” The speaker emphasized that it was not just to put all the debits on one side.
('77', 264, 5, 9, 510274) He was sure that those of his Congress friends who were free from hatred and prejudice could not repeat it without some mental reservation.
('77', 264, 5, 10, 510414) If they were asked to repeat that statement, it might lead to a great deal of bitterness, hatred and misunderstanding.
('77', 264, 5, 11, 510533) “I do feel,” he further pointed out, “that in this particular statement in the Independence Pledge there is to be found a contradiction between Gandhiji’s doctrine of non violence and the particular violence of the statement.” Mr. James is not alone in his condemnation of the part of the pledge quoted by him.
('77', 264, 5, 12, 510844) The Statesman has called the paragraph “an abominable falsehood”.
('77', 264, 5, 13, 510910) It should be remembered that this part was in the original and has stood without challenge all these ten years.
('77', 264, 5, 14, 511022) That of course is no reason for not criticizing it today if the criticism is well informed and sound.
('77', 264, 5, 15, 511124) V. G. Desai recently showed in these columns 2 how unsound the criticism was.
('77', 264, 5, 16, 511202) I revert to the subject because Mr. James sees a contradiction between my “doctrine of non violence and the particular violence of the statement”.
('77', 264, 5, 17, 511349) I presume that the statement will not be considered violent if it is believed by the maker.
('77', 264, 5, 18, 511441) For non violence does not consist in hiding the truth from oneself or the world; it consists in non violent conduct towards the wrong doer in spite of the most vivid knowledge of his misdeeds.
('77', 264, 5, 19, 511634) My inculcation of non violence has been effective because I have used
('77', 264, 6, 20, 511704) 1 Of the European group in the Central Legislative Assembly 2 Under the title “A Tissue of ‘Foul and Abominable Lies’ ”, in Harijan, 6 1 1940
('77', 265, 0, 1, 511846) 266 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 265, 1, 2, 511888) almost the same adjectives as the school of violence has in describing the effects of British Rule, and showed the most effective remedy for undoing them.
('77', 265, 1, 3, 512043) There is no merit in loving those who do you no ill, merit lies in being loving or being non violent towards those who ill use you.
('77', 265, 1, 4, 512175) When I described modern civilization symbolized in imperialism as godless in Hind Swaraj I know that I had nothing but goodwill towards those who represented it.
('77', 265, 1, 5, 512337) And is it not a fact staring one in the face that “the British Government in India has not only deprived the Indian people of their freedom but has based itself upon the exploitation of the masses and has ruined India economically, politically, culturally and spiritually” ?
('77', 265, 1, 6, 512612) A. O. Hume, Digby 1, Dadabhai 2, Wedderburn 3 and a host of other known and sober writers have taught the millions that the existing system of Government has drained the country of its wealth and reduced the peasantry to pauperism.
('77', 265, 1, 7, 512844) Political subjection is patent.
('77', 265, 1, 8, 512876) Cultural and spiritual conquest has at no time in India’s history been so complete as during the British Rule.
('77', 265, 1, 9, 512987) It is none the less galling or degrading because there has been a voluntary surrender.
('77', 265, 1, 10, 513074) A victim’s conquest is complete when he hugs the chains that bind him and begins to imitate the manners and customs of his captor.
('77', 265, 1, 11, 513205) Our household was turned upside down when my father had to attend the Durbar during a Governor’s visit.
('77', 265, 1, 12, 513309) He never wore stockings or boots or what were then called “whole boots”.
('77', 265, 1, 13, 513382) His general foot wear was soft leather slippers.
('77', 265, 1, 14, 513431) If I was a painter, I could paint my father’s disgust and torture on his face as he was putting his legs into his stocking and feet into ill fitting and uncomfortable boots.
('77', 265, 1, 15, 513605) He had to do this!
('77', 265, 1, 16, 513624) I happened to be in Calcutta when Lord Curzon was holding his levee.
('77', 265, 1, 17, 513693) I was staying in the India Club.
('77', 265, 1, 18, 513726) The toilet of the Rajas and Maharajas who were staying there was a study.
('77', 265, 1, 19, 513800) They looked like second editions of khansamas 4. Their ordinary dress was simple dhoti with the inimitable Bengali folds which only the Bengali wearers can produce and spotlessly white kurta and a thin shawl carelessly but gracefully flung round the body.
('77', 265, 1, 20, 514056) But this was considered indecent dress for the levee of the Crown Representative.
('77', 265, 1, 21, 514138) The big zamindars and the Princes must appear properly bedecked and bejewelled.
('77', 265, 1, 22, 514218) And what about the
('77', 265, 2, 23, 514237) 1 William Digby, Congress Agent in England 2 Dadabhoy Naoroji 3 Sir William Wedderburn, Congress President, 1889 4 Chef cum waiter
('77', 266, 0, 1, 514368) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 267
('77', 266, 1, 2, 514417) latest circular reproduced in these columns 1 prescribing repeated bowings at an investiture ceremony in the U.P. ?
('77', 266, 1, 3, 514533) Is not this cultural and spiritual degradation ?
('77', 266, 1, 4, 514582) Mr. James says : “You cannot prove it any more than I can disprove it.” The last half is as true as the first half of the sentence is untrue.
('77', 266, 1, 5, 514724) I have given only casual illustrations of the cultural conquest.
('77', 266, 1, 6, 514789) The tragedy is much deeper than I have depicted.
('77', 266, 1, 7, 514838) Should Englishmen take pride in the fact that many educated Indians cannot express them selves sufficiently in their own mother tongues, and that they have to transmit their inmost thoughts to their dear ones in the English langu age?
('77', 266, 1, 8, 515073) I ask them to realize with me the enormity of the ruination of cul ture that this fact means.
('77', 266, 1, 9, 515167) Many educated Indians have become saheblogs in their own land, and there is no living contact between them and the masses.
('77', 266, 1, 10, 515290) Thanks to the Congress, things are better, but they are only just better.
('77', 266, 1, 11, 515364) It is highly likely that the unnatural method of education has kept India from reaching her goal as nothing else has.
('77', 266, 1, 12, 515482) Educated India has been disabled from reaching the masses.
('77', 266, 1, 13, 515541) There are signs that Englishmen have begun to believe that India should come to her own.
('77', 266, 1, 14, 515630) But their conversion will not be complete if they do not realize the truth of the fourfold ruination of India.
('77', 266, 1, 15, 515741) If they are proud of the conquest of India and all it has meant, the gulf that divides them from us remains.
('77', 266, 1, 16, 515850) Real understanding of the heart between them and us will not come by hiding facts.
('77', 266, 1, 17, 515933) That understanding means a voluntary abdication by Britain of the fourfold conquest of India.
('77', 266, 1, 18, 516027) Without that India cannot make to the world peace the special contribution for which she is specially fitted 2
('77', 266, 2, 19, 516138) SEGAON, January 28, 1940

('77', 268, 2, 5, 518660) CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY
('77', 268, 3, 6, 518681) Q. Your Constituent Assembly will be elected by a vast majority of illiterate and ignorant voters who would vote for one side or another because that side is led by persons who cry slogans palatable to them.
('77', 268, 3, 7, 518889) In such circumstances would not the decision of the Assembly be a farce, a tyranny of numbers ?
('77', 268, 3, 8, 518985) Why cannot you settle by a discussion in the Press, or on the platform or in a private conference ?
('77', 268, 4, 9, 519085) A. There is risk always in every big experiment, but in my opinion it is the least in the proposed method.
('77', 268, 4, 10, 519192) Underlying the proposal is the faith that the majority of candidates will be enligh tened and selfless workers.
('77', 268, 4, 11, 519304) In that case the elections will be concen trated political education on a stupendous scale.
('77', 268, 4, 12, 519396) There is no ques tion of tyranny of numbers.
('77', 268, 4, 13, 519441) There is undoubtedly the risk of ignorant voters being betrayed into a wrong choice.
('77', 268, 4, 14, 519526) Nevertheless the decision will be the verdict of the people.
('77', 268, 4, 15, 519587) Discussion in the Press and on the platform cannot replace the elective method.
('77', 268, 4, 16, 519667) The decision of a private conference will represent only those who compose it.
('77', 268, 4, 17, 519746) What is wanted is not necessarily a wise but a representative decision.
('77', 268, 4, 18, 519818) Today many societies claim to speak in the name of the masses.
('77', 268, 4, 19, 519881) When the Constituent Assembly comes into being, it will silence all voices and be the sole instrument voicing the opinion of the nation.
('77', 268, 4, 20, 520018) AM I A REFORMIST ?
('77', 268, 5, 21, 520037) Q. Is not Subhas Babu right when he ascribes to the High Command, including of course you, the reformist and the liberal tendency ?
('77', 268, 6, 22, 520169) A. Of course he is right.
('77', 268, 6, 23, 520195) Dadabhai was a great reformist.
('77', 268, 6, 24, 520227) Gokhale was a great liberal; and so was Pherozeshah Metha, the uncrowned king of the Bombay Presidency.
('77', 268, 6, 25, 520331) So too was Surendranath Banerjee.
('77', 268, 6, 26, 520365) They were in their days the nation’s tribunes.
('77', 268, 6, 27, 520412) We are their heirs.
('77', 268, 6, 28, 520432) We would not have been if they had not been.
('77', 268, 6, 29, 520477) What Subhas Babu in his impatience to go forward forgets is that it is possible for men like me to compete with him in the love of the land in spite of our having reformist and liberal tendencies.
('77', 268, 6, 30, 520674) But I have told him he has youth before him and he must have the dash of youth.
('77', 268, 6, 31, 520754) He is not held down by me or anybody else.
('77', 268, 6, 32, 520797) He is not the man to be so held.
('77', 268, 6, 33, 520830) It is his own prudence that holds him.
('77', 268, 6, 34, 520869) And in that way he is as much
('77', 269, 0, 1, 520899) 270 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 269, 1, 2, 520941) reformist and liberal as I am.
('77', 269, 1, 3, 520972) Only I with my age know it, and he in his youth is blind to the good that is in him.
('77', 269, 1, 4, 521057) Let my correspondents rest assured that, in spite of our different outlooks and in spite of the Congress ban on him, when he leads in non violent battle they will find me following him, as I shall find him following me, if I overtake him.
('77', 269, 1, 5, 521296) But I must live in the hope that we shall gain our common end without another fight.
('77', 269, 2, 6, 521381) UNIVERSAL CONSCRIPTION
('77', 269, 3, 7, 521404) Q. You say millions are unarmed and unused to wielding arms.
('77', 269, 3, 8, 521465) But what is the difficulty, when India is free, in training the whole nation in the use of arms by means of universal conscription ?
('77', 269, 4, 9, 521598) A. Of course in theory there is nothing to prevent the training by universal conscription.
('77', 269, 4, 10, 521689) Only I think that the people of this land would not take to arms easily even though conscription may be resorted to.
('77', 269, 4, 11, 521806) In any event arming of the millions, or even a few, is outside my province.
('77', 269, 4, 12, 521882) It is repugnant to me.
('77', 269, 4, 13, 521905) But what I would conscript is productive labour skilled and unskilled.
('77', 269, 4, 14, 521976) This, I hold, would be the easiest and the most effective method of organizing society on a peaceful footing.
('77', 269, 5, 15, 522086) INDEPENDENCE PLEDGE
('77', 269, 6, 16, 522106) Q. The Independence pledge regarding khadi and village industries has been variously interpreted.
('77', 269, 6, 17, 522204) What is one to do ?

('77', 269, 7, 21, 522464) A. The Independence pledge has been made optional this time.

('77', 270, 2, 10, 523907) SPINNING WHEEL AND INDEPENDENCE
('77', 270, 3, 11, 523939) Q. How do you connect the wheel with swaraj ?
('77', 270, 3, 12, 523985) We were producing our own khadi when we lost our freedom.
('77', 270, 4, 13, 524043) A. We did not then know the pricelessness of the charkha.
('77', 270, 4, 14, 524101) Now that we know it, we must restore it to its honoured place in our homes.

('77', 270, 4, 16, 524502) I verily believe that we cannot gain or retain our freedom by non violent means unless we realize the necessity and the dignity of reviving the charkha with all its implications.
('77', 270, 5, 17, 524681) LUSTING WITH THE EYE
('77', 270, 6, 18, 524702) Q. I am a poor man employed in a mill.
('77', 270, 6, 19, 524741) I am in a great fix.
('77', 270, 6, 20, 524762) Whenever I go out, the sight of a fair face overwhelms me.
('77', 270, 6, 21, 524821) I lose all self control.

('77', 270, 6, 23, 524915) I once thought of committing suicide.
('77', 270, 6, 24, 524953) But my good wife saved me.
('77', 270, 6, 25, 524980) She suggested that I should take her with me whenever I stirred out of the house.
('77', 270, 6, 26, 525062) The plan has worked but it is not always practicable.
('77', 270, 6, 27, 525116) In desperation I often think that I should pluck out my offending eyes.
('77', 270, 6, 28, 525188) But the consideration for my wife has deterred me.

('77', 271, 1, 2, 525885) the lewd literature, cinemas and lewd pictures that disfigure the Press.
('77', 271, 1, 3, 525958) Walk with your eyes fixed to the earth; and whilst you are doing so pray to the God within that He may cleanse.
('77', 271, 1, 4, 526070) your heart, and believe that He will deliver you form the curse.
('77', 271, 1, 5, 526135) If necessary, wear thickly smoked glasses.
('77', 271, 1, 6, 526178) You will find in them a first class external aid.
('77', 271, 1, 7, 526228) There is really nothing to admire in the big cities with their oppressive hugeness and congestion and the same noises, and the same faces day in and day out.
('77', 271, 1, 8, 526386) If we were not victims of the mighty force of inertia, our senses would sicken over the repetition of the same ugly phenomenon.
('77', 271, 1, 9, 526514) In the daytime bury yourself in the duty before you, and at night do a little bit of star gazing with the aid of a simple astronomical guide, and you have before your eyes a spectacle which no cinema in the world can provide; and, it may be, you will one day find God peeping through the myriads of stars, and if you attune yourself to the divine nightly manifestation, you will hear the soft and soothing music of the spheres.
('77', 271, 1, 10, 526942) Try this every night and your eyes will act right and your heart will be sound.
('77', 271, 1, 11, 527022) May God bless you.
('77', 271, 2, 12, 527041) UNCERTIFIED KHADI AND A. I. S. A
('77', 271, 3, 13, 527074) Q. I can quite understand your emphasis on the exclusive use of certified khadi.
('77', 271, 3, 14, 527155) But certified khadi is dear.
('77', 271, 3, 15, 527184) The result is that while on the one hand there are thousands of people who are too poor to purchase certified khadi, on the other there are thousands of spinners whom the A. I. S. A. cannot give employment on account of the standard wage.
('77', 271, 3, 16, 527423) Would it not be advisable under the circumstances to employ the surplus spinners on a lower wage, pool the standard wage and the non standard wage khadi, and thus at one stroke provide cheap khadi to the poor consumer and employment to the needy spinner ?
('77', 271, 4, 17, 527679) A. This is a good question.
('77', 271, 4, 18, 527707) The executive of the A. I. S. A. is wide awake.
('77', 271, 4, 19, 527755) Every effect of the arbitrary rise in the spinners’ wages is being watched.
('77', 271, 4, 20, 527831) The question of pooling has not escaped attention.
('77', 271, 4, 21, 527882) Every effort is being made to keep prices within reach of the buyers.
('77', 271, 4, 22, 527952) Selfish purveyors of uncertified khadi and the gullible or indifferent public are the greatest obstacle.
('77', 271, 4, 23, 528057) The A. I. S. A. has to cut its difficult way through these obstacles.
('77', 271, 5, 24, 528127) DELEGATE’S FEE AND THE CONGRESS

('77', 272, 2, 4, 528578) A. My ideal of democracy is quite sound.

('77', 272, 3, 14, 529295) WHAT ABOUT YOUR SON ?

('77', 281, 6, 9, 543137) 341. INTERVIEW TO HOLMES SMITH 1
('77', 281, 7, 10, 543170) [January 31, 1940] 2
('77', 281, 8, 11, 543191) [HOLMES SMITH :] I am now on my way to America where so far as it lies in our power we propose to start a twofold campaign by (1) opening the eyes of Missions against continuing an unholy alliance with imperialism (2) starting a movement to be organized by the friends of Indian freedom.
('77', 281, 8, 12, 543479) I want your reaction to this programme and, if you approve of it, your blessings.
('77', 281, 8, 13, 543561) [GANDHIJI :] My strong advice to you would be not to have Indians in your society.
('77', 281, 8, 14, 543644) You will seek information from them but not members.
('77', 281, 8, 15, 543697) Their entry would make you suspects.
('77', 281, 8, 16, 543734) I would like you to retain your spiritual and purely American character.
('77', 281, 8, 17, 543807) You are interested in our movement, I understand, because it is claimed to be strictly non violent.
('77', 281, 8, 18, 543907) The hands of those who have fought for freedom all over the world are dyed red.
('77', 281, 8, 19, 543987) But you, who claim to be Christians in a special sense because you insist on living according to the Sermon on the Mount, sympathize with us because of our unique claim.
('77', 281, 8, 20, 544157) And don’t expect or accept a single pice from India, even if you may have to beg and are reduced to the level of the three tailors of
('77', 281, 9, 21, 544291) 1 Reproduced from Mahadev Desai’s report “Rediscovering Religion”.
('77', 281, 9, 22, 544358) Holmes”.
('77', 281, 9, 23, 544367) Holmes Smith, the Acharya of the Lalbagh Ashram at Lucknow, and others had signed an open letter to the Viceroy challenging the missionary pledge of alliance with “the lawful authority of the country”.
('77', 281, 9, 24, 544569) In consequence Holmes Smith was asked by his Mission to resign.

('77', 282, 1, 2, 544730) Tooley Street 1. And now I must share with you what I told Mr. Keithahn 2 .
('77', 282, 1, 3, 544806) He, like you, has broken away from his Mission and chosen to work in the villages of India.
('77', 282, 1, 4, 544898) I told him that I want every true Christian to make his contribution to the cause of non violence.
('77', 282, 1, 5, 544997) Our movement has been non violent for 20 years or even 25, that is, ever since I returned to India and started work.
('77', 282, 1, 6, 545114) Congress minded India has been moving towards non violence.
('77', 282, 1, 7, 545174) And yet today I have to say that that non violence has been non violence not of the strong but of the weak.
('77', 282, 1, 8, 545282) But you are attracted to it in the belief that our non violence is of the strong.
('77', 282, 1, 9, 545364) therefore, you should study the movement through and through, criticize it, find flaws in it.
('77', 282, 1, 10, 545458) Thus I do not want you to spin unless you see an unbreakable connection between spinning or its equivalent and non violence.
('77', 282, 1, 11, 545583) It is likely that you will discover new methods of application or new argument, as Gregg 3 does, in support of mine.
('77', 282, 2, 12, 545700) Do you not mean economic non violence by the charkha ?
('77', 282, 2, 13, 545755) Not economic non violence, but I should say non violent econo mics.
('77', 282, 2, 14, 545823) The charkha and handicrafts occupy a special place in a non violent society, as centralized activities do in modern society constructed on militarism.
('77', 282, 2, 15, 545974) My hands are feeble today, because I have not a full hearted support for my conviction that India can retain her independence by non violent means.
('77', 282, 2, 16, 546122) So long as non violence is a purely political battle cry India cannot make a solid contribution to the peace of the world.
('77', 282, 2, 17, 546245) Independence cannot be retained if it is a gift of the British.
('77', 282, 2, 18, 546309) It can be retained when we have earned it and can retain it by our strength.
('77', 282, 2, 19, 546386) We have not that non violent strength, and we certainly have not the military strength.
('77', 282, 2, 20, 546474) And so though I am going to Delhi I am going with my eyes open and in fear and trembling.
('77', 282, 2, 21, 546564) But as I am practical I shall face the situation as it comes.
('77', 282, 2, 22, 546626) But you have to work non violence out independently and not merely because I swear by it.
('77', 282, 2, 23, 546716) I am but a sojourner on this earth for a few days—it may be for a few years, which does not really matter.
('77', 282, 2, 24, 546823) I can only repeat what I have been saying all these years.
('77', 282, 2, 25, 546882) And then I
('77', 282, 3, 26, 546893) 1 Who addressed a petition to the British Parliament describing themselves as “We, the people of England”

('77', 283, 1, 4, 547432) I mention Christians specially, because though there are individual Muslims who believe in non violence, there are many who do not regard it as a special message of the Koran.

('77', 286, 1, 2, 551644) 348. INTERVIEW TO ASSOCIATED PRESS 1
('77', 286, 2, 3, 551681) NAGPUR, February 3, 1940
('77', 286, 3, 4, 551706) Gandhiji was informed by the Associated Press that Mr. Jinnah was meeting the Viceroy on February 6. Asked if he would be meeting Mr. Jinnah, Gandhiji curtly replied he had not any enmity with Mr. Jinnah.
('77', 286, 3, 5, 551911) But when asked if he would meet Mr. Jinnah in connection with the discussion on the political situation, Gandhiji said that he did not know.
('77', 286, 4, 6, 552052) Replying to an inquiry if it was again going to be a farce of interviews, Gandhiji gravely remarked that he did not hope so but also could not say anything about whether there was going to be a settlement of the present impasse as a result of the Viceregal interview.
('77', 286, 4, 7, 552320) He added : Only God knows about that.
('77', 286, 5, 8, 552358) “Our hopes are centred in you,” said the inquirer, whereto Gandhiji retorted : Have hopes in God alone.
('77', 286, 6, 9, 552462) When told that on return from Delhi he should give them news of settlement or order for fight, he said they should be prepared for both.
('77', 286, 6, 10, 552599) Gandhiji told the Associated Press that if the interviews were finished early he would not wait in Delhi for attending the meeting of the Harijan Sevak Sangh as he wanted to return to Segaon at the earliest possible moment whereafter he would leave for Santiniketan to meet Poet Tagore.
('77', 286, 6, 11, 552886) When the talk turned on the next President of the Congress, Gandhiji said that under the circumstances Maulana Abul Kalam Azad was the best and hoped that his election would be unanimous.
('77', 286, 6, 12, 553074) The Hitavada, 4 2 1940

('77', 289, 7, 18, 557301) 355. GUJARATI SPELLING
('77', 289, 8, 19, 557324) The anarchy prevailing in Gujarati spelling is perhaps unparalleled in any other language.
('77', 289, 8, 20, 557415) It is not found in Marathi, Bengali, Tamil or Urdu.
('77', 289, 8, 21, 557467) I have not heard of it in any other Indian language.
('77', 289, 8, 22, 557520) It is to be found in no European language.
('77', 289, 8, 23, 557563) What epithet except barbarous can one apply to a people who speak a language with unorganized spelling ?
('77', 289, 8, 24, 557668) Man’s language develops as he progresses.
('77', 289, 8, 25, 557710) A man can be judged in several matters by the language he speaks.
('77', 289, 8, 26, 557776) It hardly takes any time to gauge the wisdom of a person writing such expressions as hag, mar, tapar.
('77', 289, 9, 27, 557878) 1 Rani Vidyavati of Hardoi 2 Addressee’s son 3 The first two expression, as they are, mean ‘defecate’ and ‘die’; the third one is obscure.The correct spellings should be heeng (asafoetida), mari (pepper) and toprun (coconut kernel)

('77', 291, 1, 2, 560095) 356. QUESTION BOX
('77', 291, 2, 3, 560113) RELIGION AND POLITICS
('77', 291, 3, 4, 560135) Q. In your autobiography you have said that you cannot think of politics apart from religion.
('77', 291, 3, 5, 560229) Do you still hold that view ?
('77', 291, 3, 6, 560259) If so, how is it that in a country of many diverse religions like you expect a common political policy to be adopted ?
('77', 291, 4, 7, 560378) A. Yes, I still hold the view that I cannot conceive politics as divorced from religion.
('77', 291, 4, 8, 560467) Indeed, religion should pervade every one of our actions.
('77', 291, 4, 9, 560525) Here religion does not mean sectarianism.
('77', 291, 4, 10, 560567) It means a belief in ordered moral government of the universe.
('77', 291, 4, 11, 560630) It is out less real because it is unseen.
('77', 291, 4, 12, 560672) This religion transcends Hinduism, Islam.
('77', 291, 4, 13, 560714) Christianity, etc.
('77', 291, 4, 14, 560733) It does not supersede them.
('77', 291, 4, 15, 560761) It harmonizes them and gives them reality.
('77', 291, 5, 16, 560804) Q. Is it true that you advised some Sikhs, who came to seek your advice on certain matters, that Guru Govind Singh taught the use of the sword while you stood for non violence, and therefore the Sikhs must be ready to choose the one or the other ?
('77', 291, 6, 17, 561052) A. The question is badly, if not mischievously, put.
('77', 291, 6, 18, 561105) What I did say was that, if they thought the teaching of Guru Govind Singh excluded implicit belief in non violence, they could not be consistent Congressmen so long as the Congress creed remained what it was.
('77', 291, 6, 19, 561315) I added that they would be compromising themselves if they joined or remained in the Congress and might even damage their own cause.
('77', 291, 6, 20, 561448) NON VIOLENCE, ISLAM AND SIKHISM
('77', 291, 7, 21, 561480) Q. By teaching respect for all religions you want to undermine the power of Islam.
('77', 291, 7, 22, 561563) You want to emasculate the Pathans by taking away the rifle from them.
('77', 291, 7, 23, 561634) There can be no meeting ground between us and you.
('77', 291, 8, 24, 561685) A. I do not know what you thought during the Khilafat days.
('77', 291, 8, 25, 561745) Let me give you a bit of the history of our own times.
('77', 291, 8, 26, 561800) The foundation of the Khilafat struggle was laid by me.
('77', 291, 8, 27, 561856) I had a hand in the agitation for the release of the Ali Brothers.
('77', 291, 8, 28, 561923) So when they came out, they, together with Khwaja Abdul Majid, Shuaib Qureshi and Moazam Ali, and I met together and devised the plan of action which the world knows.
('77', 291, 8, 29, 562090) I discussed with them the implications of non violence and told them that, if they could not accept non violence as true Muslims,
('77', 292, 0, 1, 562220) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 293
('77', 292, 1, 2, 562269) I should be out of the picture.
('77', 292, 1, 3, 562301) Their reason was satisfied, but they said they could not act without endorsement from Muslim divines, and so there was a conference of the ulemas at the late Principal Rudra’s 1
('77', 292, 2, 4, 562479) house where I used to stay, when in Delhi, during his lifetime.
('77', 292, 2, 5, 562543) This learned company included, among several others, Maulana Abul Kalam Azad and the late Maulana Abdul Bari.
('77', 292, 2, 6, 562653) Led by Maulana Abul Kalam Azad they held that belief in non violence was not only not inconsistent with Islam, but it was obligatory in the sense that Islam had always preferred it to violence.
('77', 292, 2, 7, 562847) It is noteworthy that this took place before the acceptance of non violence by the Congress in 1920. Many were the discourses given by learned Muslims on non violence before crowded Muslim meetings.
('77', 292, 2, 8, 563046) The Sikhs too came in later without any scruples and they listened with rapt attention to my exposition of non violence.
('77', 292, 2, 9, 563167) Those were great and glorious days.
('77', 292, 2, 10, 563203) Non violence proved infectious.
('77', 292, 2, 11, 563235) Under its spell there was a mass awakening such as had never been seen before in this land.
('77', 292, 2, 12, 563327) All communities felt as one, and they thought that non violence had clothed them with an irresistible power.
('77', 292, 2, 13, 563436) Those halcyon days are gone and now I am obliged seriously to answer questions like the above.
('77', 292, 2, 14, 563531) I cannot give you the faith in non violence you do not possess.
('77', 292, 2, 15, 563595) God alone can give it to you.
('77', 292, 2, 16, 563625) Mine remains unshaken.
('77', 292, 2, 17, 563648) I do maintain, in spite of you and others like you suspecting my motives, that mutual respect for one another’s religions is inherent in a peaceful society.
('77', 292, 2, 18, 563805) Free impact of ideas is impossible on any other condition.
('77', 292, 2, 19, 563864) Religions are meant to tame our savage nature, not to let it loose.
('77', 292, 2, 20, 563932) God is only one though He has countless names.
('77', 292, 2, 21, 563979) Don’t you expect me to respect your faith ?
('77', 292, 2, 22, 564023) If you do, may I not expect the same respect from you for mine ?
('77', 292, 2, 23, 564088) You say Muslims have nothing in common with Hindus.
('77', 292, 2, 24, 564140) In spite of your separatism, the world is moving towards universal brotherhood when mankind will be one nation.
('77', 292, 2, 25, 564252) Neither you nor I can stop the march towards our common destiny.
('77', 292, 2, 26, 564317) As for the emasculation of Pathans, let Badshah Khan answer.
('77', 292, 2, 27, 564378) He had accepted non violence before we met.
('77', 292, 2, 28, 564422) He believes that the Pathan has no future save through non violence.
('77', 292, 2, 29, 564491) Without it, if nothing else, his blood feuds will keep him from going forward.
('77', 292, 2, 30, 564570) And he thinks that the Pathan found his feet in the Frontier Province after he accepted non violence and became servant of God— Khudai Khidmatgar.
('77', 292, 3, 31, 564717) 1 Sushil Kumar Rudra, Principal, St. Stephens College, Delhi
('77', 293, 0, 1, 564778) 294 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('77', 293, 1, 2, 564820) MORE CALUMNY
('77', 293, 2, 3, 564833) Q. You did not hesitate to join the Ali Brothers in their intrigue to invite Amanulla Khan to invade India and set up Muslim Raj.
('77', 293, 2, 4, 564963) You drafted a wire for Maulana Mahomed Ali Advising the then Amir not to enter into a treaty with the British.
('77', 293, 2, 5, 565074) The late Swami Shraddhanandji is reported to have seen the draft.
('77', 293, 2, 6, 565140) And now you want the Hindus of Sindh to make a present of their hearths and homes to their Mussalman oppressors instead of demanding the re amalgamation of Sindh with the Bombay Province, which alone can restore the reign of law to Sindh.
('77', 293, 2, 7, 565379) Why won’t you realize that in this age of enlightenment and progress what the minorities expect is effective protection of their due rights, not mere pious counsels of perfection ?
('77', 293, 3, 8, 565560) A. I have several such letters.
('77', 293, 3, 9, 565592) Hitherto I have ignored them.
('77', 293, 3, 10, 565622) But now I see that the news has gone through a revised and enlarged edition in the Hindu Mahasabha.
('77', 293, 3, 11, 565722) An angry correspondent threatens that persons like him will begin to believe what has been stated so authoritatively.
('77', 293, 3, 12, 565840) For the sake of my reputation, therefore, I must answer the question.
('77', 293, 3, 13, 565910) But my correspondents should know that life for me would be a burden if I were to make it a point of controverting every report about me or distortion of my writing.
('77', 293, 3, 14, 566076) A reputation that requires such a mud wall of protection is not worth keeping.
('77', 293, 3, 15, 566155) So far as the charge of my intriguing with the Amir is concerned, I can say that there is no truth whatsoever in it.
('77', 293, 3, 16, 566272) Further, I know that the Brothers stoutly denied the charge when it was brought to their notice.
('77', 293, 3, 17, 566369) And I believed them implicitly.
('77', 293, 3, 18, 566401) I do not remember having drafted any telegram on behalf of Maulana Mahomed Ali to the then Amir.
('77', 293, 3, 19, 566498) The alleged telegram is harmless in itself and does not warrant the deduction drawn from it.
('77', 293, 3, 20, 566591) The late Swamiji never referred the matter to me for confirmation.
('77', 293, 3, 21, 566658) It is wrong to say anything against dead men unless one has positive proof and stating it is relevant.
('77', 293, 3, 22, 566761) The romance has been woven round my writings in Young India.
('77', 293, 3, 23, 566822) Deductions drawn from them are wholly unjustified.
('77', 293, 3, 24, 566873) I would not be guilty of inviting any power to invade India for the purpose of expelling the English.
('77', 293, 3, 25, 566975) For one thing, it would be contrary to my creed of non violence.
('77', 293, 3, 26, 567040) For another, I have too great a respect for English bravery and arms to think that an invasion of India can be successful without a strong combination of different powers.
('77', 293, 3, 27, 567212) In any case, I have no desire to substitute British Rule with any other foreign rule.
('77', 293, 3, 28, 567298) I want unadulterated Home Rule, however inferior in quality it may be.
('77', 293, 3, 29, 567369) My position remains today what it was when I wrote the Young India paragraphs now sought to be used against me.
('77', 293, 3, 30, 567481) Let me further remind
('77', 294, 0, 1, 567503) VOL. 77 : 16 OCTOBER, 1939 22 FEBRUARY, 1940 295
('77', 294, 1, 2, 567552) the readers that I do not believe in secret methods.
('77', 294, 1, 3, 567605) As for Sindh my advice stands.
('77', 294, 1, 4, 567636) Reincorporation of Sindh in the Bombay Province may or may not be a good proposition on other grounds, but certainly it is not for the purpose of greater protection of life and property.
('77', 294, 1, 5, 567823) Every Indian, be he Hindu or any other, must learn the art of protecting himself.
('77', 294, 1, 6, 567905) It is the condition of real democracy.
('77', 294, 1, 7, 567944) The State has a duty.
('77', 294, 1, 8, 567966) But no State can protect those who will not share with it the duty of protecting themselves.
